text: Yeh went here with the Mrs a couple of times on visits to Vegas,full of designer names won't go too deep with the description.I can say we had to pay an excess baggage fee on our return journey,and were twitching like drug smugglers, as we went through customs at Heathrow.

Update: The SDX goes straight here. Before you had to take the Deuce then make a transfer. It's easy to come here now. Other than that not much change. It's outdoors so you will either feel hot or cold. A good place to check out.

Extended hours for holiday shopping ...even sweeter with 60-80% off at my favorite stores ! Max Studio offering 25% off on top of marked down red tags, Polo is doing 50% off entire store, WHBM 50% off entire store, and Kate Spade 60% off entire store !!! More at other stores ..these discounts are valid thru next week (end on NY Eve according to most of these stores )....then when u all done head to gelato cafe and meet the cute French cashier (owner ??) and enjoy a nice cup of java!

Happy New Year everyone!!!I spent 5 wonderful days in Las Vegas wth my family and friends. On the way back we decided to stop at this place for some last minute shopping. I want all of you consumers to be aware of the Asian man who sells the charger cords for the iPhones. He has them hanging freely and charges by the set. The chargers will last about 8 hrs and that's about it. He charged me 10bucks for two. I believe I purchased them Tuesday and they've already gone out. The mall is patronized by tourist so it's not like you can go back and demand a regular...???!. Also they could upgrade this outlet. It smells and most of their stuff is outdated. It's not compelling at all. I'm going to take my own advice and pass this place up like I've been doing
This a nice outdoor shopping mall with 130 stores! The only thing I didn't like was shopping in the rain, other than that, this is one of my favorite place in Vegas.

The reason I liked it here was as a larger woman they had discount clothes that fit me. This is often a frustration at Bicester for me. I'm apparently too fat for some designers to want me to be seen in their clothes.


 I got my favourite sunglasses here - leopard print!


 If you are in Las Vegas for awhile and have a car, this is a great place to go. It's about $20 by cab from the strip though.

This is one of my Favorite places to shop beside the Mall. 150 designer and name-brand Shop around. But its an out door. The time to shop is Monday - Saturday 10am - 9pm and Sunday 10am - 8pm.

Every time my family is from out of town this is where I mainly take them. 
THE LAS VEGAS PREMIUM OUTLETS.

Sometime this outlet has great prices and sometime it dosen't . Just like every Outlets.

The store I mainly hit up are: J Crew, 2Bebe, Juicy, Coach (sometime if Hubby lets me. lol), AX Armani Exchange, O.C.C. (thats a make-up store), Nike because my hubby, Guess, Lacoste, Michael Kors, and Marciano. 

Other than that... There are many other store like Banana Republic, Levis, Perry Ellis (I think that a little over rated store), Gap, Jewerly store, Marc Ecko, Dolce & Gabbana, Dooney & Bourke, Ed Hardy, Elie Tahari, Kenneth Cole, Polo Ralph Lauren, Salvatore Ferragamo, St. John, Theory, Timberland, Tommy Hilfiger and many more. 

Oh and of crouse there is a food court and for who ever LOVE coffee and need to wake up ... "Starbucks Coffee" YAY!!! LoL

Wow. What a selection at the Adidas store at the factory outlet mall in Las Vegas. they have everything from sneakers too short to shirts Etc. I picked up some nice sandals couple of pairs of shorts in a couple of nice t-shirts for dirt cheap. highly recommend the Adidas store in the factory Premium Mall.
Big outlet. They've got a Fox store. And a decent food court too.

When ever I come to Vegas, I always end up coming here. I love the stores they have here and it seems like they keep adding better and better stores. They also have a coupon book for discounts if you have a AAA card. You can pick one up at the information desk and show them your card. If you do not have a card, I think you can purchase one for $5 or $10. My favorite stores are Puma, Armani, Marc Ecko, and Colombia. If you get hungry, they have an excellent sushi buffet there.

not to bad.. didn't buy much here. but a pair of 50 dollar last year model nikes.. i bought a reg price hat at o neils... and a slushie.. need more sales and bargain@!!! the cosmetic store was a laugh.. only a slight discount on lancome makeup.. and the rest was perfume.. lame...

I have to say as far as outlet malls are concerned the North Premium Outlet in Las Vegas is definitely one of the best. The customer service alone is worth the trip over. It's easy to stay on "the strip" as a tourist. But I am glad I ventured off a bit to check out the outlet.

I would advise anyone coming to the outlet to get there a little early. It is definitely one of the busier outlets that I've seen. It is also an outdoor seating so getting out before the temperature heats up would be ideal.

One of the main perks of the mall is definitely the wide range of stores that are located within the facility. They range from the Gap, Carters, Nike, Hot Topic, Levi, Movado, Kate Spade, Burberry, Ferragamo, etc. So really something for everyone. And the discounts were amazing at almost every store from around 40% to 75% off.

So all in all definitely a must stop if you want to do any shopping while in Las Vegas while avoiding overpriced stores.

I love shopping here! The variety is great-however, the ability to get in and out is difficult. The parking is atrocious!! The pricing is fair, but keep in mind these are outlets, and most of the items are made for outlet and are not something you would find in the regular stores.

One of the newer outlet malls. Used to go to the one on the Luxor end but have been going to this one more often. Shops for the most part are the same with some stores here instead of there. Getting here & parking can be a bit more "fun". It is an outside mall so it can get hot, especially durIng the warmer months. So when I'm in LV, I make sure to stop by here.

Es un gran lugar para comprar primeras marcas a menor precio, PERO no todas las marcas bajan el precio regular demasiado así que hay que estar atento. Es tranquilo y al aire libre, lo que hace que la experiencia de comprar sea menos estresante. Muy recomendable!

This mall is gross. Security always harassing people trying to park. Parking is a nightmare, hundreds of spaces roped off not accessible. Parking garage is a worse traffic nightmare than the highway during rush hour. They block employees from parking so they can't get to work. It seems the management of this mall discriminates and provides a hostile environment.

I have been to many different outlets in United States. Every time when I go to an outlets, I'll ask for the coupon book first. This guy in the information desk said I have to pay $10 for it, which is a totally surprise for me (who's being a VIP for seven years). So I asked what if I am a VIP, he said I can print it out online for free. I have no choice but purchased this coupon book. Then many other customers coming in, and I saw the guy asked one of them show their VIP on their cell phone. So many people one by one, get the coupon book for free, so I get online, and asked this guy a refund for the coupon book since I did nothing wrong. NO REFUND!!! and the guy said he can give me another coupon book for FREE!!! who needs two coupon books?WHO? WORST experience!

I love shopping here ... it's much better than paying full price at the stores!  They have a great selection of stores from the moderate to pricier spectrum, and are opening up more soon (hello Kate Spade and Aldo shoes!).  You can also sign up online to be a VIP, and then get extra coupons that way. Who needs to shop at the Forum Shops anyway?
iv'e been comming here for a long time it's always fun the things i don't like  is that you can't get a haircut and there is no book stores  but i always get good deals on clothes.

I read lots of reviews before boing to this outdoors mall. I am really not a fan of outdoors shopping, especially when the place is this big and you can't just take an elevator to the next floor where the shop you are looking for is location. However, since so many people wrote great things about this place, I decided to take the plunge and go shopping there with a friend. We wanted to go to 7 far all mankind. It's our bad that we parked the car near a popular brand store which was on the opposite side of where banana republic is. An this is why I don't like outdoor shopping! We had to go through the whole outlet to get to the stores we wanted check out. The good thing is that that there are a loto of place you can sit down and relax for a big, which is quite necessary on hot days. We also grabbed a coffee at starbucks, which was nice. But what really disappointed me was the huge line in kate spade and the not so good deals at the most shops we went in to. It is true we didn't go during sales season but I expected better deals on most of times. Will I visit again! Probably I will.
Good deals, make sure to check in and get free passport offer. Love shopping here every Vegas trips.

They had a HUGE sign outside about buying one pair and get the other pair (valued the same or more) at 50% off. So I bought some shoes I normally do. The boring black work shoe that's the same as the Doc Martin's. Apparently they changed their position that this shoe is now a "work boot" and does not qualify for the sale. Ok awesome.

I am not a huge fan of outlet malls as normally they are geared towards tourists and rarely do they have deals.

But this outdoor mall was recommended to us by a couple of local LV residents.  The day was warm and gorgeous so we said what the heck.

Tons of shops, all the big names and tons of deals.  My friend ended up buying quite a few things on sale, me not so much.  I just didn't need anything badly this time so I just mainly browsed.  I did buy some cute souvenirs from an outdoor stand but that's about it.

This mall has mostly clothing and perfume stores at good prices, not enough food or knick knacky things.
 
Very clean premises, modern construction, well kept.  Definitely a must for tourists.

I would come back if I needed some brand names at a deal, but probably not otherwise.  Time to see what other shopping areas Vegas has.

If you are a non-smoker or have children, do not even bother coming here.  This mall goes out of its way to ensure all smokers are well taken care of.  Walking between stores you will be engulfed in second hand smoke your entire shopping experience.  The most disgusting experience ever.

SO much cheaper than UK prices! Calvin Klein is a favourite of mine and I managed to get some Uggs for £80!!


 Some shops are a bit rubbish and the food court isn't great, but it's not too far from the strip and it's air conditioned.

I went here during the summer.  The parking situation is terrible, not enough spaces for the amount of cars here.  It took 10 minutes to find a parking spot.  The food court is small and crowded, not enough selection of different foods.  The shops here are great, with alot to choose from for men and women.  The discounts in the stores are closer to 20% off the retail prices in the malls, not 50% to 75% from what I've heard.  The misters really help in the Las Vegas heat.

Der Outlet wird sicherlich niemals einen Schönheitswettbewerb gewinnen aber
Wer
 Las Vegas besucht oder dort Urlaub macht, sollte einen Abstecher dahin 
wagen. 
Auch mit dem Taxi ist der Preis von knapp 16EUR (22$) pro Fahrt noch zu 
verschmerzen. 
10min. Fahrt vom MGM Grand Ich war zur Haloween Zeit 
dort und hatte in fast allen Geschäften Sale Aktionen (Buy1 get1 for free oder 3for2 usw.)
Einen Tag dafür planen und Spaß haben beim shoppen.
Teilweise liegen die Preise über den anderen Outlets in den USA. Man merkt also dass es eine ziemliche Touristen Mall ist.

Quiet amazing since this is the place where I finally FINALLY found a leather dress shoe that wasn't made in China.  This was a years-long effort to find a replacement to my worn Dockers dress shoe.  I was wiling to pay reasonable prices so while the Nordstroms of the world have shoes to my liking, they were well into the triple digits in price just because they weren't made in China.

I stepped into the Johnston & Murphy store just beaten from the heat and about to lose all hope, when I found THE shoe.  For $70 I walked out of there with a fantastically designed leather shoe made in Italy.  It was the proudest shopping moment of my recent life because I found a bargain AND stuck to my principles.

The gap here is my favorite one. They always have sales. Sometimes I find shirts for my toddler for less than $5. And they're really good quality. I've washed them numerous of times and they're still not faded.
Best mall in all of Las Vegas. Great variety of stores and awesome prices, be sure to arrive early morning to find parking.

Horrible service.  No greeting from the get go.  I was interested in a top that was hanging on a higher clothing face out. I grabbed one of the hanger sticks to get it down...still no one to assist or acknowledge me even there.  When I got the top down, someone finally came up to me and said "ask next time"... I was so disgusted by her manner, I lost all interest in what I was looking at and walked out. Horrible badly trained associates who lose money for their business. I'm sure that's the norm, and I won't be returning.

The same as the south but further from my hotel (Cosmo) and outside in vegas heat. If you have time for only 1 Go south.

It has air conditioning.

If bargains are what you are after, head to this outlet centre to the north of the strip, in the direction of The Stratosphere Hotel. We had a car, so not sure if the bus goes here.


 Got some fantastic bargains from Armani Exchange, Guess and Ralph Lauren. Loads more besides. You should probably look at buying another bag to take it all home!

I was excited to finally go shopping and I've heard that the North outlets were perfect for high-end stores at low prices. Although, when I got there, it's still pretty pricey for an outlet. I think the best deal there was Kate Spade. 50% off select purses and all wallets, some purses had an addition 20% along with the 50% already. Sadly, I didn't snatch the deal because I desperately needed new wardrobe more than new bags. 
I was surprised at the amount of shoe outlets they had, but still no good deals. The clothing outlets were okay, just the same old merchandise every time.
I'm giving this place 3 stars because it's just too much. You can easily get lost, especially with the construction going on. I kinda missed when the outlet was smaller..

We were in town for the M.A.G.I.C show and we decided to do some shopping during our stay. I must say this mall is pretty big.. I didn't get to visit all the stores I wanted to, I was short on time..but during my visit here I did enjoy some of the stores i did come across. This outlet mall is pretty great, they have Joe's Jeans, Bare Escentuals, Nike Factory, Burberry, Juicy, Volcom, Hurley, just to name a few.. in a couple of stores their selections were nice.. compared to other outlet stores I've seen.. great prices.. it's a nice outdoor mall, its even nicer if you come out on a sunny day..it felt great to just hang around.. I can't wait to go back so I can do more shopping.

Everyone seems to rave about this place but to be honest I didn't see the appeal. Some things are cheap but I wouldn't say its any different to Cheshire Oaks in North West England - and certainly not half as big.


 Free parking though so worth a wander round

Im Las Vegas Outlet North bin ich schon öfters zu günstigen Preisen fündig geworden. Kürzlich habe ich wieder sehr schöne GUESS-Handtaschen für meine Töchter gefunden. Die jungen Damen schwärmen für GUESS, meiner Frau könnte ich damit natürlich nicht damit. Das PREMIUM habe ich oben weggelassen, weil es wie bereits verschiedene Vorredner angemerkt haben, eher irreführend ist. Aber für das breite Volk, das nicht nur Anzüge von BRIONI und Kostüme von CHANEL trägt, bietet es schon das eine oder andere Schnäppchen.

this outlet is so huge that you need to have a day to spend here :) been to other factory outlet in other state but this is where you can get the lowest price... I nrought my friend from Singapore and she was so amazed of how cheap the bags and clothes are  she did a pretty good shopping here in Vegas
Ein Muss!!!

huge shopping center with absolutley anything you could want! there literally is every type of shop in there all at good prices!


 take a map though cause the place is soooooo big
Far too many people and long lines both for counters and and fitting rooms. Try find other Premium Outlets for example near Los Angeles.

Awesome outlet center with plenty of higher end stores for you to spend your fresh Vegas winnings!  Selection is great and they're always updating the outlets to expand and upgrade.  Highly recommended if you're looking for a quick get away to spend some change.

Las Vegas ist sehr gut geeignet für das Shoppen :). Sehr viele Malls mit günstigen Angeboten. Die Vegas Premium Outlet ist schnell mit dem Auto erreicht, bietet genügend Parkplätze und die üblichen Outlet Shops in einer Mall in den USA (GAP, Nike, Levis, ...)

Parking was bad, way to far away!
The Prices were not cheap, it was to expensive. Don't waste your time.
I have been to a lot of outlets, but this was more a showroom than a outlet.
The Nike store had bad reductions to demonstrate it:
Nike Roshe orig Price 75.00$, outlet price 74.99$, it's not cheap....
Other clothes were also very overpriced.
Don't go, if you want to buy something for a good price.

I'll start by saying I loved the stores at this outlet, they had good prices and lots of variety of stores..kind of something for everyone.

Why I gave it 2 stars though? Because I absolutely hated the Kiosk's they have there..they almost assault you trying to get you to "try this"  and "try that". And when you decline to have your hair done by some sleazy South American guy  with a hot hair wand they become hostile; and I mean that in every sense of the word; hostile. They become not only rude but down right mean..

It was so bad that we wanted to do another day at this outlet but after recounting the awful Kiosk people, we decided to go somewhere else.
El paraiso de las compras, todo barato y buenas marcas.

Wir waren im Premium Outlet North - in der Nähe vom Stratosphere. Spontan - bitte nicht lachen! - kam mir das Ganze ähnlich vor wie Zweibrücken; vor allem der schrottige Lauren Factory Outlet. Wie andere Qyper schon bemerkten: nicht zu vergleichen mit anderen Outlets in den USA in denen es wesentlich gediegener bei niedrigeren Preisen zugeht. Es war unser zweiter Besuch hier - den Outlet South hatten wir auch schon probiert. Sicher kann man den einen oder anderen Schnapp machen - aber wenn man gezielt nach hochwertigen Artikeln zu günstigen Preisen sucht (nicht nur die retournierte Ware vom letzten Jahr...), dann haben wir uns hier nicht richtig gefühlt. Unsere persönliche Empfehlung: Concorde Mills Mall in Charlotte in North Carolina. Hier haben wir schon viele Male absolut gut eingekauft.

If you're going to ride the RTC bus, I would just catch a cab from the strip in the morning. The connecting bus will not start until 9 AM. The stores open at 8 AM.
I would also print out the map, or download one on my phone, and circle shops I would want to get to.  The design is pretty simple, but it may take awhile to figure out which way is north. 
We went to lunch around 11 to avoid the crowd, great idea. if not, we would have waited until about 2. 
It was over 100 degrees when we went in June. Bring a water. Better yet, go to Vegas in the winter.

Wir waren unter vielen Anderen auch in diesem Outletcenter und es hat die typischen Läden, welche man auch in den anderen Outletcentern findet. Die Preise sind natürlich toll, die Läden sind gut klimatisiert und shoppen hier schlaucht etwas mit der Zeit denn bei uns war es kalt, heiß und die im ständigen wechsel. Aber es lohnst sich hier vorbei zu schauen.

Große Outlet Mall mit prima Angeboten. Die Mall besteht aus zwei Teilen. Wer günstig einkaufen will, für den ist dieses Einkaufscenter ein Muss. Nicht jeder Laden hat gute Angebote, aber die meisten. Für Import nach Deutschland aber Rechnung für Zoll aufheben, sonst wird nach Originalpreis gerechnet.

I've been many outlets in CA but this place is in my top 5!
First of all, they have l'occitane outlet!!! Usually, I go the store and see their skincare products and just go. I can't buy because of the price!!!
but this place, maybe you can find something affordable!
I enjoyed Cosmetic Company Outlet,too!
they have stila,clinique,mac,bobbi brown and estee...it's luckey if you can find something, because they have only limited selection and color.

After a brief stay in Vegas, we decided to head on over to 4-star rated Premium Outlets. Oh my, oh my, oh my. 

Tips:

1. I implore you to get there before noon to shop or be prepared for carmageddon in the parking structure. 

2. The VIP coupon book available for purchase at the information booth: don't get it. It's really not worth your money considering you're NOT allowed to combine the sales within the coupon book with the deals already occurring in the store. And chances are, the ones in the store are better anyway. Unless you're planning on dropping hundreds for a Kate Spade handbag to get a 15% deal, not worth your $5. You can preview it if you'd like though.

3. If you manage to get there early with fewer people, the crazy packed stores include Polo Ralph Lauren and Banana Republic. The line for Banana was insanely long so I'd suggest you hit that store first if it's one of the stores on your list. 

Otherwise, this outlet was huge! We didn't even shop all of it because our feet were so dang tired already. The only downside to this outlet would be like sometimes it doesn't seem like an outlet at all because the prices are still the same for some stores. It was a hit or a miss, but even during this after Christmas setting, there were more misses than hits. 

4 stars for variety, aesthetics, and the fact that I got Nikes for $60 here and boots for only $20.

DAS ist ein Outlet!
Hier ist zwar die Hölle los, gefüht die Hälfte aller Shopping-Victims sind Deutsche. Aber: Hier gibt es wirklich alles, und die Ware wird so schnell nachgefüllt, wie sie über die Ladentheke wandert.
Die Preise sind die gleichen wie in den meisten Outlets, die Anzahl der Shops sowie die erstklassige Erreichbarkeit sind die großen Pluspunkte.
Natürlich mach Shopping in den goßen Malls am Strip mehr Freude, aber um den leeren Koffer bis zum Platzen zu füllen, ist man hier genau richtig!
Love coming here!  So many stores, all varieties.  Some places have great deals, others don't seem like an "outlet."  Always stop here when I'm in Vegas to check out what the good deals are!!

Formidable ...galerie a ciel ouvert . Des tarifs exceptionnels ....surtout sur les marques americaines..janvier periode de soldes... des remises de 30 ou 50 % sur des tarifs deja tres interessants. A vos valises!!!

Parking is hazardous to your health. I would suggest going on the weekday but even then parking can still be a pain in the rear. Its worth it once you do land a spot because they have just about all kinds of stores high end to regular outlet stores such as GAP and quicksilver to Burberry and Coach. Great selection of things and I assure you will not leave empty handed!

Excellnt shopping centre. Large range of designer shops such as ralph lauren, hugo boss, burberry, nike, french connection, juicey cotureand at a whole lot cheaper than in the UK. It is also cheaper than other desiger shops in vegas. would recommend to shop here. has a food court to eat at if you get hungry!!
Everything was great!! Except the customer service guy threw a discount coupon book on me just because i shown him my AAA card to get free coupon book. What a bad day for me!!
The information centre is a bit difficult to find but once there staff were helpful. Make sure to visit it pick up the coupon booklet before hitting the shops for additional discounts

C'est là que ma petite soeur s'est fait percer les oreilles. Toute une cérémonie, il a fallu que mes parents signent plein de papiers déchargeant la responsabilité du magasin au cas où ses lobes se transformeraient en chou-fleur. Elle y a prononcé cette phrase désormais célèbre dans la famille : J'ai cinq ans, je suis à Las Vegas, c'est le moment où jamais de me faire percer les oreilles !
Photo link: http://assets0.qypecdn.net/uploads/photos/0095/3533/056_56_gallery.JPG?27640
Il y a aussi dans le hall plein de petits manèges qu'on a tous essayés . 
On a acheté sur un stand au milieu de la galerie un produit-miracle pour nettoyer les lunettes et les bijoux HA-LLU-CI-NANT ! Je n'ai jamais retrouvé mieux , je retournerai à Las Vegas rien que pour ça !
P-S : Mes parents y ont aussi trouvé des valises canon à un prix dérisoire, mon sac à dos pour le collège vient aussi de là-bas et ça en jette quand même plus qu'un vulgaire eastpack comme tout le monde.Et un dernier petit mot pour les crocks, ces chaussures si moches et si confortables dont toute la famille s'est équipée. Quand on est revenus en France, elles n'étaient pas encore in et on a mesuré le fossé entre l'american way of life et la fashion attitud politiquement correcte dans le regard dédaigneux du tolérant peuple français.En tout cas, c'est ce que ma mère nous a dit pour qu'on continue à les porter malgré les sarcasmes.Moi je les garde pour la maison, mais elle, qui n'a peur de rien,et un hallux valgus, continue à se balader avec.
Photo link: http://assets0.qypecdn.net/uploads/photos/0095/3535/064_64_gallery.JPG?27640

I love this mall. I took a $18 cab ride on Superbowl Sunday from my hotel on the strip to this mall. I really loved the Burberry  store. Wow! Huge! The Tory Burch had a nice shoe selection. I was shocked to see a Stuart Weitzman store. The selection was okay. The Michael Kors wasn't bad. The Nike store had a great selection of womens running shoes. I just wish I had gone here first instead of The Palazzo or Forum. Def a must see if you like to shop and really nice to walk around since the weather was nice. This mall is outside so go on a nice day.
Great shopping center and I found what I needed on a very good price.

Everything here is great,  from fashion items to services. All the stores I've been to the customer service has been great. Friendly service with a smile is awesome where ever you can find them. I even hear there's even a plan for a brand new parking area. If they could upgrade the food court then it would be awesome.

What a great place to spend a morning! I say morning because by afternoon, it gets pretty hot, since it's not shaded at all. Great variety of stores, loved Dolce & Gabbana, Kate Spade, Elie Tahari, Juicy, Salvatore Ferragamo, Lucky and Miss Sixty. The customer service at the Kate Spade Outlet deserves a special shout-out, way WAY  above what you normally find in an outlet setting. Burberry was a mess, merchandise all over the damn place, hard to find anything and prices were about the same as at the non-outlet location. Bleh. If it's an outlet, at least let me feel like I'm saving A LITTLE BIT OF MONEY, right?! I'm just grateful I didn't have my little princesses with me or I would have left a lot more money there! 
Not a bad cab ride from the strip, but a good thing happened when we were in the cab line waiting to leave; a limo driver, clearly thinking on his feet, gathered several of us going to the same hotel and took us back for less than the cab ride! Score! A much more comfortable ride! 
The one and only downfall was that I couldn't find any place that served alcohol!  I was just short of devastated, then I spotted the Dairy Queen.  Obviously not the same, but a smoothie really helped keep me going. I just enjoy shopping ever so much more with a cocktail in my hand! Now before you start thinking "wow, Liz, you're such a drunk", remember, I was on vacation, okay?!
I highly recommend this place for some less pricey shopping than you find on the strip.

Loved this place. When I went there it was on average about 109. Really hot, but it was the best time ever. Great stores and friendly service. I really enjoyed going here and I can't wait to go again.

Très bonne adresse pour se jeter sur les grandes marques comme Calvin Klein, Hugo Boss, Tommy Hilfiger etc.
Tout est à plus ou moins 50% par rapport aux prix français, sans compter le taux de change du dollar, très favorable par moments.
Attention aux tailles ! Le XL américain c'est du XXL chez nous et il vaut mieux essayer tout avant d'acheter (on peut, le personnel est super aimable).


 Il est fortement conseiller de s'arrêter ici avant de quitter Vegas, si déjà on s'est laissé tenter par ce lieu de perdition !

This outlet has more than 180 shops for you to choose from.  You'll find something for everyone.  Please be sure to go to the Management Office and check in with Yelp.  You can get a FREE savings passport ($10 value) for additional discounts.  Also, if you have a Mastercard, please be sure to ask for the Mastercard Priceless Las Vegas Offers Guide.  It may have more discounts than the savings passport.  The outlet is in between the strip and downtown LV.  It's open M-Sat from 9 to 9 and Sunday from 9-8.  Shop till you drop!
mostly a tourist attraction place not really a place where youd find the things youd want

Didn't live up to the hype.  Sure you have lots of brand name and designer shops here, but the prices weren't  any better than you could find online, or during a standard sale at your favorite store.    

Parking was also a nightmare, and the food court was lacking.

The visit here was a total waste of time for us.
One of the spots I regularly visit every time I go to Vegas. Decent priced, clean and well spaced out. It gets crowded but I've never felt overwhelmed there.

This mall was nice as a regular mall even if it wasn't full of outlet stores.  Outdoor pedestrian malls always seem nicer than the indoor malls so this was a nice change for outlet shopping.
The store selection is varied and many higher end companies had stores here that aren't usually encountered at the more common Mills based malls.
Even if you aren't shopping, this is an interesting place to come visit and just sit outside and people watch. It's a good break from the strip and the timeless casinos.
Had a good time there. Had lots of my favorite stores but too much and too hot to do in one day.  Enjoy and take the Vegas Strip bus to get a tour of the city and save some money getting there.

Das Labelangebot ist sehr umfangreich, das Sortiment ist allerdings kleiner als z.B. in den Outlets in der Nähe von New York City oder denen im Süden von L.A.


 Etwas nervig waren die zahlreichen Stände außerhalb der Geschäfte wo man wie auf einer Messe alle 5m angesprochen wird ob man z.B. eine elektronische Zigarette testen möchte und sie dann am besten für 150$ auch gleich kaufen soll.


 Die Food Corner sind super. Großes Angebot z.B. China Max, Subway und Co. Auf der gegenüberliegenden Seite der Outletwelt, quer über den Parkplatz ist ein super Smootie Laden. Der Name war irgendwas mit "Tropicana". Sehr gut!
Nice stores! I love Calvin Klein and ASIC store. It's outdoor mall so bring your water bottle to cool down.

The TUMI store here provides the BEST service one can ever receive. The male assistant is very attentive to details, thoroughly explains the features of each product very well- exceeded my expectations. Fabulous! I was very impressed.
Love the Hanes store there, I get all my undies there. The prices are good and they always have sales. I'm a loyal customer as long they are open.

It's an outlet in the desert....what can I say It was hot....there is a parking structure next to the stores and it was packed did not have to wait to long for a spot.  Bring water and your walking shoes.

Shopping is my cardio!!!

I love to shop and when I'm in town to visit my brother and his girlfriend. I always make a point to stop at this outlet. 

They have more selection on the designers that I love and the deals are always there no matter what time of the year I'm there. My husband and I travel to LV at least 3 times a year. 

It does get hot during the summer as we all know which is the downfall of the outlet being out doors, but that never stops me from shopping here, just go right when they open :)

Why do I love coming to Vegas?  

1) Gambling
2) FOOD
3) OUTLET Shopping!!!

Vegas Premium Outlets has the best outlet stores in the area.  It's not so huge where you feel overwhelmed with all of the ground you have to cover, but they do have a good variety of stores.  This is the best place to shop around, especially if you're looking for some great deals!  And it's only about 10 minutes from the strip, in downtown Vegas.

As a local I was not impressed with this place at all. I felt the prices were outrageous and the mall itself was way too hot for the middle of summer...I didn't notice any misters on when I was there over the summer. Also parking was an absolute nightmare...hubby and I went here around 2pm in the middle of the week and the garage was filled...took us 10 minutes to find a parking spot...never again

Parking.  So the garage says 90 spaces open. Yet the "guard" there just leans back on his post and watches cars leave without letting anyone in.  I ask if we can go in. He says " no, all full"  Doesn't move. Doesn't look. Doesn't make for a great first impression.

Parking is impossible. They should Pay you to wait for a parking spot. The Mall management must be nuts! They tore down a parking lot to add more store, when one can't park Now! News flash: outlet sale items are crap, not the same quality as an item found in Dillard's or Macy's. The junk is made just for the outlet.  No sit down restaurant. Stick to the sales at a real shopping center.
Good place for shopping. A large number of stores but hard to park!
Always find a good bargain.  The food court is nice too. Enjoy coming here to enjoy shopping and sunshine when i visit Las Vegas.

This is a must for the shopaholics that visit Las Vegas! This set of outlets boasts stores for every budget. I appreciate the range of brands carried by this place. You can find deals from your favorite mall stops to rare high-end outlet versions of brands like Juicy Couture or Stewart Weitzman. My favorite place to shop here is the French Connection store.

Don't get your hopes up too soon though, some of the stores don't offer discounted prices. Which makes me wonder why they are even at the outlet. But thankfully, these stores are rare. One other negative: parking can be a real chore.

Another tip: Holiday weekends boast really awesome sales (I mustered enough courage to brave the midnight madness sale on black friday), but be aware that you will need a lot of time and patience to deal with the large traffic of tourists and locals alike.

I wish you happy shopping!

I love these outlets, it is nice but I wish it is enclosed because the elements can be brutal. FCUK, BR, Coach, Dolce, A/X and other outlets that are more higher end are located here. Too bad it lacked a lot of my sizes so I left a little disappointed.

The baby & I did our share during Black Friday to help stimulate the economy at this eye-popping paradise for bargain-hunting shopaholics.  Conveniently located less than 10 mins. away from The Strip, we arrived there before 9AM & took advantage of the extra discounts which, unfortunately, don't apply to all stores.  BONUS BARGAIN:  Try to get a hold of on-line coupons that you can present at the information desk to receive coupon books for added discounts.  Example:  Baby got a 20 percent discount at Lucky Brand Jeans.  Good quality stores like Bass, Coach, Ann Taylor & about 150 more.  From now on, we need not travel all the way to Primm, NV to go outlet shopping.

Visiting here reminded me why after spending high school and some college years working at an outlet center, I don't go to outlet centers. That being said, I do like the set up of this one. Nice looking storefronts and doesn't have a million stores all lined up waiting for your money. The outlet center on the south end of the strip is like a horror house of stores jumping out at you all at once. 

Great store choices, most very high end. As expected the stores that people can actually AFFORD are mobbed. See: Forever 21. The Coach store is spacious so there's less of chance your eyeballs will be scratched out for coming too close to someone's prized purse find. LESS of a chance. 

Parking is decent, big garages on both sides of the center. The food court is...a food court. Hope you like ear shattering noise as you eat. Keep in mind if it's 80 degrees in Vegas hoofing around this center will make it feel like 90. And if it's 90? You won't see me here. Know what else you won't see much of? Locals. It is tourist central...I would imagine you could hold some very successful foreign language immersion programs in one of the courtyards. But hey, it's an outlet center, all the negatives I mentioned you knew you were in for!

Was dem einen Freud ist des anderen Leid. So empfinde ich es hier als sehr angenehm, dass diese Outlettmall, ausser die einzelnen Shops, nicht überdacht ist und man zwischen den einzelnen Shops im Freien wandeln kann.


 Sehr angenehm dagegen, dass hier anstelle eines großen Parkplatzes zwei Parkhäuser vorhanden sind. Somit stehen die Fahrzeuge überdacht und im Schatten.


 Die einzelnen Marken die ich hier vermisse, finden sich dann im Las Vegas Outlet Center (http://www.qype.com/place/1827323-Las-Vegas-Outlet-Center-Las-Vegas) am Las Vegas Blvd. südlich des Flughafens.
At 10:30am on a Sunday I got a parking spot no problem. The deals really are good.

The stores had decent inventory, not the kind that are so outdated that no one wants to buy them, which is usually the case at outlets.  They just opened the Burberry and Juicy Couture stores, and the Coach store wasn't bad compared to my last experience.  After Christmas the store was at max. capacity that it felt like New Year's Eve on the strip.  Some sales lady had to carry a sign around so people would know where the end of the cashier line was.   My favorite was Banana Repub., everything was 40% off during 4th of July weekend :)

Ein sehr großes und recht neues Factory-Outlet in Norden von LV.


 Hier gibt es Shops wirklich aller interessanten Marken und meist fantastische Angebote, vor allem wenn man europäische Preis gewohnt ist.


 Etwas ungünstig ist, dass das Outlet sozusagen open air ist - was bei den dortigen Temperaturen etwas anstrengend ist. Wir hatten Gott sei dank nur 32°, somit war es auszuhalten.


 Der Service ist anscheinend manchmal etwas genervt von den Touristenscharen.

This is like one of my homes. I go there atleast 3-4 times a week. Not really what you think of for an outlet mall. It's outdoors in the desert. Very hot during the summer, extremely cold during the winter.
They always got sales but they aren't cheap enough for an outlet. Fyi, the seasonal/holiday sales of most stores are the same sales they have on regular days as well. So doesn't really matter.
They have pretty decent stores that i always go to: Juicy Couture, Lacoste, Kenneth Cole, Steve Madden, Aldo, etc.
Parking garage is always full, so make sure to go there earlier of the day! This place is always busy...this place is most visited by tourists than the other outlet (South). Make sure to eat somewhere else before you get there, they sell overpriced food on the food court, which are not good enough to priced that much! Bottled waters cost over $2!
Coach was having a sale this day. More than 50 percent off. Got my mom a great bag and purse.

Franchement ce serait très dommage de ne pas profiter des brumisateurs et des outlets en allant à Las Vegas.


 Supers affaires à faire et choix de boutiques important 150 pour celui-ci qui est plus tourné vers les marques que nous connaissons et portons :)


 pêle même : french conection, gap, D&G, Missoni, American Apparel, Banana Republic, Converse

I have yet to not spend money here.  They have very high end, low end, and everything in the middle shops.  I have the shops I always hit and the wife always hits her own shops.  If I'm doing well in the casino, I will try to splurge and get a nice gift for her.  Trust me, there are plenty of spots that she will love.

I usually frequent the spots that I can't find near LA like AG Jeans or True Religion Outlets.  Can't beat the prices and I don't need the latest styles.  Perfect for outlets.

If splurging for the wife, I hit Kate Spade or Burberry or Coach.  I can usually find something to buy.  She on the other hand doesn't like to splurge so she hits places like Banana or Ann Taylor.  Good deals all around.

Our latest trend has been shopping for baby clothes since we had a little one recently.  Carter's, Osh Kosh, Gymboree, and Children's Place are the spots to shop.  Seriously, they grow out of their clothes so fast, outlet shopping is perfect for them.  Brand new car smell without the brand new car prices.  You should shop these spots twice a year minimum to load up on the next size gear. (OMG their feet grow so fast...)

Like everybody else, if you're there for a leisurely shopping trip, go in the morning or evening.  It's hot and no cover available.  Going from 100 degree weather to A/C climate stores can't be good for you.  I don't know who they are trying to fool with those misters all over the place.  Those don't help unless you plant your face in front of one of them and hope that there's a breeze right after.

BUT, if you are a serious shopper and know what you want, go for the day trip.  Get there, hit your stores, and get out.  OR if you like the heat, hey, more power to you.  

Another thing, if it rains, again, no cover except for certain areas.  Outdoor malls are nice but not suitable for such extreme weather.

Buy buy buy.  The stateline stores suck except for William Sonoma and the Barstow shops are just a joke now, so stock up here while you still have money!

If You want discounts on stores you've been to in other malls. The premium outlets is your best bet. I come here mostly for Puma jackets, children clothes at the children's place, and savings at charlotte. I'm Not into the outdoor thing and some store are too far from one another.

This pertains to the valet service at the outlet mall location. My car was broken into this past week. I was not informed about it until I went to go retrieve my vehicle. There were 15 thefts this past week in this outlet. That day my car got broken into there were 3 in the valet. The valet parking had my phone number and did not call me to inform me of the brake in. Also, I went to call the company  AmeriPark valet. Their numbers are not working. So shoppers be careful where you park and don't assume that your in valet that your vehicle and belongs are safe.
Poor service.. Walked in and the gurl n front turn around so she wouldn't greet.. WTF.. This place require no star

Love these outlets, great selection and prices, not the normal last season stuff you find at other outlets. The stores selection is great, lacoste, D&G, Stuart Weisman, at an outlet mall thats awesome. Always end up buying several items from here.

I have only been to these outlets twice: once when I was a tourist and twice recently. It's still a nice place and has the type of stores that I would shop at. I like the layout and prefer this one to the South Premium Outlets although I have been there more often. I think the south one is where more of the locals go. You'll see mainly tourists at the northern one. So far, the customer service at the stores have been great. I'll have to visit this one more often.

SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much better than the outlet stores on the opposite end of the strip.

This outlet has outlet I have never seen before.  I have never seen an outlet for Ralph Lauren Children.  The prices were AMAZING for Polo clothes.  More than half off retail and everything is an additional 40% off THE LOWEST sticker price.  Even the clearance items.  I got my daughter a purple Ralph Lauren light weight zip up coat for $8.  I couldn't believe it.  I got her some dresses to for about the same price, maybe slightly cheaper.  They do have items that are more expensive but they are still a lot cheaper than buying them at Macys (even when they are on clearance).

Their Nike store is amazing.  We had went to the other outlet Nike store and bought a BUNCH of stuff.  When we entered this store, all the items we had already bought were CHEAPER here!!!  

Next time we are in town, this is the ONLY outlet I will be going to.

I love malls, parking here sucks. Tried to get valet but I guess during the summer valet fills up real quick. The summer heat kept me in the stores more and made me walk into stores I wouldn't walk into because I was trying to run from the oven outside. Tons of stores and good prices!

There's no way I can complete a trip to Vegas without stopping by here at least once during my stay. My aunt had told me that their high end stores had moved to their own area in this mall. That and plus the fact that it was my birthday gave me an even bigger reason to go. So glad I did! Being from the Bay Area, I love taking advantage of anywhere that has lower sales tax. The Coach store is my favorite. Normally I just get one item from there when I visit, but this time I managed to walk out with a leather wristlet and purse, each for under $100. What made it an even better experience is that I got handed a coupon for an extra 10% off as soon as I stepped in. Scoooooore! Happy birthday to me!

Ich war besonders von dem Nike-Shop angetan !!! Besser wäre aber NIKEHALLE  Irre Auswahl und Preise die jeden Schuh interressant machen. Man bekommt schon fur 25 Dollar echt coole Schuhe . Als wir nach zwei Stunden fertig mit probieren waren, zahlte ich für 4 Paar nigel nagel neue Nike gerade 170 US DOLLAR !!! Wer in Vegas ist und gern shoppen geht  Pflichttermin
Szilvia at Hugo Boss is amazing. I rarely have seen sales person so friendly and enthusiastic. She did great and thus got a big sale. Thanks a lot!

Take an Uber here immediately!

We were trying to kill time before out flight and the Mirage slots were not being kind to us so we headed here. I've found that it's completely more economical to pay $20 for a Hurley hoodie than to feed it to the machines... weird how that works.

The inventory offers items that you'd actually wear, not asymmetrical, sub-par, standard store rejects, these are things that are still in season, just heavily discounted. 

The bathroom facilities were clean and even though it was a very busy day, I didn't have to wait in line at all. There is also a food court so you don't have to gnaw your arm off for the fear of missing out on a good deal somewhere. 

There are some great brand name stores such as L'Occitane, Kate Spade, 7 for all mankind, Furla, timberland, guess, and more. I don't think I've even scratched the surface of what this outlet mall has to offer. We'll definitely have to return next time for a special shopping trip!
Worst parking situation in the entire state of Nevada. We will never return after 45 minutes of driving around and not one single spot. Don't waste your time - just go to a place with a parking lot.

Love these outlets. They always have great sales going on. Best sale was Kate Spade. They had bags already lowered to a very low price plus still 70% off. I got a $325 bag for only $84 and an iPhone 7 plus case from $45 to $18. I always find great sales when I go to Las Vegas and especially at three outlets. If you go early in the morning before 12pm there are no crowds.

These outlets are better than the south premium outlet mall. It's outdoors so keep that in mind for summer, but the shops are higher end than the south outlet mall. There is Burberry, dolce and gabbana, Kate spade etc. Food options isn't that great but there is a Cheesecake Factory. 

By comparison, the south outlet (trust me I go there all the time cos I live nearby) also has nicer shops but aren't as high end. There is a coach, Michael kors but you can find all that and more in the north outlet anyway. The plus side is the south outlet is indoors (a little cramped and dark though in my opinion) and has more food options around the area. Both have great sales going on all the time. 

Either way I'd choose the north outlet if you want a nicer experience and the south outlet if you don't care if it's a little dingier and just want to shop.

I'm not a big shopper, but whenever I'm in Las Vegas with friend looking to shop I come here.
Parking can be quite a hassle on the weekends so listen to some good music and be patient.
There are plenty of stores from Reebok to Coach for all types of shoppers, even a Ed Hardy store...

I'm glad I don't live in LV or I would be in debtttt majorly! I love this outlet.. I live in Washington and we have the same outlet but the prices/products are NOT the same!

I came here on the weekday  which thankfully, it wasn't super busy and swarming with people! The coach store is awesome, it's huge and has amazingggg deals! I got a super cute big leather tote for $120 or so... I had to seriously refrain myself from buying too much stuff in this store!

7 for all mankind. I probably spent close to a hour in here because their jeans were about $50 each. The shoes were on sale too but unfortunately, they didn't have my size. My bf bought a belt for $13 (originally $109). He seriously had to refrain himself from buying too many jeans! I couldn't believe how good the sale was in this store, as well!

I can't truly remember any other stores... Juicy was okay, the store was pretty enormous but the prices weren't that great. 

Overall, I would recommend this store and I definitely will shop here again if I visit LV.

I seriously save all my Christmas shopping until I can get to this outlet!  They have great stores and offer awesome discounts!  I love the layout and parking.  I do wish there were better food choices in the food court.  I am not a fan of the random places to eat.  Overall, great place to shop!

Great prices here. I went to Pac Sun and got a couple of jeans for around $20 my sister snagged a pair for $10!

The Forever 21 here is closing, moved to the Strip I guess.

Hollister, American Eagle, Sunglass Hat, Juicy Couture, Nike, Addidas, the list goes on...

This could be heaven on earth, but it's not quite there. You can definetly find some good deals here, but any amazing deals are harder to come by. I recommend going early in the day, and check their website before going for any extra deals going on. They also have free coupon books for MasterCard holders.

I didn't really find alot compared to the time spent here. The best stores were Nike, Brooks Brothers and Ralph Lauren. Some of the stores felt a little bit meh, especially compared to the brands usual stores. Ended up having to leave Kate Spade before I could try a dress, because they only had one dressing room and it was obviously a very popular store. 

I would definetly come back the next time, but without all the wandering around, so definetly have a plan before you go!

These are pretty good outlets.  There's a large range of stores for if you want to spend some money to if you WANT TO SPEND SOME MONEY!!!

Most of the stores have decent deals and some of the stores have amazing deals.  

There's Nike, Adidas for those sporting days.  Diesel, 7 For All Mankind and True Religion for those hanging out days.  Burberry, Dolce and Gabana and Hugo Boss for those nights you want to go out.  Of course there are a lot more stores and more than just clothing stores.

There is a hot dog place in here that you should try the pretzel dog.  It's pretty damn delicious!
Had  VIP coupon book thumbs up to Kate Spade store they honor the coupon even after extra 40% off but coupon not work at Michael Kors  store

Avoid this mall at all costs right now. They are undergoing construction with only one entrance and one exit and we should have known when first going in to park that it was going to be hell getting out. And no one here seems to care that hundreds of cars are stuck in a parking garage standstill traffic jam wasting precious time in Vegas. Took us over an hour to get out of the parking lot and caused us to miss the rest of our plans in Vegas afterwards. Prices aren't that cheap either - better prices in Los Angeles.

Great outlet here in Vegas! Much more stores than the other one.  It's an outdoor outlet so be prepared to be in the super HOT sun during the summer time.  Eeek!!! At least they have the water mist thingy on during this time.  It's a nice mall.  Great for walking.  You have everything from The Disney Store, Armani, Coach (my fav ^_^), Zales, Sketchers, a lot of surf brand shops like Quiksilver, Rip Curl & Billabong.  A whole lot to mention.  The only thing I don't like about this outlet is their food court.  Not that many selections & it ain't all that great either.  To me anyway.  Restrooms are hard to find other that the one in the food court.  It's always a busy mall because it's a tourist attraction as well.  So if you're in Vegas, don't forget to stop by here! You won't regret it.

Not a bad outlet, but not my favorite either. We had some time to kill, and that's all this ended up being: a time-sink. Parking is difficult to find, especially during peak hours. I don't see a whole lot of variety in the stores, and there wasn't a lot that appealed to me. I've seen better outlets.

We were in town for work and decided to take some time to hit up the outlets! Saw on Yelp that this one was more popular and took a taxi over there since it isn't that far from the strip. This outlet has most of the popular brand name stores and there were tons of awesome deals! I ended up buying more than I intended :x

Beware!!  There is a kiosk near the Michael Kors Store that sells t-shirts.   I asked the price of a novelty tee.  Sales rep responded:  "Starts at $20".  I agreed, when he added iron-on to cheap $4 Gildan t-shirt, the price went to $54!!   I said "No Way!", and the sales girl chased me down causing a scene that I needed to pay for it..   It's a scam, poor customer service.

I was really looking forward to stopping here before taking off back home to Cali but it was just ok. The sales weren't all that great and the only place that was worth going to was Coach but honestly Coach is just so played out I left empty handed. Went to Michael Kors expecting to come out with at least something but they were almost close to the original price. Same with the CCO was looking forward to picking up some Mac cosmetics but the makeup wasn't anything too appealing. What a waste of time never coming here again!!!!!

One thing I've recently noticed is how polarizing the local malls are.

Meadows: Reasonably priced and accessible, but rather average and is slowly but surely losing the allure it once had.
Boulevard: Good selection in the stores that are available, but it seems like every other time I visit another store has closed or is going out of business and it has pretty much COMPLETELY lost it's allure.
Fashion Show: Great, diverse range of stores, but uppity and filled with too. many. TOURISTS.
Forum Shops: Accessible for a mall of it's kind, but gimmicky.
Grand Canal Shoppes/Palazzo: Very nice, but overtly-gimmicky and borderline inaccessible. 
Miracle Mile: Has a sense of fun to it, but trying too hard to be edgy.
Crystals: Looks pretty, but is mostly filled with a bunch of stuff we've already seen before. 
Outlet Center: Great deals, but kind of stale, if that makes sense.
Galleria: Seems appealing, but way too far from me to begin with so why bother?

The Premium Outlets is pretty much the only local mall which has no serious drawback to speak of in my opinion. True, it's outdoor, which will be a bitch in the summer months but it's a price I'm more than willing to pay. It's essentially a combination of all the pros of each of the malls I've already listed with none of the cons that make me groan in the back of my mind as I walk through the halls of each one.

Protip: The deals are very good, but remember to be careful. Pay very close attention as some of the stores are either priced exactly the same (or in some cases, actually charge MORE) because they believe that since it's an outlet mall it MUST be discounted, right? And it works, judging from the patrons I've seen in the stores who are guilty of this and seem to be completely blind to the fact that they're not getting a very good deal at all. 

The mall itself is a very interesting environment. It really reminds me of San Diego. The layout IS confusing but there are several courts, each of which with a large anchor outlet store and a marker of some sort, keep that in mind and you'll get the hang of it.

Came to this outlet while vacationing with my husband. We stopped by the customer service desk right away to pick up my discount card (with tripe AAA) for additional discounts for the majority of stores here. 

I like this outlet over the South outlet because there are more stores (well only 10 more though) and the place just seems bigger overall. One thing I wished was that it wasn't outdoors (well especially during cold or rainy weather). There are also plenty of shops here for me to browse through and spend my money at.

Plenty of parking as well at this location, will come back here again next time I'm in town.

Outlets located within 5mi. from the strip where you can buy at moderate prices, I shopped at the nike, kenneth cole, baby gap, stores could of shopped more but it was just too hot, its an open outlet mall.

This place has some really rare outlet stores...at least coming from Atlanta they're rare to me. Diesel, Dolce&Gabbana, and American Apparel to name a few. GO NOW if you want to find some of the most ridiculous sales you'll ever see. Every store, and I mean every store, had a minimum 50% sale going. Unfortunately for me, I couldn't find a whole lot that I either liked/fit me.

Definitely worth a visit when in the city. About 10 minutes north of the strip. Easy to find and parking is free.

This outlet is good. It might not be the biggest outlet I have been to but the stores lineup is excellent. 7 For All Mankind, Armani Exchange, Guess by Marciano, Juicy Couture, Kate Spade and Diesel all in one place! 

My only complaint - it is an outdoor mall and the scotching dessert sun could be rather annoying. 

Unlike other outlets, this mall is located not too far from downtown. It is a short taxi ride from the center of the strip.

We went to the Premium outlets on an extremely hot Vegas day and we did not realize that this center was outside so we didn't go through every store like we normally would. We had our eyes on certain stores and visited them only because it was just so hot. There are misters everywhere and lots of seatings throughout, but it is still hot out there! Parking is in the structure, but it could be hard to find so just keep looking at the ceiling for the green lights to park!

This place charges non-Nevada residents $5 for parking now.  This is just another tax grab, IMO.  Why impose this burden on shoppers?  Why not just take it from the businesses?  While I know that $5 is not a large sum, I just hate it when a business nickels and dimes its customers.  No more coming to this outlet for me.

This is a great outlet mall with all of the high end outlet stores. A few of my favorite are Michael Kors, Coach, Tory Burch, Juicy, and so many more. It is so large though that you can get lost. We walked around in circles a few times today trying to find the Coach store, lol. Not very good when it's 105 degrees outside. That's the only downside. It is an outside mall so it's hard to handle in the hot summer days. They do have misters that feel pretty good and cool you off for a second. 

The food court is pretty lousy as well. Not a whole lot of choices and seating is minimum. Every time I go there we have to wait for someone to get up. 

Overall a great mall with an awesome selection of outlet stores. It's better to go in the nice spring days though rather than the hot summer.

Hmm $10 coupon book? I thought Woodbury NY (also operated by Simon) offers $5 coupon book... Is it trying to rip off uninitiated tourists? I could've sold my coupon book (free via a Yelp check in) to a tourist for $5... 
I went on a Tuesday PM to kill time before my evening flight. 60% of visitors were Chinese tourists. 
Maybe it's because it was a weekday, but not much was on sale. For example, the Nike store had 6-pack socks for 25% off of $20. I could swear that my Nike outlet in NY sells it for ~$10 before discounts. 
I think it has become a tourist trap because tourists felt the urge to spend tons of $, which leads to stores jacking up prices/limiting discounts.
great mall, stores with wonderful discounts

Tory Burch Outlet...

that makes it worth the trip.  Lots of other stores for those not interested in that brand.  The parking is kind of tight and usually pretty packed.  There are two PEV charging stations if you have that type of vehicle, however I have never been able to get them to work with my card.

Richtig gut. Richtig, richtig gut! Schnäppchenjäger und Shoppingqueens dürften sich hier wohl fühlen: 30-70% reduzierte Preise und eine überraschend gute Auswahl an Marken. Besser geht´s kaum!

Neben den üblichen Verdächtigen wie Sunglass Hut, Adidas, Nike und Levis, gibt es auch Fashion Brands wie Diesel, Aldo, Vince, Burberry und, und, und. Ich habe es in zweieinhalb Stunden nicht mal durch die Hälfte der Läden geschafft und hatte bereits so viele Tüten, dass ich kaum mehr hätte tragen können. Zu meinen Trophäen gehören unter anderem schwarze Lack-Nike Air Max, ein Burberry Mantel, eine Seidenbluse, eine Miu Miu Sonnenbrille und eine perfekt sitzende Camouflage Röhrenjeans von Lucky Brand. Diese musste leider wenige Tage später, bei meinem Unfall zerschnitten werden... Ich trauere immer noch!

Tipp: Am Eingang kann man für 5$ ein Discount-Heft kaufen. Damit gibt´s in vielen Läden noch mal extra Prozente obendrauf. Das lohnt sich!

I love Shopping and this is the place to go! you find good bargains all the time. I can spend hours in just one store. I find that the items here are very new usually compared to the other outlets i've been to. You find things that you find in regular retail stores all the time.

I like this mall. I got a really good deal at Neiman Marcus. I never imagined I could afford anything from that store but I got a nice top for a good price. Go early or finding parking may be tough. Would be better if it was indoors but hey, the outlet malls in Minnesota are outdoor and people still shop in the winter so who am I to complain.

Good outlet stores.  I am not sure the prices reflected outlet.   A lot of foreign travelers however thought it was a gem.  Beware that it can be hot outside walking.   Also food court is small and not great choices.

Came here and lets just say they aren't any different than the other outlet store around besides the fact that they really aren't much cheaper than the regular stores on the strip or elsewhere as we found out.   And some of the layouts in the stores was juat to crazy to deal with especially in shoe stores, juat a heads up if you do go here get here when it first opens up aftrr 12 it's gets packed and crazy

I normally don't like shopping it's exhausting especially outlets cause it's huge and outside and bleeeh. However! This is a must stop when in Vegas now I don't know what's in the South side outlets but everyone said don't go I said alright and it's fine every store that I wanted to visit was in the North side! From Nike to Adidas and a Lulu Lemon that's right Lulu Lemon!! It's huge so wear comfy shoes. And lots of money because you'll always end up finding something I did... and a little too much on my most recent trip
This is the best outlet mall in Vegas. Similar to the Cabazon outlets in CA.

THIS PLACE IS THE DEVIL.

Omg, I love it. The selection of stores is beautiful - Burberry, Cole Haan, and Kate Spade in one place?! YES PLEASE!

I can't speak for the parking issue because we took a cab there and back. No need to worry about parking that way!

We got there when they opened on Sunday for two reasons - we wanted to avoid as many crowds as possible, and we didn't want it to be blazing freaking hot.

We only spent a couple of hours there - we had specific stores we wanted to go to. I ended up with a new Kate Spade purse and wallet, and a new Cole Haan purse and wristlet, for under $330. I'd say I did pretty well.

I would give this place No stars. Do not go eat at the food court at the mall. It is disgusting and they have birds and insects that fly all around in the food court. There is bird poop on the tables and the janitors don't clean it up! Please stay away from this place. They allow birds and animals to live inside the food court!

My wife loved this! I understand people complaining about it not being that cheap when you compare it to other outlet malls but for tourists it IS cheap. esp. when you compare it to european stores or some of the flagship stores around the US. We did shopping at Adidas, ecko unltd, hot topic, nike and some more stores, all with a great selection of goods (only exception here was nike, where we found absolutely nothing) and helpfull staff.

Coming here once was enough. Would have rated this 3.5, but I'll give it a 4.

If you want to take a break from the strip and ride the WAX or SDX somewhere safe to do some shopping, then this place is it.

This outdoor complex is very nice and clean, and a lot of the employees there are quite friendly. The coupon book, however, isn't impressive since they require you to spend a lot in order to get a discount. 

You'll definitely find at least one store to check out and see what they have on sale. They also have a Starbucks there as well, which accepts gift cards.

Cheers!

This place is okay if you're a tourist, but I'm not. The parking sucks on the weekend. Stay away if you live here. They have some good shops but I'm not a big fan of crowd. The food court sucks, need more restaurants or fast food place there. I wouldn't go back. Why go there when you can enjoy the coolness of the South Premium (indoor) Outlet. There are way more places to eat there and better shops.

4.5 stars

LOTS OF SALES!! I've been here twice in the last two times I've been in Las Vegas! Absolutely love how the tax rate is lower than the one in California. So many stores to go into and it'll probably take a whole day if I didn't restrain myself and reminded myself that I'm not here in Vegas solely to shop! Definitely go early for better things!

Great place. Perfect for the ladies after a buffet or large meal. I found some great deals such as Lucky Jeans for 20 bucks a piece. Coach purses for an average of 150. Aerosole shoes for around 30. This is a true outlet mall. My wife and I spent 600 here and we prolly saved about the same. I highly recommend.

one of the nicest outlets in Las Vegas.  pretty good deals, except it was 110 degrees outside.  some of those mister don't even reach you, then again I'm only 5'2 1/4, yes i had to factor that in lol.  i went to leather store, my leather jacket was originally $150, i got it for $42, what a deal!!  expect to wait in line for some Starbucks approx 30-45mins, bummer.  o yea, so i lost my shoes in the whole room transfer deal, so i bought a pair of converse for $20, it made my day!! :)   definitely check out this place if you don't mind walking in the sun LOL.

Every time we visited Vegas, we ended up here every freaking time for whatever reasons, and we ended up turning the trip into a shopping spree here.  I actually started shopping here when the parking garage did not even exist many years ago.  It was amazing to see them adding a new section and built two parking garage, and expanded one of them lately.  Despite the parking nightmare, they added these ceiling lights telling you if a parking is available, so you do not end up circling on one floor forever in busy parking lot traffic.  They have bus route from the strip to here if you wish to save the pain.

If you walkthrough this place and did not end up buying one thing, then you really suck at shopping.  Something will always get you...  Whether it was Nike for shoes, clothes from Gaps to the Armani, purses from Coach, wallets, kids' stuff from Carters or Disney store, other designer brand stores, or maybe just Starbuck in the food court area and they accept Starbuck gift cards.

The Vegas North Premium Outlet is definitely one of my favorite places to spend those gambling wins.  Often enough, I found the same item cost a lot less here if they were sold in the same store on Strip.

Decent outlet mall with mostly higher-end options. Location is under construction so some businesses are closed and parts of the parking lot are a bit of a disaster, recommend using the garage.

Despite the brand-name stores (Coach, Michael Kors, Kate Spade, Ann Taylor, etc), the mall itself is on the run-down side and not in the best area of town, either. Expect to run into a lot of foreign shoppers who are nearly rabid and salivating over the sale prices, with no courtesy- cutting you off, snatching up things you're looking at, etc. If you don't want to deal with that, maybe go elsewhere.

Lots of sales here, being that it's an outlet but definitely make sure you're getting a good deal before buying- many of the locations have minimal markdowns, while others have 20 on top of 50% deals regularly. Just shop wisely and make sure to inspect condition of items before purchase, many places have small-print all-sales-final policies.

This place is pretty decent and is a big area which I like. But one thing I don't like is that it feels incomplete for as big as it is. It does not have a forever 21 which sucks. I like that it has an accessible food court with a wide selection. It also has bose store which was helpful when looking for speakers as many malls and outlets don't have this store. In the summer I wish there was more mist because it gets very hot. And likewise for the winter as they need more heaters since it can get freezing sometimes. It's worth stopping by though if you are looking for good deals.

Freakin great outlet mall.  This is my 3rd visit, the last one being a few years ago where there were fewer stores.   I say forget Barstow and maximize your precious shopping time here.  I scored at the Crocs outlet for the first time.  (see my other review for Crocs outlet) 
I usually hit Brooks Brothers, Banana and Ann Taylor for work clothes.  Hey, you can always validate the male members of your Vegas entourage that shopping here is a great way to thwart any tempation to gamble (aka lose), thus saving them more money! LOL!

Even though I have never gone to that mall before, I have applied for a job at Chipotle, twice and first, even though I had to reschedule a job interview, since I was in West Sacramento atm, then they lied to me about my would-be-upcoming job interview .

"Thanks for applying to our Restaurant Team Member - Crew (2584 - Las Vegas North Outlets) position.  Unfortunately, we are unable to offer you a position at this time," they said.

Then, last month, when I was checking my emails, I got a chance to reapply for a job there and when I learned that I would have a job interview on Janurary 2nd, so on a week before New Year's Eve, I called them and attempted to reschedule the interview, to which I had to give them my phone number, and then they said that they would call me back later, but the next day, it turned out that they never called back after all, so on New Year's Eve, I managed to reschedulethe interview to this Friday and yet today (which is three days later, I think) I've just learned that they sent me the same message that I have already mentioned above. What a bunch of liars they really are! If you ever apply for a job, beware, people! Those people working there are liars! I'm sure there are better Chipotles out there and as far as I'm concerned, I don't think I'll ever apply for a job there again.

I love this mall but they started to charge $5 for parking - effective March 27/18. Locals with a DL are free but not the rest of us (I'm here twice a month). South Outlets are still free. Guess I'm going there.

There really are some great stores in this location with great prices!  There are several that I stop in several times a year as a local.  

The walkways and facilities seem to always be pretty clean when I'm there. It's also great that there are multiple parking garages/areas considering these shops get high traffic volumes. 

These shops are a great addition to the Downtown LV area, and I hope they stay well maintained for many years to come.  I enjoy that this mall is safe, affordable, and enjoyable.

Came here while visiting Vegas. I walked away with a lot of great items. I made a purchase at Micheal Kors, Nike, vitamin store, and Gap Factory. Very nice outlet mall. I have been to vegas about 5x and my recent visit was my first time there. I would definitely come back.

This mall has the best selection in all of Las Vegas, and includes the best brands.  If you shop early in the day 9-11am you will find parking and no crowds whatsoever.  Keep in mind while it has outlet in the name... That does not mean it is heavily discounted or last seasons odds and ends.  So make sure you ask what is "made for outlet" and what is from the mainline retail stores.  Unfortunately most of what you will find is "made for outlet" product lines.  There are still some stores that carry current season items just at a discount so don't be afraid to ask.  

Bring snacks, there is not much for food here, and food court lines can be long.  Bring an umbrella in the heat of summer as there is no shade.

As a local in Las Vegas I don't shop here often as it has the worst parking in town and any prospective savings can be lost in the cab ride to the center for quick trips.  If you are not trying to park you have no worries, but on both weekdays and weekends I have encountered closed parking garages.  Hopefully there is a plan to increase parking as the center is huge and hiking from the main South garage to Cheesecake Factory in the summer heat is a hike and quite miserable.  

This review could easily be a 5 if there was parking, and shade, and an improved food court.  But it's just a great outlet store selection (J. Crew, Tag Heuer, Citizen, Dolce and Gabbana) that keeps us coming back.  But do shop early if you want a place to park.

First time at this outlet mall. Everything was at great prices. Loved the outdoor part of the mall. Great brands, good variety and also a good food court. Don't get the overstuffed lobster roll at the little wagon. Overpriced and definitely not worth $20.
The Oakley store helped me out tremendously and the staff was very very helpful and informative and very friendly they went out of their way to help me in a big way.. thank you Oakley
This is a really cool outlet. Too bad it's so damn far from everything else on the Strip.

My friends and me visiting from out of town caught an Uber to the outlets. Was looking for a few things and I let the quest begin.

The outlet is nice, but really no different than other premium outlets that I've been to. You have your pick of many different stores. It's a good chance you'll find something you want for a good, discounted price. 

My favorite outlet there was the Cole Haan store. Polo always has great stuff. Nike, Sunglasse Hut, etc. Lots of great deals.

There is absolutely nothing special about the Las Vegas Premium outlets...and I say that because we have the exact same set-up here in Houston!!! The shops are the same, the layout is the same, and there is the same sense of boredom that comes across me everytime I walk through an outlet.

I have never found anything at an outlet that blows me away in terms of price...especially since there are so many great sales everywhere now!!!
This mall is disgusting.  There is not a single open space that is not covered in people blowing their second hand smoke all over the damn place.  No thank you.  Never returning.
I love this outlet , done lots of my cross boarder shopping here while in Vegas. This outlet has it all with good deals. Just not crazy anout the pushy sales people working the outside stands.

Well.....im really kinda partial of this whole place...the only issue i have is when i think of an outlet mall i think of crazy prices and amazing deals.....LOL.....right well this outlet mall definitely does not match this criteria...and to be honest they match strip prices on some of the good the store sells.....

By far my favorite outlet that I have been too! The prices here are deeply discounted compared to the one on Primm, Cabazon, etc. The only bad thing about this place is that the parking is ridiculous! You would be lucky to find a spot here! We circled around like 3 times! And remember that it is packed already so time wise...very long!

The shops that are here that I like are the following:
1. Coach (Need to improve their designs...)
2. Lucky Brand Jeans
3. Burberry
4. Nike (Love their shoes!)
5. Banana Republic
6. Steve Madden (Brand new!!! Great selection!)
7. CAN'T REMEMBER THE OTHERS! =(

Overall, DEFINITELY COME HERE!
We drove to Both parking garages and saw the same signs ... $5 Parking. We turned around and went somewhere else. I will NOT pay $5 to shop at your mall ... RIDICULOUS ! ! !
Good outlet mall with plenty of stores to select from and the stores are well stocked.

The mall itself has some great stores that you won't find very often around like Uggs but try not to go during the weekend as it is a large tourist spot. It gets very hot since it's all outdoors during summer and winter you'll get really cold so dress appropriately!

In my experience, the north outlets are just ok.  Most of my visits here are short because I know which stores I want to shop in.  It's always busy just like any other outlet mall.  

There is construction going on throughout the walkways and storefronts.  It doesn't make for spacious walks with orange barriers all around.  Just very cramped.  Many of their palms were cut down and not eye appealing. 

On the plus side, they have some great stores here such as Kate Spade, Michael Kors and Burberry.  It's also filled with your staple outlet stores like Nike and Disney.  

When I know what I want, I'm not opposed to shopping here.

This is my Favorite mall ! Because they have the most stores ! It may be 101 degrees out here but I don't care ! More reason to go into every store and cool off ! LOL 
You have to hunt for good deals. It say's outlet. But it's not outlet prices.

I think this Outlet is either hit or miss.  The day we went, it was definitely a miss because I saw no eye popping deals. 

What I did see was the following:

* Plenty of vendors at the kiosks selling crap.  Why in the hell do I need a ball, made of slime, that you throw against a window just to watch it creep down the window?  Yeah, I bought 3.
* A Nike outlet store where it was wall to wall people yet no deals to be found.
