* Briefcases in excess of $300 dollars.  I'm not going to live in the damn thing, I just want to lug some crap around.
* A food court with maybe 6 types of food choices and about the same number of seating available.  Ok, it was a large dining are but so packed that there wasn't seating available either indoors or out.
* More footwear stores than I ever knew existed.  Are Ugg's really a hot commodity in Vegas in May?
* A Levi's outlet store.  I like my Levi's but aren't denim jackets a bit much unless your herding cattle?
* A Guess outlet and a Guess by Marciano.  Well guess what....I don't know who Marciano is.

My observations withstanding, this mall is easy to get to and if you get there early, parking is quite easy to find inside the parking garage.  Later in the day it gets busy and parking seems to be a premium at either of the parking garages.

The layout is easy to navigate with a bank of stores on the perimeter along with a center building with additional stores so you're basically walking around a rectangle.  Plenty of water misters throughout for those hot Vegas days which made this shopping experience bearable.

This one is way better than the south outlet.  This is open air shopping center with a lot of high end brands.  Ted Baker, Burberry, 7 For All Mankind, etc. I wish I was in Las Vegas for Black Friday.  This is one of the first places I'd stop by.  I usually do my best to come here when coming to Vegas.

I can't express how much I love this outlet. They are many brands you can shop here plus a cheese cake factory restaurant. Their parking is good also since there are several parking in mall. They sell a discount notebook too but you can get it free with your AAA card membership; sweet :)

Outlets?!? 70% off sale??? Cheap designer brands? I'm SO there! Great selection of stores. From Michael Kors to Banana Republic. You can find alot of different stores here for anyone. The prices are remarkable as they are outlets. Only thing is try to avoid them during the 104 degree weather. Gets hard to focus on shopping, but then again, you can just hop around the stores and make use of the AC. There is also a taxi line, as there is everywhere else. Makes it easier for out of towners to enjoy.

As I journeyed thru the outlets, I found a great pet accessory kiosk, adjacent to the Van's shoe store, called Pets on display. Although the merchandise is basic with the bedazzled collars with matching leashes, and harnesses already sold at local pet stores, Robert Ansara served me well. His fashion forward sense and caring personality sold the deal. Got my Cookie her first dog tags, inspired by Tiffany ID bracelet. Thought it was a great buy $70 bucks for sterling silver dog tags with matching lady's bracelet. 

My Cookie girl is all smiles. No buyer's remorse here.

The parking at this place is just terrible. Despite having two lots, "A" and "B", there's no indicator on the outside of how many spots are remaining. One could end up driving to the roof and then back out again before even seeing a spot. Yes, they have those new red/green indicator lights if there's a spot, but the staff is limited to putting up an orange cone at the parking lot entrance when they think it is filled. While it is not the biggest outlet, it has one of the better selections of high-end brands, security runs around on Segways. If you fail/give-up finding parking, there's a small, paid lot for $7! (Damn, MGM for starting this trend in Vegas!) Another pro-tip is to buy the City's Deuce pass and it will go from Strip all the way to here. You skip the taxi line, the madness of finding parking, but then you can only take what you hand-carry back.

There is a good selection of stores to visit and the prices are actually pretty good. Also, if you have AAA membership, you can get a coupon book from the information office. Just be careful to look at the fine print for exclusions.

Overall, I try to stop here for at least a little shopping when I'm in Vegas. There are usually some pretty good deals. And it's not far from the strip either.

A couple of notes though (that have not deterred me from coming)- it's an outdoor mall so of course it gets quite hot in the summer. Parking is also a pain. There are always tons of cars trying to get in and out.

Other than that, it's worth a visit. Why pay full price when you can get things for less?
Great parking, great stores, great prices, this is my favorite outlet shopping center!

This is a great outlet mall, but you might find some better bargains at their south Outlet Mall on south Las Vegas Boulevard. There were two distinct items that were cheaper down south. One was a phone belt holster that was three dollars less. The other was a jacket that was BOGO 1/2 price up north, but the item itself was 1/2 off down south. Yes, these were both at the same store, same style, etc. The north outlet mall is bigger and has more stores. The one down south is older, slightly smaller selection of stores, but you might get a better bargain.

This place rocks now, I used to hate it. My wife just found out they are charging for parking now and that's like the best news ever. Every time I come to town (Every 3 months) I have to stop at this stupid mall. Now shes so mad at them for charging for parking that she wont go anymore. Can you hear the joy in my post? She was complaining and I was singing inside. Thanks guys, I never thought the mall itself would get me out of this.

This place was amazing...Not for what it looks like, but for what you can find. I made a last minute decision to go and I'm so glad I did! A must-stop for every gay man visiting Vegas. D&G, Diesel, French Connection, Calvin Klein, Energie, Ted Baker... Are you serious? I can't believe I almost missed this place. Definitely worth the $20 cab fare from the strip. I just got my entire summer wardrobe and probably saved $1,000.00 off the full prices. Most of the stores I went to had deals going on offering 20-50% off of everything inside (with a few exclusions like formal wear). There's good stuff too...you just have to have the patience to sort through all the ugly stuff and XXL crap.

Of all the Premium Outlets, this is probably one of the most extensive ones I've been to.  It has all the usual stores but also a lot of the more high-end stuff that I don't see at all outlets: Tory Burch, Kate Spade, Michael Korrs, etc.  I actually found a lot of the stores to be too high-end for me, but there's also a ton of stores that were in my price range as well!  Such a great variety!  And the markdowns were pretty amazing!

The drive is about 10 minutes from the strip, but beware of parking.  We went pretty early (11:30am-ish) and the parking structure was PACKED.  There were a line of cars queued WITHIN the parking structure since the aisles are generally one-way, one-lane, so cars get backed up when the front car is waiting for a stall.

The rate of a taxi from the strip I think is about $20 per way if I recall.

Like most of the outlets, the food selection isn't the greatest.  I'd recommend eating beforehand or planning on going somewhere else after, especially if you're a foodie like me.

It's an outdoor mall so be aware of the weather!

Love this outlet mall! They have a large selection of shops, from high end brands to cheap stuff. I know that some brands tend to make cheaper quality stuff for their outlet sections, but there are still some great finds if you put in the time, and as far as holiday shopping goes, we all have those on our list who care more about the name than the quality, so as long as they're happy it's fine by me! They open pretty early (9am) and they have a steady stream of taxis going in and out of the outlet so for those that don't want to drive you don't have to worry about being stranded if you cab it there! They also have a decent food court and the place is clean and orderly. Great outlet shopping to be had here!

While I am generally a fan, this really is a premium shopping district and no longer an "outlet mall."  The stores are far more expensive and higher-name retailers than this mall used to have.  A number of the more reasonably priced retailers have been pushed out so don't go there looking for moderately priced merchandise.

[HOLIDAY RANT] The traffic flow through this outlet shopping center is just excruciating.  Big planning FAIL.  Takes forever just to get to the parking lots on those single lanes.  Poor pedestrians have to dodge and weave the grumpy drivers who've been tipped over the edge waiting and hunting for spots.  Trying to find a spot is harder than winning at a penny slot.  The store variety is the only thing going for this place, but the quality at outlets is just weak in comparison to the real stores.  Another thing was that they pumped up the heaters in all the stores so it was like an oven breeding ground cooking up all the holiday germs.  Yes it's cold outside, but did you ever think about the amount of BTUs the crowd puts out?  I'm just about through with outlet shopping. [END HOLIDAY RANT]

Great selection of stores but horrendous parking! They have signs that say how many parking spots that are available but not accurate by any means. I went through the north garage with no luck then the small ground level, then the south garage until I found open spots on the roof. There seems to be other spots but they are closed off for some reason. I normally don't like going here for this reason and it's super crowded.

Best sales and a lot of good stores! Only thing is that it's really hot during the summer and it's an outdoor shopping mall. This is the north outlets by downtown Las Vegas. The south off blue diamond is good, but doesn't have as many good high end stores. The south outlets are in doors so that's the kicker.

In regards to outlet malls, this is one of the best I've been to especially after adding the high(er) end section (burberry, black and white, marciano, marc jacobs etc). Its clean, has parking garages, outside misters (not sure of the cool down especially when its 110). The prices are comparable if not more than sales prices at the regular stores. You can occasionally find good sales or buys but they generally have a good selection you can choose from. I loved this place better than the one in Ontario which claims to be the biggest but definitely not the best.

Located across from the women's coach store is this  men's store.

The employee who helped us was kind and professional. 
Excellent customer service. (Better than the women's side)

They have limited edition accessories with baseball teams. We bought one for a friend who is a sports fan.
Ive been coming here on and off for years when I visit. Now I have to pay $5.00 to park !? I have never had to pay to park in a mall parking lot...ridiculous...

LoveLoveLove this place.  I shopped here twice in December and once in April.  I will be back in late July / early August.  My first and second time there, I discovered that my beloved Burberry packable nylon tote was available in the exact color I'd been looking for back home.  At LeSportsac, the only place I trust for quality and durability in terms of makeup bags, I found several of them at ridiculously cheap prices.  At the Disney Store, I picked up a very cute Piglet stuffed animal and decided that waiting in a long line to buy it was worth my time.  At Ecko Unltd, I purchased a comfortable pair of black yoga pants for way less than $20.  At Lacoste, I found a comfortable polo shirt and a large cosmetic tote, the latter of which I ended up using quite often for the remainder of my trip. 

Weirdly enough, it's easier to remember what stores I shopped at in December 2010 than it is to recall my experience in April.  I think this is largely due to differences in stock (there was more available during the holiday season), the weather (December was cold, but April was super duper uncomfortable h-o-t), my mood (I think I was grouchy / tired on my last visit) and the simple fact that I was here twice in December, compared to only once in April.

Nevertheless, I did find quite a few things in April as well.  The most noteworthy purchases are my Ecko Red large women's jacket (hard to find back home) and my Vans all-black sneakers in women's size 5 (almost impossible to find anywhere).  These are items that I consider wardrobe staples, and I found myself using them the same day of purchase.

All in all, I highly recommend shopping at LVPON.  There's something for everyone here, no matter your preferences or budget.

Oh yeah... and the food / drink selection is adequate with 10 establishments.  WTG with the Starbucks!

This place is about an average size outlet.  Probably the best prices around in the area.

The security guards zip through everyone on their segways which is probably a bit dangerous.  Maybe they thought they were cool to be able to use one or something, but they should slow down.

It was pretty busy with a lot of travelers too.

I work here. I shop here. I DO NOT waste my money on this food court. It's the absolute worst. Everyone that works at the food places here always seem to be in a horrible mood... 

You'll always be able to find good sales here.

I am used to going to Simon Premium Outlets as there are a lot in California, however this one in Vegas took me by surprise to see how big it was with a lot of high end stores that are usually not at the other outlets. Parking took about 30 minutes because of a small 5 story garage, but the mall itself had a lot of aspects to it and overall was very nice to be able to see new shops. It is definitely easy to get lost here if you're unfamiliar. I did not get a chance to try the food, but there were plenty of options at the food court!

Great variety of shops but the parking is terrible. If not for the good deals on clothes and shoes, I wouldn't come here. Also it's outdoors so when the weather is extremely cold you will feel the chill and when its blazing hot in the summer you won't want to be outside.

Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!!!  Coach, Charlotte Russe, White/Black clothes shop, Aldo, Adidas, Kate Spade, Puma, Banana Republic! 

We spent a good 5 hours here. And walked out with some amazing deals! 

I agree with Cynthia A. that they could have better food options.  But we just cabbed it to In n Out on our way back to the strip instead. 

Will be back, the next time I'm in Vegas.

Very pleasantly suprised by this shopping center. It is large and has a food court along with two parking garages. Lots of variety of stores. Some that i was suprised by was citizen watch store and under armor store and famous footwear. Great location, appreciated that it was off the strip between downtown and main strip as it allows for easy access on all sides. Total got some great deals, we will be back.

This outlet is located away from the strip and is accessible by public transport. 
This location has way better variety than the south location and being out door and newer it has much better clean feel. 
Though I wouldn't recommend it on a hot day. There way a lineup outside Starbucks and Ice Cream shops of people just trying to get something to quench their thirst.
Food options are a bit better as well and I recommend the Makino AYCE Japanese.
For store I just luv luv the Armani Exchange outlet. 
Parking can be tight so beware of that and this place does get its fair share of traffic. 
I recommend this place if you can't drive to Primm.

My coworker and I were in town for a conference and excited to a do some shopping during our limited free time. This place is huge with a wide selection of stores. I give it only three stars because it's a long ride from 'The Strip' especially when you take the bus, and the prices are very high at most of the stores so it doesn't seem like you are getting a bargain at all. The most reasonable prices I found were at Ann Taylor where they had dressy work tops from $15-19. 

Many of the stores felt really empty to me in terms of clothing and other merchandise. At a couple of the stores I was super bored while my coworker tried on a few things as I found that I had already circled around through the stores and that I'd already seen everything there was to see. 

There are very few dining options outside of a few fast food places. We ended up eating dinner at Starbucks, which is always good. 

In the end it wasn't worth it to us to make this trek. My coworker only found one thing to buy, and I didn't find anything. It was fun to check the place out, but I probably wouldn't come back.
Over crowed with tour buses and no parking.  Go early or late.  The outlet itself is good if you need to go to one store. Outlet south and Primm have the same stores with less people.
I love this place, it has such a better selection than the other Premium Outlets in other cities.  It has better designer stores, woohoo!

So your at the Wynn and your on a heater.  The table eventually cools down and you walk away nicely colored chips in your hand.  It's only natural to walk over to the shoppes and see if you can treat yourself to something nice.  There is the problem my friends, you can treat yourself to something (singular) nice.  So I got into the car and drove down to the Outlets off of Charleston and noticed that I didn't have to think about only being able to buy one thing anymore. 

This place was pretty sweet.  There were some stores (Banana) that had jaw dropping deals, and others (Hugo) that just made you scratch your head.  There were quite a bit of high end stores and, if you can stand the heat, definitely worth the visit.  If you're wondering....Yes, I did leave with some items (plural).

Open even on a holiday! Parking structure has recently been updated to include red and green lights to tell you from a far when there's a vacancy. Hot as heck out here and super crowded but most things are on sale. Outlet stores include Nike, Adidas, Nine West, Claire's, Polo, Starbucks, Zales, White house black market, and many more. If you plan to eat in the food court know that space is very limited.

Awesome outlet mall! I wish they had outlets like this in San Antonio. They had a lot of great deals on Christmas Eve this year but I do wish that this outlet mall had an easier layout to navigate. Come early with a game plan and where comfortable walking shoes. Also, if you are planning on shopping at popular stores like Coach or Michael Kors, go there first because by 12 noon there will a line you have to wait in outside.

This place is ridiculous. I have been coming here for years when we travel to Vegas and all of a sudden the parking structure now cost money to park! Seriously?!  Why would you want to pay to park at a mall or outlet?  Of course the structure is full of idiots willing to pay including us because it was out of our way to drive to them since they are in North Vegas not near the strip. So we ended up letting them rip us off along with everyone else. But now that I know this we will NOT be back in the future. I also feel that the pricing for stuff there is no longer "outlet" prices. But rather the same price as a regular mall. Which you can go to anywhere and also not have to pay to park!

New look, nicely laid out, easy to navigate.  

There's lots of stores to browse, but I really didn't see a lot of true bargains.  Most merchandise was discounted the same amount as you would find in a regular (non-outlet) shopping mall.  

The weather was great when I went, but I can imagine how miserable a person would be walking around this place in the middle of July.

Definitely not a bad outlet in any way.  There were LOTS of people there, even on a weekend, and probably around 70% of them being tourists.  Which isn't always a bad thing.  Unless they're rude tourists.  Because I then get pretty annoyed.

I do like the huge range of stores they have, and they're all pretty nicely arranged where there are two main "streets" you can browse through to hit majority of the stores.  There are branches into other smaller stores or the Food Court, for example, but most of the shops are just on these main two rows. The shops are of all various items, though my favorite ones to browse have been Pandora and Fossil, while hubby was going through all of the shoe stores recently (we both have mutant fat feet).

For parking, you can park across from it and walk on over, or just hit the parking structure that is at the end of it.  Pretty convenient parking, especially because they're all sensored so that you know what space has been taken, and how many spaces are open on a given parking level.

Pretty close to the strip, though getting here during rush hour may be a bit of a pain.

I would say that this outlet has a lot of the "premium" brand outlets that most people would be looking for, although I thought this place was total crap.

The "common" areas of this mall are all outside, so each business has doors to go in, it's like a giant strip mall. For people not familar with the stores names, you have no idea what's inside. So many of the window displays were hard to see, so we didn't end up going in many stores. This is probably the first "mall" I've went to in my life and not bought a thing. Lots of stuff here you'll find at other malls.
Large and clean. During the hot summers, they have mist blowing. Parking is ridiculous but it's Vegas.

I love shopping at this outlet mall!

One thing you should always do when shopping here is ask the store if they have a discount for those who purchased a coupon book at the Outlet mall guest center.  Sometimes places will give you an additional discount if you purchased the $10 booklet up front.  It can really save you a lot of $ if you plan on spending a lot.

It's hard to find an outlet mall with such a wide selection of stores.  And it always beats paying full price at some of the places on the strip.  And it's not really that far away if you want a break from the strip while visiting Vegas.

This place has easily become one of the go-to malls in Vegas for locals and visitors alike. It has lots of stores I tend to frequent like Gap, Converse, and Aldos. There are lots of great deals to be had, one just has to look! There are lots of higher-end stores as well which makes for a nice mix. It is an outdoor mall so dress accordingly! Sometimes in the spring and summer some of the misters don't work that well and "spit" out water as opposed to "misting" it lol!
Nicer layout than the Outlets on the south side. Tricky parking though.

This outlet has a large selection of stores better than the oulet at Primm.  I only wish they had a Williams Sonoma store.  I didn't see any empty stores which is what I've been seeing in other outlet malls.  The food court and restaurants are okay.  The parking sucks when it gets busy.

Enjoyed shopping here they have SOOO MANY outlet stores, but we only went to Gap, Hurley, and Godiva (looove the choco dipped strawberries but they're $12.50 for 6!!). Definitely recommend shopping here.

There are basically 2 outlets near The Strip.  In fact, they are on opposite sides of The Strip.  One is an outdoor outlet, the other is indoor.  This particular review is for the former.  I think in comparison to each other, I prefer this one.  However, when it's the dead of summer and it's reaching 120 degrees outside, I'd prefer the indoor one.  But, in terms of shopping, I like the stores here.  They have a good Tommy Hilfiger store that always has good deals when I go there.  Also, the Nike outlet always seems to be stocked with stuff I could use and if it's on sale, stuff I could afford.  I also like the fact that there are like 2 or 3 different stores where I could buy cooking supplies.  That way, when the Mrs is looking at girly clothes, I have somewhere to go.

As for the food court, skip it.  There nothing over there worth going to.  With that being said, the food's not bad there, it's just that I'd rather go somewhere else if possible.  Parking is not a problem.  Wait, let me rephrase a little.  Parking is not a problem if you go some time other than the holiday season.  If it's black Friday, then good luck!

I love this outlet more than the Premium South outlet and Fashion Show mall for a few reasons.  This outlet has a lot more brand name stores and you can find some things that are highly discounted.  And, this outlet is closer to the strip than the South outlet. 

If you have to choose one place to shop in Vegas, I would choose Premium north outlets.  Just try to go early in the morning or later in the day when it isn't so hot as it's an outdoor shopping center.

Cool outdoor mall...had just about everything, great sales too.

major props for the AC food court, although it didn't feel cool while in there, but I knew it was much cooler inside compared to how hot it was outside.

Las Vegas North Premium outlets, one of my favorite places to shop! 

Coach outlet. 
Pandora outlet. 
Claire's. 
Michael Kors outlet. 
Tory burch outlet. 
Hot topic. 
Cheesecake Factory. 
Starbucks! 
A food court! 
Just to name a few :)

This outlet mall is an OUTDOOR mall, one of my favorite features would be the parking lot! I swear everywhere in this country needs that system!! Red light taken. Green light empty! That saves so much time  for parking! Especially because it even shows the amount of stalls that are available. 
This outlet mall is also very clean! Big plus!
Spent way more than anticipated, but got great deals at the William Sonoma and Coach Factory Outlet. Worth the stop!

It seems like at some point the idea behind outlet shopping has changed.  It used to be a way that manufacturers could sell direct to the public stuff that retailers didn't want (slightly damaged, out of date seasons) at cheap cheap prices.

It seems lately like it's simply a place where these manufacturers can cut out the retailer's margins and sell direct to the public.  The prices really aren't weren't that good on my last visit (is it just me that noticed this?).  Maybe it was just because we were shopping the weekend after 4th of July weekend, but I found it was hard to find anything beyond 10 to 20% off in most stores.

We went to the non-outlet fashion show mall (ON THE STRIP) and were able to find many of the same products we were looking for for cheaper. 

If you take away the cheap prices then I'm just walking around in 110+ degree weather, and if that's the case i would prefer to be browsing around in a nice comfy air conditioned mall :).

Helpful tip: If you're looking at getting to the mall from the strip for cheap, take the ACE bus.  It doesn't stop at every single hotel like the deuce and is way cheaper than taking a taxi.

Always a fan of outlets - especially when they carry name branded stores. Tory Burch, Lacoste, Nike Factory, etc. It was really crowded when we went - given it was St. Patrick's day. 

First time here though. Next time we're going to explore the South one.

I try to avoid the Malls and department stores as much as possible but especially the outlet malls because it is out doors and in Vegas I can't handle the heat. Shopping amongst a million and one locals and tourist, and fighting for good deals is really not my idea of a good time. But when I do find myself here it is hard not to go bonkers, I mean when I shop I shop! 

I haven't been here in a loooooong time since before they renovated but to my surprise it looks very good. They have added parking with high tech parking assistance and cool shaded benches to help cool down customers which is a great idea and not to mention they look esthetically  nice. There are more stores then before and now there's even a Cheese Cake Factory which is nice to have a dinning spot as oppose to the food court. 

Anyhow regardless of how much I hate shopping dealing with the cray cray ness I do have a weak spot for the this outlet because of the tiny bit of discount I get now it's that much more enjoyable.

I luckily went here on a day when it wasn't too hot, but if ti had been, it would have been miserable.  With that being said, they have a lot of nice stores to choose from.  I am not big into name brands myself, but I do love me some Juicy Couture and they have a good selection.  Sometimes I just make a beeline for the back of store where the super clearance is at and you can usually find stuff for even better prices.  And no one has to know unless you have snooty friends who actually care what "season" your clothes are from.

Also, watch out for tourists from Asia: they are ferocious when it comes to buying purses and carry so many shopping bags that they take up half the walkway.
Great selection of stores. It was a short ride from the strip. It's e fun place to spend some of your winnings.

It's a nice time... during nice weather.  it's outside so it's not comfy in the summer.  I don't always come out of this place with awesome finds.  It's just like any typical outlet... but with more of a mall look.

you'll find A LOT of shops to browse through.
coach, pacific sunwear, zumies, charlotte russe, nike... sunglass hut.
there are also restaurants here..  [i've never been]

don't come often cause it's a drive, but when i do end up here it's usually with family in the summer, and the good thing about that is the misters.

Stores are great, wide selections and variety. With Some new stores opening soon. Such as American Eagle Factory. Parking is very limited in the weekends. You cannot park in the government office parkings. Try going during weekdays when it's smoother.

This is probably the best outlet mall I have ever been to. Not only does it have great stores, it is also just a nice outdoor mall (far superior to the bland concrete strip malls that are other outlet centers).

It can be a challenge to get here, though. I think they deliberately made parking difficult so you have time to truly work up your shopping appetite. Hint: Parking garage B always seems to be less crowded than parking garage A, and don't even bother with trying to valet (the valet has been "full" every time I've been here). 

If you are visiting Vegas and didn't rent a car, there is a direct bus here from the Strip. There is also a taxi stand for easy return to the Strip when loaded down with shopping bags.

It can be helpful to create a plan of attack before arriving. To me at least, this is not a place I like to just wander about and shop. It's always crowded, and for someone like me who is directionally-challenged, I can get lost easily in this shopping maze. Hint: You can go to the website and print off a map.

The deals you find here can be spectacular. My two favorite places are Kate Spade and Kenneth Cole. There's nothing quite like the feeling of a 1/2 price leather clutch and 2 for 1 skinny jeans.

Hint: If you are 50+, or shopping with someone who is, you get an additional 10% off at select stores on Tuesdays. You can view the list of stores on the website.

Shopped here December 29, 2016. Nice outlet with a good variety of stores.  Just like any outlet know your pricing before buying merchandise.  Lots of parking but it did get busy later in the day.  Outdoor shopping so it is open to the elements.

On the plus side, they have some stores that are atypical of outlet malls. On the negative side, the deals are not plentiful. They know that you are tourists and that you'll buy anything that is "on sale". Beware that some of the items are made-for-outlet only and therefore can be sold at a discount price. 

The parking is good. The stores are situated in a big circle pattern so you'll be able to hit all the stores. Again, the bargains are slim so you really have to pay attention.
Hands down my favorite place to shop!  Best boutiques - you will always find something!  Now if only we had a Jimmy Choo or a Gucci outlet there...

Been coming here for a few years now, and I have to say this is by far my favorite outlet center. I do wish that there was more shade since Vegas can get wicked hot in the summer, but overall a fine shopping experience.

Food court is a little lacking in variety, but it'll do in a pinch when you've been on a shopping binge for a couple of hours and realize it's well past time for lunch.

Addition of parking structures is great. At least your car won't be melting hot when you finish your shopping binge.

Mall is pretty large and oddly shaped, so make sure to check one of the posted maps to ensure you haven't missed anything. This is a must-stop for me whenever I'm in Las Vegas.

For all you bargain hunters out there, I think it would definitely be worth your time to check out this place.  Although it's an open-air mall, there are a lot of name-brand stores, ample parking in 2 garages, and a somewhat decent food court.  This place even has a starbucks!

M-U-S-T:

1)  For all you fellow Gap and Banana Republic shoppers, do
visit the locations here, there's a bargain waiting to be found!  

2)  I thought there were some pretty good deals at Kenneth Cole on shoes and dress shirts.  I also found a winter jacket, but nixed the idea of buying it almost right away, WHEN would I ever use it in this tropical weather we live in.

3)  Lastly, if you are in need of sunglasses (which I wasn't but I bought them anyway), stop by the Fossil outlet where the sunglasses are priced at a bargain in all shapes and styles.  Just a small NOTE:  Since this IS the outlet, the sunglasses cases cost extra...just fyi.  


C-A-U-T-I-O-N:

1)  Be mindful of the force.....of the weather, it IS an open air mall with not much shade if you're caught in a downpour or even a light drizzle.

2)  Be mindful of the kiosk vendors selling goods that sounds too good to pass up, merchandise you might not need, or stuff that's sold on infomercials.  They're slightly annoying to say the least.

Bottom Line:  A place to consider if on the hunt for a bargain.
This place is awesome. So nice to shop at an out door mall. I wish they would bring the food trucks back. And beware of this really tall large breasted Asian woman. She will eat you whole.

This is a great outdoor outlet mall! The Simon outlet family is always great. Tons of high end stores here and I particularly enjoyed the following shops:

1. Tory Burch- omigosh this place was HUGE. They had some items for 50% off when I visited. Excellent selection even though I walked out empty handed. 
2. Gap Kids outlet- loooooved this shop! Great sales- I got some pants for $2.97 for my kiddo! The clearance section was wonderful. 
3. Ralph Lauren kids- pretty tiny inside compared to the other stores I walked into. 
4. Chipotle- always a great place to stop for a bite to eat. Portions are smaller here than at other locations, I feel. 
5. kate spade- huge, gorgeous store!! A gigantic selection even though again, I walked out empty handed. 
6. Oliver Peoples- first one I've ever seen. 
7. Lulu Lemon- very nice sales associates! Great deals!

This is definitely the outlet location to visit if you only have time to visit one while in Vegas!

They have a good selection of stores. I love the cool mist fans throughout to help keep you cool on those warm days. They are missing a couple stores i'd like to see like A&F but for the most part one of the best i've seen.

you can only gamble and drink for so long. take a break and come to the outlet and get your  shopping on. When  my girls and I went it was hardly anyone there. so you can enjoy strolling along, window shop, actual shop , great bargains on top of the line  stuff  too!and then go to your hotel and rest.

Great big outlet shopping spree! Yay! This is probably one of the better outdoor outlets that I've been to. Lots of variety... from J.Crew to BR... to Coach and more! My friends and I went at the perfect time: New Years Eve. Markdowns were everywhere, and it wasn't crowded to the point where we weren't helped. Must go back!
lots of window and people watching but less deals than a decade ago.  i still go in the am when its less crowded

A lot of shops to chose from, a lot the shops have great deals too. There is a Nike and under amour store. Parking in a garage which is always good. What more can you say about an outlet, if you been to one they are all kind of the same.

One of favorite outlets.  I always stop here when I'm in Vegas. Good variety of stores.  This past weekend 60+20% off at Kate Spade.  40% off entire store at Tory Burch.  My favorite store this time is Godiva.  Yum.  Bought 20 packs of cookies for $40.  You get free samples and the store manager and staff were extremely nice!  Prices are so good here.  Make sure you stop by customer service with your AAA card to get a coupon booklet!  I never shop at outlets without picking one up.  Not all stores are in there but it has a lots of good deals.  One of the thickest outlet booklets out there.

This place has definitely grown in size and store selection over the years. An awesome outlet to score major deals. Bet your bottom dollar that this place has something for every one. Even my husband who never buys any clothes managed to spend some money here. Ample parking.

We like to come here fairly often, the Bebe store in particular is always having sales and they have relevant styles avaialble.  The open area to walk around is nice especially in the evenings or when the weather is mild.  Best parking garage around because the sensors that tell you what spaces are avaialble!  The rest of the shops there are also great and many times can do holiday shopping in one day because there is something there for everyone!

Two elevators and one escalator out off order. Retailers have their sale racks blocking the walkway.  Clear ADA violations - they should be ashamed of themselves. Then the entire south garage has been retired in a fashion that only makes traffic congestion worse. Terrible planning and foresight by management. It'll be a long time before I go back. I'll definitely avoid it on the weekends.

I was very ecstatic when I arrived at the prem outlets! I did a little research prior to see what shops they had.. TONS AND TONS of shops... I actually didn't get to go all the way around because I had plans to attend to.. but I did find a lot of good stuff and great deals. The coach outlet always does me right.. they always give away coupons to lure people to buy stuff and it works! Me and my aunt purchased over $350 worth of stuff and got 30% off each item. In the end we got 3 things for only $200. Amazing. The True Religion outlet is AWESOME! $99.99 for Trues are a steal.. they also have some more intricate designs for $120. The Ed Hardy store is OK.. nothing really to rave about. The Juicy outlet was pretty great, they had an additional 20% off but I didn't find anything of my liking. Overall I'll definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Las Vegas is a city with indulgence and bargains so it make sense to have outlets that are found on both ends of the strip.  These outlets are on the north end, you'd drive past the strip on I-15 on the way to downtown.  

There are high end shops and also more affordable options for us middle class citizens. =)  I would say that the Coach store & Nike store are usually pretty crowded - I am a personal fan of the Gap and Aldo stores.  There's a very large selection of stores to shop at and it is an outdoor outlet.  There's a food court as well.  It's a good place to shop and kill a few hours if you want to get away from the typical Vegas stuff.

Overall the place is nice. Food, shopping , restrooms, ect.
Bring a light jacket. It gets windy since it's outdoor.
Not very crowded on weekdays but weekends mabey different. Friendly staff. Clean mall. There are a variety of retail to choose from. 
I'm sure there's public buses that run there but cabs are there waiting for you at the front.

This is going to be short and sweet.  Three words: Coach Outlet Store. Fantastic selection of bags at awesome prices.  That, my friend, is what a true outlet store should be.  Oh, and there are some other awesome outlet stores there too: Banana Republic, JCrew, Converse, Burberry, BCBG, and the list goes on and on.  

Even if you lost big in Vegas, you can still feel like a winner at Premium Outlets!

Top tips!

1. Come during the week during business hours so as to avoid crowds.

2. Look closely at prices.  Some are not lower than the main retail store.

3. Some merchandise is the same (just a season or so older) than the main retail store. Other merchandise is definitely designed for the outlet.

4. Adequate food court with at least one healthy choice. Please note there are other eateries scattered around e.g. Chipotle, Starbucks and Dairy Queen.

5. Convenient walk from Fremont St. /Downtown.  Check out Fremont before your shopping excursion so you won't have to lug bags.
Love this outlet! We go here everytime we are in town. Always great finds!

We only came here to grab a pair of shades at the Oakley store.  It is basically a million degrees and you run from store to store to get onto the ac.  I feel super bad for the people working the kiosks outside.  HOT!

I have been shopping here since years...
But in recent times the experience hv gone worst.. especially with respect to customer service...

Esp. Guess factory store.. hv been shoppimg here since years but this time round.. everyone was very arrogant... not sure what piss them about me..... guess at guess... still bought because their styles are good.

Also this saving passport didnt work anywhere...
So don't count those coupon codes as evrything wud be a dollar cheap n it dint apply on a any item i bought anywhere

Nothing impressive here...

I've been in 8 of these "premium outlets" around the southern states, and they're really all the same. If you're looking for a bunch of fashion stores that pretend to lower their prices and sell you last seasons collection, then you're in the right place.

No seriously, the sketchers "outlet" had 40-70% discounts on their shoes, but they had the exact same prices as the normal sketchers store inside Vegas... Seriously bulls**t as usual.

A nice outdoor mall. We took a stroll to burn a couple of hours while I finished killing off our credit cards and my husband took a mental nap. 

The mix of stores is interesting. We found both high-end and pedestrian shops. The finds are hit or miss since its all subjective on what you consider a good "deal". I loved that it was less intimidating to go into the higher end stores here vs a luxury mall but at 90% sale some of these garments still come up to several hundred dollars so it's still a splurge. 

Nevertheless the few things I managed to score I don't think I could have found anywhere else. Definitely a place to visit if your patient enough to search carefully.

This was my first time at the premium outlets in Las Vegas. We came here for some after Christmas shopping and the stores did not disappoint. Plus the sales tax is cheaper than California, so that helps too, haha.

My favorite store has to be the Columbia outlet. Jackets galore for women. I don't think I saw any jackets more than $90 in that entire store, including their snowboarding jackets. Plus if you sign up for their email list you get 10% off your entire purchase.

It is a spacious outdoor mall, so in the winter it is cold.

Pretty neat outlet with many neat stores all around. Went to just polo and burberry and bought a lot of their stuff due to the right sales and price. There were a lot of stores but felt like only some were just there to fill the space, but it was still a fun adventure to look around.

A few minutes north of the strip this place is well worth the trip.  If you had a lucky day in the casino and decide to splurge, this is the place to be.  Tons of high end retailers that provide rock bottom pricing are just footsteps away from each other.  

If you are a AAA Member, be sure to visit the information kiosk right in front of the entrance to get a booklet containing additional discounts. 

Shop til you drop!

Black Friday at an outlet is always crazy. I cannot believe I was one of those people that went and braved the crowds. From last year, they updated the selection of stores from Coach, Dooney and Burke, LeSport Sac, Polo Ralph Lauren, Banana Republic, Black House White Market, Juice Couture, Quicksilver, Billabong, and so many others to remember. 
They have a decent sized food court with a generous space for eating. They also have a Starbucks which happens to be crowded every single moment, so line up early!

This outlet is one of my favorites, and there are always good deals through out the year.
Shopping at its best! I love the north end outlets! Great shopping, I always find deals & I love the indoor/outdoor shopping atmosphere!

This outlet had some major upgrades since I last visited (which was when I was in my teens.... Meaning a LONG LONG LONG time ago). I guess being owned by Simon Malls has it's perks!
Pros----
---Premium brands...... Lululemon, Oliver People's, All Saints, Carolina Herrera, Neiman's Last Call, Rag & Bone, Scotch & Soda
---They also have stuff for the kids like Gymboree, OshKosh,Disney Store
---Mist sprayers in the walkways. They sort of help keep you cool.
Cons---
--Parking in the main structure is c.r.a.p. I think it took us around 30-45minutes just to secure a space, which was a total game killer. After driving up to the top, I headed down and just so happened to find a car pulling out close to the entrance. This prevented us from actually going through the whole place.
--It's outdoors. With the sweltering desert heat, it can get pretty miserable.
--You're not saving much money, if any at all. I mean, this is for the higher end stuff. Mid-level stores actually had the better deals!

This outlet location has gotten better in so many respects in the past few years. These days they have a great selection of quality store. It seems very clean, they have misting systems in some locations & more security than they had in the past. Wish they had a big & tall mans outlet here, Lane Bryant & Niemans or Nordstroms. All in all it is a great experience these days with a nice food court & even an Orange Julius:)

Super deals any random day.  Seriously too much fun!  We came here before leaving Vegas for the weekend and it was just the perfect send-off.  I couldn't think of a better way to spend my hard earned money.

Treasures-galore!

Don't get this confused with the  Las Vegas Outlet Center on Las Vegas Blvd. 

Take note that you shouldn't plan to come here on a hot day since this is an outdoor mall. You will be sweating buckets. With that said, I've been lucky to come here on days with bearable weather. Unlike the other (indoor) outlet mall in Las Vegas, this outlet mall has a better selection of stores such as Coach, Ralph Lauren, Lacoste, French Connection, Timberland, Dolce & Gabbana, and Banana Republic, just to name a few. Parking can be hectic, but that can be resolved in a snap if you are willing to pay $5 for valet.

Not a bad selection of stores, which are mostly higher end. Can't say that I've ever found too many great items or deals here. As you all know, items at outlet malls are either seconds, made specifically for outlets, or the stuff they couldn't get rid of at clearance price at the regular stores. However, if you're visiting from another country, chances are the exchange rate will be in your favor and can get items you can't get back home for cheap. And if you're an XXS or XXL, you're in luck, as they'll probably have your size.

They have added an additional wing to the mall now which has stores including John Varvatos, All Saints, G Star, and many others. The funny thing is so many of these shop workers have better-than-you attitude. Dude, you work at a mall--an outlet mall. Get over yourself.

After finding all those great deals LOL you can fill up at the many(!) Auntie Anne's pretzels stands or the brick and mortar location, or stand in line at one of two Starbucks. There's also a large food court in the center with a huge white circus like tent cover for plenty of shade.

Fun to go a few times a year with visiting friends and family.  I like the outdoor element -- get your exercise in whilst hunting for bargains!  I've found better deals in the non-outlet versions, but it doesn't hurt to look around.  The food court is rather lame for a 'premium' outlet mall; I mean, really, only a handful of offerings (Subway, a pizza place, a Japanese-style fast food outlet, etc.) facing a dining area that could use some redecorating.

Come here on weekdays, not weekends, if you don't want to run out of patience!
Always fun to walk around.  Silly how expensive these stores are but very beautiful lay out and if you win in Vegas... great place to shop!

Tons and tons of great shops! Love this outlet mall they have it all. Be ready for a day full of shopping!

They added more restaurants too so you dont just have the food court as an option. 

Its outdoor so be ready for the warm weather.

If you like shopping, especially at outlets, come here for shopping! They have your usual outlet stores, mostly high end brands at low prices.

My boyfriend and I don't like shopping, but we came here anyways haha. There was a big Nike store here, but after seeing the line - we said nehhhhhh.

This shopping center is outdoors, so I can't imagine enjoying this place even more during the summer (triple digit temperatures) or winter (30 degree weather!??!!). Luckily, the food court is indoors with plenty of seating HAHA.

Parking can be a B though. Plan ahead :)
Great selection of stores.  Its outside but is worth the amount of deals and discounts you get in all the stores.  Is worth a visit.  Must check out the Kate Spade for exclusive bags.

My wife enjoys paying a visit to this outlet when we make the family trip to Vegas. I don't mind but my kids would rather be at the pool, I don't blame them. We usually bribe them with some Orange Julius, which can be found at the Food Court.

My wife convinces me to come here because the car will be parked in the shade inside the parking structure. Okay, I guess the car won't be hot after some shopping. She also reminds me about Kenneth Cole, Calvin Klein, and The Nike Outlet. Some shopping for myself is also a good selling point.

As for my wife will spend her time at Carter's, The Children's Place, Disney Store Outlet, Gap Kids & Baby, Lucky Brand, J. Crew, Coach, Godiva, and the list goes on. I'll be honest, the shopping portion of Vegas is all about her. After all we are on vacation and she needs her own fun ;o)

This outlet is awesome, I love the selection of stores and brands they offer; although I am a little miffed about them taking out FCUK. Another thing that I docked off a star was because its already so hot in Vegas, that outdoor malls aren't ideal =/ Other than that, this is where I like to do shopping in Vegas.

This outlet has a pretty good selection, everything from cosmetics to fragrances to Guess to Coach; definitely hits a wide range of audiences.

I am a frequent Las Vegas visitor and shopper and I never go without stopping at these outlets.
First of all, they have a wide selection of stores...a little bit of everything for everyone...but they do have the usual favorite designer stores. 
My best advice to get the best deals is to go on holidays and weekends. Yes its busy but they have way better deals. If you go during the week, there are usually no special deals and it's not worth going there. The whole point of outlets is to get good deals. 
I usually stop here during Black Friday. Warning to all those that go this year...its freaking cold, parking is horrible, and there are LOTS of people. Despite this, I enjoy going every year because I get awesome deals. Some of the stores even form lines, like Coach, they only let a certain amount of people in at a time, so a huge line forms outside. This is common on black friday. 
So if you don't like the madness and the cold, stay out of here! we don't need grumpy people shopping around because you will need a lot of patience for shopping on this day.
Otherwise, one of my favorite outlets to shop at!

This is a great place to get some nice clothes at a discount price. They have something for almost everyone. I know I always fine something when I go and I'm not even looking. I almost want to avoid this place because it's just more stuff that I really don't need.

This is the better outlet mall in Vegas as far as I can remember. It's an outdoors shopping mall with a multilevel parking garage. Last time I went to the one at the other end of the strip I was really unimpressed and haven't returned since, so it's been a few years. 

While it IS ridiculously hot out during a majority of the year, there are small cooling stations scattered about. All of the bathrooms and stores are well air conditioned and there are vendors or machines dispensing drinks at frequent intervals. Still, I'd come around sunset due to personal preference as I'm a nocturnal lass and dislike excessive sun. No, I don't sparkle. ;}
 
I find this a fun place to come and window shop or people watch. It's also good exercise, doing laps around the large rectangle trying to find any cool stores I may have passed by first time around. There are a lot of fashionable foreign people, most likely drawn by the Armani Exchange and likewise stores dotted throughout. There are stores suited to a wide variety of budgets if you're willing to look around. Even the American Apparel store had some decent prices on things when I ambled through!

While I didn't eat in the food court this time, I remember it being uncomfortably hot and the food unpleasant. There's a sushi restaurant and a Starbucks, plus multiple vendors, so it shouldn't be too hard to find quasi-appetizing edibles. But really, who goes to the mall to eat? It's all about the shopping!

As a guy, im not into shopping and trying stuff on, matching this with that.  Just get me in and out as quickly as possible.  But i do like a good bargain, and this is the place to find it!  

I basically come here once a year and get all my shopping for the whole year in one shot!  (usually on a 3 day weekend sale).

Deals i've gotten in the past
Quicksilver khakis, and board shorts (regular price $45 - 50) $15
Ecco shoes (regular price $150) $40
Izod polo shirts (Regular price $40 - $50) $12
Johnston and Murphy shoes (regular $150) $60
DKNY jeans (regular $70) $25
Perry Ellis polo shirt (regular $50) $10
Oakley collar shirt (regular $45 - $55) $15
Oakley double thick Hoodie (regular $70) $15
Quicksilver Jeans (regular $50) $10
Jockey underwear (regular $20) $10
you're basically looking at my whole wardrobe for the past 2 or 3 years here! 

So yes, i hate shopping but at such a steal, i can put up with one day a year and save well over 50%!  I never end up spending less than $300. I think i now understand women when they come back with bags and bags of clothes and say, "But im saving so much money."  To be honest I think I actually enjoy it;  So any place that can get me to enjoy shopping is 5 Stars all the way!

Some tips to save even more money is, create an account on the premium outlet website https://www.premiumoutlets.com/ and join the VIP club.  This will get you a voucher for a coupon book which you pick up at the Information center, this saved me another $35 last time.  You can also print out more coupons from the website that that are not offered in the coupon book.  If you have AAA (for your car) they can get you the voucher for the coupon book too.  the VIP club is good for all their outlet malls around the US as well, so sign up for each one you might visit.

Tips: Mall opens at 10, be there at 10 or no later than 11, when i leave at around 1 or 2 there is a crazy line out the parking lot of cars trying to get in and find parking!  Guess people get a late start cause they are up partying all night.  
Come on a 3 day weekend for better sales, you'll be sure to find something!

Makino's is a good place to eat, all you can eat seafood and sushi.

It's shopping, and I'm a dude. Can I really give an outlet mall more than 3 stars? Hard to when it's 106F outside and little breeze and shading. 

My wife and I thought there weren't many real values at most of the stores, just a bunch of cheap looking and priced older styles usually. The good stuff was rarely marked down more than 20%. Usually priced just a hair under typical retail prices. The bargains were few and far between. Good vibe to the place though. Nice crowds, clean stores, and fairly benign sales people. Go when its cooler.

It was a beautiful Saturday in October, and maybe that was the problem. 

The mall, and that's what it is, an outside mall, has a lot of great stores, but it was crowded, had no deals, and we left.

Probably will not include this spot on future visits to Las Vegas.

Yelp tells me that I have checked into this place 4 times-- that's it?!
I'm surprised! I feel like it should be more. I am infatuated with this outlet mall.

I can count all of Vegas' malls on both of my hands. Trust me, I've been to all of them, multiple times. As a mall connoisseur who just moved from LA, the land of shopping I can say with confidence that this is my favorite place to get my shop on. I usually valet ($6 not including tip) my car, although the parking structures are not bad here now that they tell you how many spaces are available on each level. Not a fan of the flow of traffic in the structure-- it can be a mad house, dodging cars left and right if you come on a busy day.

Here are some of my favorite places:

1. J.Crew-- This outlet location is the ONLY J.Crew in Las Vegas. There is no full line store in this desert. The service here is pretty great. If you are a teacher or a student, you can show them your ID and get a discount (even on top of sale items). Great place to get your work clothes and accessories! I am madly in love with their jewelry and shoes. 

2. Disney Store-- This location has great service and wonderful Disneyland park items. I scored on some awesome end of the year gifts for my students. Those lucky kids! Spreading my love of Disney one class at a time. 

3. Marc Jacobs-- Opened not too long ago, however their customer service is hit or miss. If you're a fan of MJ like I am, this place will have your wallet empty in no time.

4. North Face-- I never had to own a real jacket until I moved to Vegas. Come here for your winter gear. 

5. LuLulemon-- Also, opened not too long ago. Worth the browse, even though I have yet to really find anything really great here yet.

6. American Apparel-- This location has great deals on hoodies and tees. There is a full line store in Summerlin and also in PH. If your dog is in need of a well made hoodie, come here! My dog enjoys their comfortable sweatshirts in the winter.

7. Kate Spade-- Always a sale going on; definitely worth checking out if you like KS and their cute designs. Watermelon clutch anyone? 

8. Nike-- Always worth a quick peek. They have new things in here all of the time. Worth it if you are looking for work out clothes or sneakers. (pro tip: right next to the parking structure entrance!)

I used to always make an afternoon at this outlet when I would come to vegas for a weekend getaway. Now as a local, I still find this outlet worth my time. Maybe even more so than the typical malls around the Vegas area (Sorry  Sunset Galleria). Keep in mind this is an outdoor shopping center, so this may not be the best place to go when there is a crazy wind storm or extreme heat. 

Happy shopping!

Haven't been here since before I moved to Las Vegas (4 almost 5 years). It's changed a bit, not much. They added another parking garage hallelujah.. But parking is still a huge headache.

I'm usually a target or Walmart shopper for my daughters clothes due to location an prices but after coming here that's changed.

Hello $$$. Get back into my wallet. So many good deals it's hard nt to go crazy. Last week I sped $25 for a pair of jeans for y two year old from target but went to osh kosh and bought a pair of jeans and overalls for $27. Deal! Or steal? ;)

Love all the stores here, Michael kors, coach, nike, sketchers, fossil (who by the way has an 11 yr warranty on their watches) Charlotte Russe, Disney store, etc etc.

I think I will be Xmas shopping here but not in dec that's suicide.

The mall is a great place to be at but the 1 thing that downs tamale sense is the Parking. There should be more parking options then just the 2 parking garages. It's always packed & cars almost hitting each other.

This has an excellent selection of stores, much like other Premium Outlet locations.

Being here in March means outdoor shopping is great. I would probably subtract stars if this was in August.

Since I took a cab here, I didn't witness any of the parking issues that people spoke of but I can totally see how it would be a problem.

Discounts among stores are hit and miss. My wife really liked DKNY which had as much as 70% off while other stores either had no sale or had something pitiful in comparison. Why would I go to a factory outlet to save 10% over MSRP? There were even some cases where some items were full-priced.

The food court is poor. It has too few selections for such a large mall.

Free wifi would have been nice...

So clean! Large selection!
Amazing stores!
L'Occitane, Coach and Tag Heuer are my faves.
I love to shop openly in hot, dry weather so, there is that and the parking garage is convenient. 
Encountered friendly staff all day long.

The Las Vegas North Premium Outlet was one of the better outlets I had been to in a long time.  We went here on Thanksgiving day and this place was crowded.  It was pretty close to the hotel we stayed at.  The parking garage still had a lot of space left on the upper floors when we came around noon.  This was the first time I saw the parking garage with an indicator to let drivers know how many spots were opened and which spots were open indicated by the green or red light above each spot.

All of the stores were close together and separated by maybe a kiosk in between.  I looked at their website before coming here to know exactly which stores I wanted to check out.  After I walked through the whole outlet, I realized how small it was but had enough for most people's needs.  There was a food court which was pretty crowded considering it was Thanksgiving.  I remembered there were five different restaurants in the food court with Subway being one of them.

This outlet was good and I would recommend coming here to buy clothes or any merchandise.

My kids & I love to shop at this outlet mall but right now during their parking construction, it creates horrible traffic!! It took us over 30 min just to get out of there on a Saturday afternoon.  They have security trying to direct traffic but it doesn't help at all.

Also, the elevators are out of order in the parking garage. 

If you don't have the patience to sit in traffic after shopping several hours don't come here on a weekend.

Black Friday!!!! I thought I was crazy for going there . First of all I thought parking was going to be crazy, and it was, but I got lucky, found one as soon as I got there. So many stores, you just don't know where to start. FIRST OFF, don't park at the first parking structure...go to the one by Saks Fifth Avenue. I usually Valet, but they were full. Then go to the main office and get the map. I ALSO got the VIP passport for $10. Its full of great coupons, at first I got a little upset, because some stores didn't honor them, but then I understand, everything was at such great prices. But then a lot of them did, so I definitely got my money's worth. All the stores were well prepared. A lot of merchandise and great staff.Lines were going super fast. Got great savings....My favorite was UGG.I got 2 pairs. YOU NEVER FIND UGGS FOR SALE....anyway, highly recommend it if here in Vegas and don't want to blow all your money on gambling. Or go for it do it, I know it's a lot of fun, but  for my kids the outlet was funner blowing the rest of my money...on a serious note...great place, great deals!!!Have fun...  OH one more thing, if planning to do a lot of shopping, I saw a lot of people that brought big suitcase with wheels and stuffed all their bags in it, so you don't lose any bags....BRILLIANT!!!!

It was our last day in Vegas and we had been talking about going to the outlets. 

This is an outdoor mall and I was here in August, so you could imagine how hot it was! Parking looked crazy because we did come on a Sunday, thank goodness our friend dropped us off. There were so many stores, we didn't even get to walk around the entire place because we were on a two hour time limit, due to our flight. I didn't buy anything for myself, but I saw a bunch of things that I could buy the BF so I just shopped for him. =) 

Though I didn't have enough time to explore the entire place, I enjoyed walking around and shopping for the boyfriend. Maybe next time I'll be in a mood to shop for myself.

Really great prices and selection! Bought so much stuff for so little! Make sure you don't drive in because the line to the parking lot takes 2+ hours (badly designed parking lot). Also, make sure to go to customer services to get a coupon book for out-of-towners. I got an extra $10 off something that was already cheap! Need to go back with an empty suitcase...
There is a variety of good stores in this place...time to go shopping with your winnings, before you lose it all back!
lotsa shops, lotsa good stuff. better than primm and the south premium outlets

Among the outlets in Vegas this one is by far my favorite. It's an outdoor shopping center with a large range of mid-tier and high end designers. Burberry, L'Occitane En Provence, Le Sportsac, and 7 For All ManKind are a few of my must stop shops, but I often like to window shop at some of the really high end stores like Armani, Dolce and Gabbana, Hugo Boss, etc. There's so many stores here that you can definitely spend the day here! 

I highly recommend coming here right when the shops open (9am) to secure parking and enjoy all the neatly organized racks before all the tourists raid the shops. Also, wear comfortable shoes as you'll definitely be doing a lot of walking!

I am never let down by this outlet mall! Coming from LA, Premium Outlets are always a treat. I usually get a massive haul once a year here and i'm pretty much set for a good while. Very convenient and easy to get to from The Strip. Don't forget to remember where you parked! It's a big parking lot. 

Favorite stores: 
- LOFT, Fossil, Kate Spade, Francesca's, The Beauty Space, Marc Jacobs, Adidas, and Gap, Saks Fifth Ave Off 5th, Steve Madden

Very clean and well laid out outlet mall. They also have a food court and Starbucks so you can fuel your shopping sessions.

So.. I go to Vegas to eat, watch shows, and SHOP! This is the best outlet shopping center that I've been to! There are a lot of high end/designer stores with reasonable prices.

If you go during the summer, I would highly recommend going early in the morning. The mist can only go so far. 

Parking is not a problem. If you are stranded, you can easily take a taxi.

There are 2 outlet centers in Las Vegas, the NORTH and the SOUTH.

I've been to both.  If you're from or familiar with Southern California, to compare I'd say the NORTH is similar to Camarillo or Palm Desert.

The SOUTH is similar to Ontario Mills or The Citadel.

The NORTH is an outdoor shopping area, it has more stores as well as higher end (brand names) stores.  The SOUTH for the most part is an indoor mall, and has a mixture, 'tho if I had to summarize, has more working class type retail stores.

Parking is difficult at the NORTH, they have a parking structure that's covered.   Parking seemed easy over at the SOUTH.

The shopping clientele seems be comprised of more visiting tourists (and foreign ethnic)  at the NORTH and more locals (and urban ethnic) at the SOUTH. 

I like the NORTH Premium Outlets, as a male shopper for:

Dolce & Gabbana (D&G)
Tumi
Lacoste 
Ferragamo
Coach (for Men)
Marc Ecko
Kenneth Cole

It's outdoors, so when it's hot, it's HOT... but the store are all air conditioned, so gives you good reason to visit the stores and browse.

Some sales rep are so rude and don't even wanna greet you really
look at you and see if they are interested in you 
I also found the Coach store very out of place needed some organization so far i have to admit it was crowded but it look trashy 
Michael Kors the ugliest customer service the reps were so  discriminating 
That is not customer service that just selfish service to provide themselves good commission and if you are not dress they will pass by you completely and not even smile
Bebe was a way better experience when I went they had good sales ,clean, friendly

Yee! Premium outlets.  

I tend to just shop at Kate Spade and their staff is super friendly. Under Armour had some great deals ($17 for shirts), North Face had $50 fleece jackets and found some Oakley sunglasses for $70 with all the discounts. Plus Kate Spade was doing 60% off and it made buying handbags pretty attractive.

However, the expansion is not so great on the discounts. Walked into Tory Burch and there weren't really any deals worth taking. It was a bit of a bummer!

I think it's better than the outlet on state line, prices seem cheaper and they have Porsche Design store one of 2 location outlets only in the U.S., really good deals a must visit when in Vegas it's at the end of the strip near downtown...
got my bf to buy his first watch at kenneth cole. lots of good store there =]

Found some damn good deals there with brand names that I like, so overall, this is a great outlet mall to visit.

Couple of caveats:

1.  The taxi line at the outlet is LONG.  Waiting in it can take way too long.  Do yourself a favor and either a) rent a car or b) learn to take the bus.

2.  Do not take your girl there unless you have the endurance for a 3-hour shopping excursion.
Fast alle Marken sind hier vertreten, die man sonst in den Malls findet. Nur zumindest teilweise massiv preiswerter!

Selection here is good (they have well-known brands), but the prices aren't very competitive! Kind of defeats the purpose of an outlet mall. If I wanted to spend $80 on a shirt, I wouldn't bother coming here...I would buy it at home.

On the upside, it's a nice walk.

This is another place I must stop by when I visit Las Vegas. Yes there are Outlets in SoCal but this one is my favorite. It is worth driving the extra miles North on the 15 freeway pass the the Primm Valley Outlets and pass the Las Vegas strip to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets in the North to shop.

Start off with parking in the structure at one end of the Outlets so your car can keep cool in the shade. Use your AAA Card to pick up a coupon brochure from Guest Services to get additional discounts at selected stores. And "Let the Shopping Begin!!"

There are many brand name stores like Oakley, True Religion, Swarovski, Coach, Crabtree & Evelyn, Calvin Klein, Banana Republic, Michael Kors and much much more!! And a Starbucks for a break from the heat and hours of walking.

I would like to try coming here during the weekday. I imagine that it would not be as crowded as the weekend. 

Yes parking can be crazy. Yes there is crowds especially during holiday weekends. But the deals and shopping therapy from this Outlet deserves 5 out of 5 stars!

I wanted to hit up the after Christmas sales. My husband told me there was an outlet close to the Vegas Strip. There are actually two outlets one is the South Outlets and one is the north Outlets. We ended up going to the north Outlets because I wanted to hit up Gymboree. The sales were great but the crowds were massive. The outlets are sprawled pretty widely. There was a Toys R Us, Disney Store, Auntie Anne's (where you can get a Groupon for). There were lines at the typical name brand purse stores like Kate Spade, MK, etc. 

We ended up going and purchasing a lot at Gymboree because of the good deal plus the addtional coupon on the coupon book.  you can get the coupon book at the customer service place. They charge $10 per coupon book book unless your AaA Member or part of the military-just show them ID. 

Parking was fast but crazy. They have people directing traffic, which helped a lot. Will I be back again? Probably not it's the same as any other outlets.

lot of stores that are higher-end. I found a few stores for my kids: Disney store, vans, children's place, but i didn't find many stores that sold everyday women's clothing, which I was mainly looking for. kinda bummed.
this place makes other outlets look hella WACK... i love love love this mall it has something for everybody....YES EVERYBODY!!!!

Since I didn't party at Tao the night before I got an early start on my shopping.  One of my plans was go to check out this outlet since Caroline said they had a Ferragamo outlet and I wanted new sunglasses.  Since she said the sunglasses was just 100 bucks, hell yeah I was there.  Vil let me borrow her old car and I made my way to the outlets on my own.  Yes I got lost but I didn't mind getting lost it was fun.  When I got to the outlets I was impress by the stores they had.  Dolce and Gabana, Juicy Couture, BCBG just to name a few.  They had lots of stores I love.  I even texted my sister telling her she needs to shop here.  Overall one of the best outlets I been too.  Going to save my money and come back and shop.

This particularly outlet is located just north of the Las Vegas strip. The outlet has added a parking light indicator similar to the Cosmopolitan but I believe it is not fully functioning yet.

Of all the outlets I've been to so far, this place has the most variety of stores for my personal tastes. Some stores off the top of head were: Adidas, Nike, Puma, Calvin Klein, Kenneth Cole, Timberland, Nautica, Asics, Bose, Hugo Boss, Banana Republic, Starbucks, Merrill, Wilson's Leather, 7 for Mankind, etc.

The best Adidas outlet I've been to hands down. They have alot of other great spots and deals  UT Adidas was it for us this time. We had to buy extra luggage with all the deals we came across. Highly recommended

Most everyone has already done a thorough job of reviewing these outlets...so I'll keep this brief:

Pros:
Parking garage and security has a presence, convenient location, outdoors, great high end stores, clean, big

Cons:
Parking gets tight and backs up, elevators in garage are slow, when it's hot you'll work up a sweat getting from one store to the next

If you love shopping, definitely make a stop here on your next trip to Vegas!

I don't know were to start with this place. Don't come here if you are disable and try to find a parking spot. They have turned all the handicap spot into regular parking and closed off parking to even try to park close to accommodate the disable. When asked about it she shrugs her shoulders and was to park on the top floor where it's raining. When I tried to park close when a white couple was walking toward their car so I thought. They must have thought we were trying to rob them so they would walk in different directions so we couldn't park in there spot.

This is probably one of the best outlets I've been to in a long time because when they say Premium, they truly mean premium! Some notable goodies are Diesels at 30% off outlet prices, True Religion jeans at $99! and great deals on kate spade shoes. I can't stress about how awesome this place is and if I had an unlimited budget I would probably buy all my wardrobe from here still because it's so much more accessories, shoes and clothes for your money!

The only downside is that the parking situation is terrible on a daily basis and in the summer its hot like crazy since its outdoors and in the winter its cold for the same reason. Otherwise outlet prices + Las Vegas tax = happy shopper!

Between the North and South Premium Outlets, I preferred this one. The Las Vegas Premium Outlets (north) is a nice shopping place to get great deals. I was here way back when it was during Christmas time and boy...what sale after Christmas. I got a Coach bag here at a really, REALLY good proce. Then off course, I got ton of shirts and a pair of shoes here and plus the coach bag....ALL UNDER $80!!!! What a shopping spree at a bargain price! 

Overall, I loved coming here and I'll definitely be back to this place when I hit up Vegas again. ;)

It's an outdoor shopping center and boy, it is not easy to shop here when the temperature is in the 100's!!!  They have misters but it really doesn't help when the sun is blazing and glaring down on you.  They  have a great selection of shops, but I personally have found better deals at the outlets at State Line.  Found amazing deals there on Kate Spade purses.  Oh yeah and the State Line shops are indoor with great air conditioning which is a plus!  :)

Las Vegas Premium Outlets...you are so awesome. 
You are my favorite place to stop at when I'm at Vegas. 
I could spend hours just going around the different stores and browsing all the cool deals. There's just something for everyone here. 

It always seems to be crowded but yet there is room for everyone. We've never had a problem finding parking and we always are able to find the stores we want to go without too much hassle. It seems almost every store has cool deals. There are definitely good discounts compared to going to a mall. The discounts even sometimes get another percent off due to coupons the different places give away when you first enter. 

Oh and the great deals are not just in the big stores. There are also excellent deals to be found in the those boutique carts on the outside. I found some great crystal bracelets for a really good price in one of those carts! The only thing is it can be hard to browse to shop at those carts when you're under the hot sun, burning Vegas weather. Nonetheless there are deals to be found everywhere! 

I could go on and on about how awesome this place is and about all the cool stores but I'll let my detailed store reviews do the talking :). 

I'll end this review with the following: 

Las Vegas Premium Outlets. Truly AWESOME place!

Not sure who the genius was to develop an outside mall when the temperature goes over 100 in the summer time.  This seems to be a popular place yet they didn't consider the right amount of parking spaces for the crowds that come here.  Every time I come, I find getting a parking space a real challenge even with multiple garages.  Meanwhile, the shopping center is humongous.  You will need a map, and even with that, you will get lost.  Every conceivable shop is here.  Not sure about the Outlet label since I really didn't see any real bargins here.  But if it's shopping you want to do, then you will be in heaven.  Eating here is limited, even bad, especially now that Makino is gone.  So eat before you get here, bring bottle water in the summer and bring your walking shoes.

Nice store, great prices. I will say this one person was rude and would recommend she treat her employees better ( or at least not in front of the customers).  I believe she was in charge or something because disrespectful towards the other girls and made rude comments.  One person called her Tina.  Other than that, I would recommend this store.

Let me begin by saying that the only two things I care about when I go to Vegas are gambling and eating. Because of this, maybe that's why I didn't really care for shopping, let alone shopping at the Outlets. With that in mind, maybe that's the reason for my A-OK rating.

We came on a Friday night. The place was desolate. Which I guess, that's a good thing since there isn't someone else there trying to snatch up that last item both of you were eying.
