There were plenty of stores: shoes (such as Aldo, Nike, Crocs), clothing (Banana Republic, Columbia), accessories (Burberry, Kate Spade). This place seem to have it all.

And if you get hungry or in need of a drink, there is also a food court located in the Outlets. 

Be sure to bring your AAA card for additional discounts at select stores :)

It's an open air mall, so you know it can get hot. Their solution to help cool you off? Mist. Pretty cool if you ask me, but if you are out there suntan lotion is probably a good idea. The girlfriend and her mom love this place and they love going through all their favorite stores and sales. It's a nice, clean, and spacious. Probably one pf the best places in Vegas to find a good value.

Parking wasn't too bad because we parked in the structure.

I have been to other outlets, like Carlsbad Company Outlet, Lake Elsinore, Citadel, Las Americas, and Ontario Mills. I would like to comment that this mall's architecture is not as appealing as the other outlet malls that I've aforementioned. However, it does seem to include all the usual factory outlets, like Nike, Gap, Banana Republic, Journeys, Vans, etc. Not missing much, but I did not enjoy the experience as much as in the other outlets.

Ok people, do your research. #1 the internet or phone service in this area sucks.  I needed it so that i can compare prices in the normal retail store vs. this outlet but i was able to get it to work using my verizon mifi. so here's the truth, these outlet stores mark up the prices so high and they have signs saying 20-60% off and in reality when you calculate it then it comes out to be the exact the same or higher than any department stores.  I went to UGG, Nike, Gucci, LV, Michael Kore, and other stores I can't remember and every one of them was a full of lie and bullshit.  Save your gas $$ and shop at your nearby Nordstrom, Macy's, etc and you will be happy with the results.  These kind of rip off and deceit should be illegal and punishable by law!!! 

If there were 0 starts i would give it 0 in addition to the nasty food court they have there.

Its like Waikele Outlet for all you local Hawaii people. Except the BEBE there has merchandise on sale for stuff that is regular priced at Ala Moana. 

+ You can smoke hookah while the ladies are shopping. Just find the hookah guy.

+ Armani had a $20 sale when we were there in February!

Straight up fan. There are high end designers and mass market brands interspersed at this location. Dolce & Gabbana, Armani, Kate Spade, Tory Burch and Michael Kors rub elbows with Banana Republic, Sunglass Hut Chico's and White House Black Market. Way to cover your mass appeal bases. 

It is open air, keep that in mind during summer. You are able to peruse with water in hand, bring your own. While they do have vending machines, a Food Court filled with pseudo nutrition and carts offering variety (Sasapops, anyone?) it is not the best place to eat. 

For some reason, it had been a while since I'd been here but will be returning for sure. Like any other outlets, knowing your prices is key. Parking is a cluster, the signs have icons on them to remind you where you left your ride to avoid "Dude, Where's My Car?" moments after maxing out the plastic. 

FYI: some stores offer a Military Discount; Banana Republic @ 10%. Don't be afraid to ask. Our salesman told us when he overheard us talking about Nellis.
Love the outlet stores but have to pay $7.00 for self parking is ridiculous. I will have to curtail my shopping here.

One of the outlets in Vegas. There's a North and a South Premium outlet... I think I've never been to the south... always to this one.

This outlet has many store options like tumi, aldo, kat spade, micheal kors, etc.

We can here intended for me to find workout shoes in hopes it's cheaper than Hawaii. Didn't find shoes  but I ended up buying a purse from tumi's haha Didn't need another purse. Woops! 

This outlet mall has a weird shape, it's like a double square connected in the center. Seems big and has many stores. There's a cooling area where water sprays and many benches to sit outside if you're not feeling the shopping (hint you guys with the gf/wifey) these are helpful. Girls who shopped till they drop, no worries there's plenty benches to sit down and burn more paper.

I stop to shop here every other time I'm in Las Vegas so I guess a review is long over due.

Name brands. Discounted prices. 

Sizes are usually picked thru. Styles may be a little dated however there are deals to be found if you're lucky. My friend's favorite is the Coach Store. They're usually giving a coupon at the door. 

Makino's Buffet isn't too bad. 

Parking can be a pain.

I spent 5 hours here recently and was wondering how I could kill the time but I managed to go through the entire outlet in that time.  First stop was the Simon Guest Services to get your free VIP coupon book when you check in; otherwise it costs $10!  It has discounts for some of the stores and I was able to save $10 off at Charlotte Russe.  The bathroom facilities are very clean and there are plenty of places to sit if you need to rest.  Make sure you get a map of the stores at Simon Guest Services and plan out which stores you plan to visit before you start walking around.  It will save you time and energy if you visit the ones that are close by first and work your way around the entire area.

4.0- Did someone say outlets?  Why yes, I think I will.

Being Filipino, it is inherent that I look for a good deal.  Naturally outlets and I get along pretty well.  While I'm not the biggest shopper, and usually limit my trips to outlets to very specific stores (adidas, puma, some dressier shops) there are some outlets that don't have "outlet prices."  Yeah, not a concern here.

What I also like about this outlet, is the selection of stuff at the stores I go to.  I found a really cool Filipino shirt at Adidas, and I found an Iron Man watch at a watch outlet for $25 (though, I opted to get a $12 one that was just as good).  Dress shirts seemed to be pretty decent buys, and I found a pair of "nice" cuff links for about $20 (best before that was about $30).

A good selection of stores, good prices, and an ok food court (hey, they got Orange Julius), if you want to do some affordable shopping off the strip, come check this place out.

$5 parking fees.  I will not go back to this outlet. Bad decision I give this outlet 6 months to feel the parking fees and 12 months for the outlet to become a ghost town. Vegas locals can make you and break you. Did you not learn from the last recession.

Throwing around the term "premium" pretty loosely. Its 92 degrees on a saturday. Parking is packed (The only positive about this place is the parking structure lights that indicate in green or red whether a stall is open). But both elevators  is out of service. Going up and down 4 flights of stairs in the mid day sun.... alright it's cool, let's burn off yesterday's lunch buffet. But then inside the complex it's under going renovations. Everyone is gridlocked like the strip on a friday night at 630pm, all the while you're trying to peak over divider tarps trying to navigate which shop you might want to peruse. On top of that, only one restroom is available and hard to find. Stores are alright, but not that much of any real bargains going on.

This outlet mall is a must place to go everytime we are in Vegas. Mostly tourist here. The outdoor outlet with all the branded company that you can think of. 
This time with the heat, it was nice to stay cool inside the stores.  

I always check out Kate Spade because I love their wallet and they've a good deals compare to online. And golf stuff shirt, short for my husband and some other brand. 

Well I came from huge country with gigantic malls and moved to Carson / Reno area which has nothing and I barely visit the mall in Reno so hell yeah time to get crazy here. 

Parking is free at the parking structure & be smart shopper then you'll find a very good or dead deals!

11.29.13.

Grey Thursday/Black Friday deals? Yes please!!

There are two parking structures, there's really no difference other than they're on different entrances of the outlet mall; take your pick! If you are planning to go on a busy day because chances are they will both fill up quick!

The shops here have improved since the last time I had been here (5-10 years ago)...or perhaps my taste has also changed that much haha. Either way, there is a store for everyone here & prices/sales are usually reasonable/steals!!

I would def want to come back again for another infamous sale! I have to say the GT/BF deals were pretty amazing!!

Yelp 365 Challenge: #332/365

I have been to many Oakley outlet stores, but this one had so much of what I wanted I went back twice!  Pricing was terrific as it was a holiday weekend.  I was impressed with their selection and sizes. Something for everyone in my family including me

The best outlets around. The merchandise is fantastic the selection is phenomenon. It's a great place for high end outlets . They have polo and Nike and a lot of high-end stores. They also have food. And the deals are fantastic. They also have clothing store for kids and adults. This was my first time visiting this group outlets and I was so impressed and it's very close to the strip. I would highly recommend paying a visit . But don't forget to take your credit cards because you'll spend a lot of money there.
I very much enjoy visiting the outlets when I'm in town for business or visiting my daughter. All of my favorite shops in one location! What more can anyone ask for.

Absolutely love this mall. One of my favorite malls in Las Vegas. Many stores, great deals on clothing such as Hurley, Volcom, Pac Sun, Nike, Bose, Under Armour, Adidas, Zumiez, Quiksilver, and many other stores. Hours are great and the mall is big.

This is the outlet that I prefer in the Vegas area. Some of my favorite stores are located here; Coach, Cosmetics Company Store, Pandora, and Kate Spade to name a few. I've been here a few times. It can get crowded so parking may take some time. We parked our car with the valet near the Brooks Brothers entrance. There's also a valet near The Cheesecake Factory. When we finished our shopping trip, we were in that area. The valet attendants were nice enough to bring our car over from the other valet entrance where we'd parked. Thanks! Also, this is an outdoor mall, and It gets hot while walking around so be prepared for that.
Great place to shop. Has many of the name brand stores that most are looking for! Parking is great! Location is easy to find!

This is one of my favorite outlets in the United States.  There are quite a few high-end brands, the selection is great, and their volume sales mean new stock comes in all the time.  It is also new and clean.

Parking is decent with 2 big structures and an open lot, and it is also accessible via public transportation.

The only drawback is that it can get uncomfortable during summer and winter, due to the fact that it is an outdoor mall.

Okay love the many different shops and on a pretty day with good weather its a fun place to be. Hate the parking! Drove around for 15 mins trying to park in tiny spaces with traffic running everywhere. Its like an ant brigade waiting in line to park. 

They do offer valet and perhaps that would be a better solution. Other wise I think I will stick to town Center and or the fashion show. Every mall is busy but this one takes the cake for the worst parking set up, ugh! Avoid in the hot months as the whole mall is outside.

Came here on a visit from Cali. Very boring. Prices are hardly at outlet prices. They should have some type of entertainment to take your mind off of the ridiculous heat. They have water misters everywhere and that really doesn't help me when its over 100 degrees between stores. I actually hated my experience in the frickn heat.

Outlet stores just aren't what they used to be. I remember back in the day you would go through racks ala TJ Maxx to find your bargain. Now, these outlets have made for outlets clothes of lesser quality. Sure, you might find a "real" higher quality name brand shirt but it is probably either stained or a 3XL. There are many high end stores here and it does get very busy on the weekends, especially on Saturday. If you want to save yourself the headache, get there right when they open. If you wait until mid day and expect to find parking, it isn't going to happen.  Some weekends are busier, like 3 day weekends and such. There is an ok sized food court with choices like Subway, a pizza place, a Japenese restaurant and a few others I can't remember. There are misting fans that are spread out along the way to cool you off since it is an outdoor mall. The South outlets are trying to compete with the North outlets now, and are starting to get higher end stores there. It will be less crowded at the South outlets because they used to be the Bel outlets and omg we're they ghetto before they were bought out. Some of the oddness remains of the South outlets but at least they are trying. The South outlets are indoors which is nice but can get busy on Sundays while people kill time before catching their flight. But, I was disappointed by some of the prices at the outlets. I went to the Adidas store to look for running shorts and they were $25 and up!  I can get a much better deal at Dicks Sporting Goods clearance racks. I want outlet prices back darn it!
Really impressed on the wide range of store selections. Especially the higher end stores. Definitely will be back to do more shopping.

The reason that I like this outlet is that there is a Seiko Outlet here.  I talked to the employees.   There are about 14 Seiko Outlet in the US, but this is the only one in Nevada and Southern California area.  All the other stores are everywhere--nothing special.

One of the things we like to do on vacation is indulge in a little shopping, and Vegas is no exception! Since most of the time we like to stay downtown, the outlets are close to our hotel, so it's never out of the way.

There's a big variety of shops here, and you can find something for everyone. The prices here are pretty standard like most outlets, but there's more selection than the South Outlets.

The parking can sometimes get crazy, but trying to find an open stall is usually fast since they gave indication lights. Never took a taxi here, but it usually looks like there's a line? Which I don't quite understand in the age of Uber. Plus the taxi's line up too, waiting for customers, so again, don't know what the line is for.

The real drawback to this place is that it's outdoors. Like many other people know, LV has temperatures on each end of the spectrum. During winter it gets pretty cold, so it's not ideal. During the summer, its boiling! They have some mist sprays, but it doesn't help that much.

Recomendable al 100% y no olviden hacer su check-in para obtener una cuponera a mitad de precio, que es muy útil y aprovechas para ahorrarte unos dollares más, todas las tiendas son muy buenas y en el área de comida aunque hacen falta asientos, encuentras algo que te agrade. Visita y compara precios y trata de llevar ropa cómoda.

6/18/16
I wanted to check out the hype over Las Vegas Premium Outlets and see if it's really as great as I've been told. This is basically, a mall with mid-to-high end stores with discounts you generally will not see in the stores. 

This place is mostly and outdoor mall, which is awesome on a pretty day, not so much when it is blow dryer hot as Vegas gets, they do have misters situated around the shopping plaza. 

The food court is okay, nothing special, but this isn't the place to go when you want fine dining. All-and-all, not a bad outlet mall.

A variety of wonderful stores and amazing people to watch. Nike, under armor, asics, adidas, puma and reebok have great prices for sportswear. Feeling hungry? They got a chipotle and a spacious food court for those who love to eat.

Clothing? A bit pricey, no h & m here, but they have Calvin Klein, Columbia and polo here. No more Kenneth Cole as that was my go to for female attraction clothing. 

Auntie Anne's? Yup, incredibly delicious. 

Weather good? Nope. It's hot in the summer and the wind brushes against your face as you wither thru the narrow passageways. No more makino japanese sushi which is unfortunate.

Great place to ask a person out on a date? Nope, there are bars and strip pubs in vegas. Take a look at crazy horse 3 or sapphire. Prices are well rounded.

Two Words: JECKYLL AND HYDE. 

JECKYLL: The stores here are all nice and organized. Walking around, the clean up crew does a good job keeping the the grounds spotless. The food court is decent and thankfully inside where it is air conditioned.

HYDE: The number one reason I am not too crazy about going to this place and im sure that EVERYBODY that shops here will agree with me is that THE PARKING SUCKS! Every time I go here it takes forever to find a parking spot. When you do find one, it's usually between a huge SUV and a hooptie. Forget the fact that the stalls are small to begin with, the chances that you will have a ding or two on your car is higher than finding the lost city of Atlantis. With all the business they do here you would think they can add at least another 3 levels on their parking structures or least put more structures on their open lots. The South Premium Outlet has a better advantage because parking is a little bit better and thank GOD it's an actual shopping mall with air conditioning.

This place was a HUGE disappointment for my mom and I 

I'm unsure why they call it "premium" because there wasn't anything special or wonderful about this place.  They had mostly out of date brands or stores that made items exclusively for outlets.  They also had some designer stores but very limited products or nothing worth getting.  I've been to premium outlets in California and these were short from those.  

Another major complaint was the innovation that was taking place.  It was hard to walk around to stores because a lot of the walk way was blocked off.  It was frustrating.  Also convenient restrooms were nowhere to be found.  You have to walk a ways to get to one.  Their food court was chaos.  There were way too many people just hanging out.  Forget going to Starbucks, their line was out the door and it was teeny tiny inside.  I won't even mention the fact that this is an outdoor mall in Vegas temperatures.  Parking was also terrible.   

We both left with nothing, which is very rare.  For us, it was not worth going here.  We probably will never come back.

Honestly not a huge fan of shopping, but if it needs to be done then this is a pretty good place.

These outlets are "outdoors" so it can be really hot at certain parts of the year and then at other times it can be cold and windy. I've been at both times and I wanted to leave pretty quickly (because I hate shopping), but we had specific items in mind and we were able to go and find what we wanted pretty quickly with the large selection they have here.

Love, love, love this mall!  Unless you are here for something specific, be prepared to spend hours here!  =)  They've practically got every store you can think of.  Lol. Well almost all.  They've got an awesome all-you-can-eat seafood and sushi restaurant (Makino) here too!

Always a must when I'm in the shopping mood here in Vegas!

PS: parking garage is adjacent to the mall and valet is available as well.

I know the design of this place is meant to be outdoors and fashionable.. but seriously Summer Vegas weather is not ideal for this place.  Aside from it being outdoors this place by far hosts the best outlets in Vegas., Very very diverse and reasonable. Design of the outlet kind of stinks but the shops are well worth it.

This place is definitely one of the better outlets I've ever been to. It was first time visiting and a bit confused about the layout of the place - primarily the parking structure but thank goodness for Google maps! 

The one thing I like about the LVO is the fact that they have cheesecake factory and it's located at the end of the stores. Actually, the stores are located in an oval, so if you park in the parking structure, you will exit outlets the same way you came in. 

The stores here were pretty impressive and definitely better than the Primm outlets. Can't wait to go back!

omg it's like everything is inside the circle and you drive around the outside as long as you can until you finally find somewhere to park or figure out if you go into the parking garage and walk into the center you'll find a great selection of stores! The stores, the food, everything is great inside, but getting inside is the pain. Also, you see the Nike outlet sign but you can't park by it, so you drive around the entire ....structure, and can't find parking - knowing you don't want to park in that huge garage because that is real far from the Nike store .. ugh .. maybe the valet was the way to go. Other the design flaws, the stores are great :) you should visit this mall if you can stand it. lol
The best thing about this outlet center is that it is indoors and rain or heat wave, you can still shop comfortably.  The selection could have been better.

Out of the two outlets here in Vegas, this is my favorite one. Even though I'm closer to the South outlet, I'd still prefer to come to this one. 

This outlet is the higher end of the two. The other outlet has higher end shops as well, but not as many as this one. This outlet has shops like Kate Spade, Tahari, True Religion, J. Crew and Tory Burch. They do still have the more affordable and typical stores an outlet would have, like Levi's, Nike and Coach. When the weather is nicer in the springtime, it's awesome to just come out here and enjoy the warm weather while shopping. 

Cons: the parking is aweful!! This is a huge destination spot so you are fighting for parking with the tourists and the 2000+ employees. The parking garage isn't completed yet, so hopefully it'll get better. The heat during summer can be unbearable and this is when people go to the South outlets since they are indoors. Lastly, their food court is pretty lame. Nothing is appealing and there are only 5 or 6 options to choose from. Although there are little snacks spots around the outlet, like ice cream and pretzels. Solid spot to shop!

1 star for some cool stores other Premium outlets don't have.
1 star for the water misters throughout the area for cooling down on a hot hot day!
That's it...other than that the Desert Premium Outlet is soOoo much better!
I got way better deal on cosmetics (ie. lancome lotion I got for $14.99 at the Desert was $28 here) and the selections in the stores were better.
My friends also told me that you can get some better deals at the Fashion Show mall.

This is a pretty typical premium outlet mall except that it's so hot your skin will melt off. (No seriously it will) It has all my favorite stores: Coach, A/X, Kenneth Cole and Banana Republic. There are some good deals in here but a lot of stores only knock off about 20% which isn't much. Either way I always come here when I visit Vegas.

New parking garage is about to open... It's about time!

I love this mall - worked here for 2 years, lived only 15 min away. This was my go-to mall even on a day off, I could always find whatever I needed.  Just be sure to get here early, the tourists are amped and ready to go BEFORE the mall even opens. Parking can be beyond awful so again, get there first thing in the AM or about 1-2 hours before closing (if you know you'll be quick, the stores do not stay open for late shoppers).  

I'm so happy to see the 3rd parking garage finally opening. It was in the works since day 1 of working there (3 years ago!). Holiday's are brutal, beware! I head to the top floor of garages, but note that it will take forever ... allow 45 minutes for parking at prime rush times.

The food court is so-so but I love the Asian restaurant NOT in the food court, they serve beer! Men will love that! Their lunch boxes are cheap-cheap-cheap and enough to share for 2.

Pick up a coupon booklet at the info center (where the cabs drop off/pick up) - they are usually $5 unless you have a military ID, AAA card, etc.  Totally worth it, 90% of the stores are in there.

Once you are done wandering this mall (you'll need half a day) head south to those outlets, different stores for the most part and it's really growing.

I like this outlet because they have a great Makino sushi buffet in there. Other then that most of the store are still not open yet. 
I'm not sure why they call this place as outlet because everything is not cheap. I mean I'm from S. FL, and when I go to outlet in Sawgress, Orlando premium outlet everything is good price. But in Vegas outlet. Their price is as high as normal department store. 
Don't expected to find something cheap here.

I don't know what's worse...parking at Paragon or parking at LVPO...well...maybe Paragon wins the "better parking" award...only b/c if they run out of actual parking spaces...there's a dirt road conveniently located across the parking lot for you to park your car haha...

Anyway, everytime I'm in town, this is my go-to place to shop...I almost never leave this place without a shopping bag in my hand...haha

Came here for the "Day After" Christmas sale...I didn't know they had opened at 0700 that morning--we arrived around 0900, but were very lucky to find parking in the garage which was good...there were a lot of people, but it wasn't overwhelmingly crowded...YET... 

Went to a lot of stores, but didn't really buy anything only b/c my heart was set on buying a purse either from Tory Burch or Kate Spade...Kate Spade was a win...60% off (on top of that, selected items, which there were many of, were 40-50% off in addition to the 60%)...I got a cute black crossbody with a matching wallet...all for $159 with taxes already included...I say that's pretty damn reasonable given that the purse was originally $250+ and the wallet itself was $100+...of course mom bought a purse and a wallet to go with it as well...our total came to $237...not bad at all!  What's even better? The fact that we came at the most perfect time b/c after an hour or so the line was out the door...not just out the door...out the door, stretching towards the parking lot...wtf??haha

Speaking of lines out the door...mid lunch time, hoards and hoards of people started coming in...tell me how I couldn't get into Tory Burch...one line was for the people  waiting to get into the store...and the second line was for people to get into the first line to get into the store...like seriously??  As much as I wanted a purse from there so bad...I had better things to do with my time...like eat...that's always good yes? haha...

Anyway, definately do come here especially if you're one that likes to shop...but again, make time for parking cuz it is a bizznatch out here haha...it gets so bad to the point security can't even handle it...lol

Large outdoor outlet.  There is a food court and starbucks and prices seem good.

Fun place to shop while in vegas.  Worth checking out.

This place has a telephone number, which would lead one to believe that they actually answer the phone. However, after having called six times over three days, I can confirm that is not the case. Why do you not answer the phone, Tory burch outlets of Las Vegas?

One of the best outlet malls I've ever been to in the country, and I've been to a lot. They have your typical designer outlet stores (Coach, Juicy, True Religion, Ralph Lauren, etc), but they also have specialty stores and outlets that are very hard to find (Burberry, Dooney and Bourke).
This is definitely s must stop in Vegas. It's close to the strip, but far enough that you're out of the hustle and bustle of the strip. My advice would be to hit it up on a weekday as the weekends are so crowded some of the parking garages are full by 11:00 am.

Small walk ways & not enough food court options. Parking would be better if it were more centrally located. Noticed that it seemed to be a place to hang out for visitors before they head to the airport because several people were there with luggage.

Honestly, like most outlets, the prices really aren't that big of a difference. I've found the only times it's cheaper at outlets is when the specific store was having a sale themselves. I know this outlet has been around for a while, but it still looks and feels new/clean. The only problem, they have these fans that are supposed to cool you down with misters, but the dang mist always gets blown by the wind, meaning, no cooling down. Efff the heat. Effff it I say!

This is one of my favorite outlets in Vegas. It's a bit north of the strip, but not too far. It is an outdoor mall and reminds me of the Citadel in L.A. 

My favorite stores are Coach, Victoria's Secret, Nike outlet, and the Perfume store. I can never leave without buying something. 

The parking structure is a great plus here.
They need to have more misters up. On the hot days. I do come here everytime we come to Vegas
good selection. parking gets tough but they also have a garage.

I've been to better malls but I enjoy shopping here on occasions. I cant stand going places that are way too packed, so i try to beat the crowd and I always try getting there in the morning around 10am... no traffic, not as many people and not having to deal with people and their "random stop disorder" (if you're going to stop, at least move out of the way people!!!) and after shopping you can go someplace else to eat since the food court is such a rip off.  But while I'm there, I always have to go into the coach store... I love the deals they have there sometimes! I like other stores too, but my main reason for coming here is for coach and oakley :) I kinda wish they had more stores though... I mean, yeah sure they have plenty of stores, but half of those stores don't get my attention.

There so much shops here from Prada to Payless shoes and everything in between. There lot of food as well Ice-cream and lemonade. Lots of clean bathrooms with changing stations. One bad thing is there no free wifi.

I really like this outlet. There's a good number of stores that I like and it has a mix of high and med end brands. Some of my favs are Kate Spade, Tory Burch, Cole Haan, Polo, Gap, Banana, Zales, Aerosoles, and Ann Taylor. When the weather is nice it's a great place to walk around for a few hours. If you're going in the winter definitely bring a heavy jacket because it gets really cold and windy.

There's a few casual eateries and a Starbucks; perfect for staying energized during long shopping trips. I love that parking is free and it's a pretty big structure. I only wish it was closer to the strip since I don't often have access to a car when I'm in vegas.

lots of shopping came to buy things

dodged asian tourist to get to stores

spent money - would do again

It was a cold and stormy night. No, seriously, it was! On Sunday, the last day of our Vegas trip, the thunderstorm happened and it happened while I was at the outlets. So many wonderful options at this location! Bought stuff at the Disney Store, BR, and White House | Black Market. If it wasn't for the downpour, I would've shopped more. They have a great selection of retailers...even one that carries the out of stock items from Disneyland itself! (I can vouch for it since I've seen those merchandise items before on a monthly basis at Disneyland.)

It took 20 minutes to get to the top of one parking garage so that I could turn around and drive back out.   

I never got to set foot in the outlet mall. 

After 40 minutes of driving in circles without finding parking, I turned around and went back to my hotel.  Obviously they don't feel the need to ensure there's adequate parking...  I don't feel the need to give them my money.

I doubt I will ever attempt to shop here again.

Went to the premium outlet mall today to grab a couple of pair of jeans.  The shopping is similar to the last time I visited this mall.  Sale, Sale, Sale, is the theme and given; it's an outlet mall.  I love the store selection at this mall.  When you can visit brands like Cut & Sew, Ferragamo, Guess, Polo, etc and save money you can count me in.

The mall is heavily saturated with tourists from the strip.  Most locals would probably vote that as a big negative along with the lack of food and restaurants available.  Also, don't even consider getting a coffee at starbucks; the location is always slammed.

The new parking garage is also a plus even with the congestion at times.  Overall, the shopping mall is great when you have time to walk around  and your looking for different selections than Town Square and the Outlet mall offer.

I love this outlet place.  It's kind of between downtown and the Strip, and not exactly in the greatest area, but I love it anyways.  One of the few outlets I've been to where the stores actually do have worthwhile sales and there are a lot of fantastic stores to choose from (from Ferragamo to Brooks Brothers).

In the year that I've been here in Vegas, I've got to admit that I've never had great luck with any Brooks Brothers stores except this one where you can actually get a dress $150 dress shirt for $40 if you hit the right sale.

Absolutely love this outlet area.   Have recommended it to all of my friends and family that visit.  Oh, and there's a Starbucks right in the middle in case you need to wind back up for more shopping needs.

Wow!  What a place! 
Be sure to stop here when in town. 
Busy, lots of shoppers but also,  tons of great stores.
I'm happy I stopped in!

Outdoor mall. Many stores. Nice and sunny. Good for me. Not good for my wallet. Have been here a few times on separate trips to Vegas, and I've found stuff here each time.

Food there is so-so though. Took a taxi here one time from our hotel on the strip and it wasn't too expensive. Needless to say, a pretty short drive from the strip for those who are driving.

Nice. I liked this mall. Not crowded and stores were full of merchandise. Clean and has a lot of brands. The BRepublic guy was very helpful same as the Sunglas Hut. The MK are not willing to help but the store has good merchandise. The Asics store has regular priced items.

I've been to a lot of outlets in my day. This one is pretty good and was open on Christmas Day. However I wish that they would have advertised that not all stores are open on Christmas! Quite a few were closed.

The parking garage is a little crazy so I would drive with caution.
I only go there for lululemon outlet. Should go there friday since they are expecting so many people shop there on weekends, they have so many selections on friday.

Sales people were horrible in most stores and they wouldn't honor coupons that I bought at customer service. 

Katie was great at Max Studio.
Parking Sucks! Horribly unorganized parking structure with rows unnecessarily blocked off!  Cars just driving around and around! Very frustrating

Of the two outlets in Las Vegas, this is definitely my favorite.
It has many great stores, current fashion and for the most part filled with friendly employees.

I seem to end up here when people are visiting, they want to go check it out since it is so close. It is usually super crowded on the weekends, so if you can plan a week day visit it is easier to navigate through, parking, etc. 

If you are willing to deal with th crowds, here is the secret, all of the stores have the deepest discounts on the Holiday weekends! YES, it will be crazy, but I have gone a couple times and saved BIG TIME!

Regardless of when I have been, I end up with 2-3 bags of great deals, or some good basics that are needed.

This outlet has a lot to offer.  They have Kate Spade, Marc Jacobs, Burberry, Loft, Ann Taylor, Black & White, Max Studio store which pretty much cover my favorite stores.

I went with 6 friends who are shopaholics and I'm sure you can imagine how that went. Left us with little storage trunk space.

We came here on a week day during opening hours so it was not crowded.  I also glad we got first pick on most of the stores.  

This outlet is clean, My only complaint is parking is far from the stores.
Great outlet stores! Especially coach, white house-black market, and Disney store.

I've always managed to waste some money and find something to stuff my overstuff suitcase with here.  It helps that there is shuttle service from a lot of the major hotels here.  Even if I haven't ever used it.  It does get a little crowded during peak travel time, but hey, if you're in Vegas for more than a couple of days and are realizing that you're running out of things to do on the strip, the outlets are just as good a place as any to burn some time and money.

Great shopping good bargains and we were able to use the military discount!!  Mainly shoes shopping today.  The one change I would make is a place to really recycle . those of us traveling do not need boxes to add to our luggage so placing boxes in the trash bins outside the store is not cool

Okay so it's Monday night 8pm, we should had left from Vegas hours ago and I knew we weren't going to make it to the Coach outlet store in Barstow, luckily my little brother told me about this place, it's much bigger then the Barstow outlet store and double the merchandise. I got my coach fix of two new purses for under $140.00, as always I'm not complaining.

Great outdoor outlet mall. Great shops and prices generally speaking. I was less impressed with Juicy Couture, Nike, and Burberry. But Polo, Coach, and Dooney were pretty good pplaces to hit. I would come back but do get there early. I aws there at 10:30am and parking was already getting limited.
Great for a deal, always.  Some items last season.  Worth the trip, always go to the North, the South Premium outlets is nowhere near as good.

Yes, this is an outdoor mall and that can be tricky with the Vegas heat, cold, wind, and rain, but if you want to have a bit more elbow room to fight off the crazy tourists, I would say this is a better location than the South Outlets. 
It is a bit high end, but they do have good deals at most places. Just have to be there at the right time. 
It was a bit of a maze so make sure to grab one of the maps that all the tourists had to better navigate the place.
I did see mall security a few times during my recent visit so that was a bit comforting.
Not too much as far as dining options besides the food court so eat before or after or otherwise a pretzel may be your top option.

Cool outlets a mile from Fremont street.  Lots of premium stores but also plenty of stores that you can afford as well.  The outlets were just about complete with the addition of several more stores and restaurants including Off Sax and Cheesecake Factory.  There is a large parking garage and a taxi and bus pick up drop off area as well.  One note the outlets are outdoors so get there early if you want to avoid the blistering summer heat.

Compared to the Outlets on S Las Vegas Boulevard, this one has problems. Logistics aren't as good. It's outdoors, not a problem except on rainy days. Like today, yesterday, and the day before. No, I'm not made of sugar.

There are many stores with locations both here, and in the S Las Vegas Blvd version, and the stores on the south side have better inventory, and often, more experienced employees. Parking is across the street, but the parking garage confuses people and they get lost, as the driving patterns are changed and where to go is non-obvious. If I was pressed for time, I'd go to the one on the south side. Better overall, there.

If you have to choose between south outlets and north outlets, this is the place to be. Awesome selection of vendors from watch station all the way up to Armani outlet. All can be had at a good discount of at least 40%. I enjoy shopping the sales here every time I'm in Vegas.

Pay to get your car window busted out and car out luggage stolen. Would give 0 stars, if I could. Pay $5 to park and we were gone less than 1 hour in the middle of the day. Crowded. Bad bad bad experience -- welcome to Vegas ....

My parents were ashamed of me when I was born, "We think he got the waterhead from Diego senior's uncle Pietro," they would often tell friends.
How fucked is that?
Back then, people didn't use PC terms like 'Hydrocephalic', no, they used the more caustic, 'waterhead'.
Actually, as it turned out I wasn't a waterhead baby at all. I just had (have) a large cranial area. One that requires extra large sunglasses. And that brings us to Vegas.

Well guess what. 
Few places carry the elusive 62mm Ray Ban Aviators save for the Sunglass Hut at the Las Vegas Premium Outlets. 
I now have a pair of sunglasses so big, they manage to conceal:

 * Unibrow nubbins ( non-shave days)
 * Bloodshot eyes
 * Suitcases
 * Cleavage gawking
 * Dozing at company events
 * Skunk-eye
 * Crow's feet (maybe Eagle's by some standards)
 * Missing pupils (mine don't just dilate, they expand to the same size as Jupiter
 * Missing eyelashes (never grew back after last year's Labor Day Barbeque)
 * Welling up at the end of Dirty Dancing

I also get my 501's here. They have odd sizes in all fashions. 
I have "Hydrobooty" too. 
My parents called it a bubble-butt. I never liked them.

In Las Vegas nothing is free, not even parking. Nevada residents with valid ID may park for free others are 5$. 5$ to park your own car to shop around. That was honestly disappointing showing up and having to pay 5$ but hey it's Vegas right? There aren't jaw dropping deals here. The sales are average but this place does have high end stores like Burberry, Ferragamo, Hugo Boss, and a few more. But like I said there aren't great deals but I mean hey a $100 off a Burberry bag is a $100 off. Better than nothing. Overall cool experience with many shops. You can get lost easily and walk around in circles. I also like how this outlet has fans that spray water on you while you walk because that Vegas sun is HOT.

If you're down with rocking last years style, wallet-conscious and enjoy a good parking garage rage session, welcome to the motherload! There are great brand-name stores here and deals are easy to come by. The layout itself is easy to navigate and the place is always clean. Plus, some stores have multiple locations, so you can catch 'em on either side of the Outlets (unless I'm seeing double). Hungry? There's an AYCE Asian buffet (Makino) and a food court. The perfect spots to hang while your other half does his/her thang. Know this, the parking STINKS. I've had better luck in the southern most lot, but that wasn't the greatest experience either. Prepare to spend an extra 15min getting in.
If your looking to shop this would be the place prices are slightly cheaper than the norm. Outdoor malls are not my fav but it'll do . Also they have cheese cake factory and other food vendors!
Fun outlet! Decent amount of stores. Was excited to see Kate Spade there and all the stores are in close proximity of each other which makes walking easy. Kind of a weak food court though.

nothing amazing, It's like any other outlets around my area (socal)
lost of walking space. Only plus is seeing tourist lol.

In all honesty, I only come here during Black Friday since it's apparently a tradition to come to Vegas during Thanksgiving.

The stores here are pretty decent, I'll tell you that.  There's the "high-end" outlets like Burberry, Juicy Couture, Lactose, etc. but when you go in there, you might be a little disappointed.  There would only be a handful of items that are worth it but thing is there's only XXL.  I guess I can make a name brand tent out of it.  
Window display is lacking in all stores apparently.  
Food court is a joke.  How am I suppose to fuel myself from all this shopping?
Restrooms? Where? It's like trying to find a secret room.

Parking is pretty good here.  There's more than enough parking but the parking security are major douches.  They were controlling who gets which parking spot when a car pulls out and when they get it wrong they don't care and piss the hell out of you. 

It's not bad.  Not great either but then again I haven't been to an outlet that I loved before.   Good variety of shops.

Not a bad outlet mall with some good deals. Overall good selection of stores at varying price ranges. I really wish they had a Michael Kors outlet that just sold clothing!

Be prepared for the following with your visit: a) Waiting in line and/or fighting off hoards of Asian tourists at Coach, Michael Kors and Tory Burch. b) It will be hot and there is limited shade. c) Get your Starbucks before coming here. There are limited places to eat and one Starbucks.
This is a great mall when the weather is nice.  Great stores!  Sadly it's all ourside so in the really hot weather it is miserable!

OMG! Vegas the unofficial "ninth island"as we locals like to call it!! For me is also my shopping heaven!

As soon as I stepped foot on the grounds of the outlets, my heart skip a beat for pure happiness and yet sank shortly after because I did not have enough luggage space!!!

This outlet is so amazing!!! So many famous and high-end brands at half the cost!  Was super excited to get some new Tory Burch flats and the cutest side bag from Vince Camuto! Let's just say I left there very very happy.  A grin from ear to ear!  As much walking done and excitement it was to shop, sometimes you tend to forget the Vegas heat!  There isn't much shaded areas but the welcoming cooling AC entering the store makes you forget about the heat again! Much H2O needed when coming, so make sure you got yours! 

Big Tip: Wear comfy shoes and cool clothes! 

As for food, they have a small food court and vendors through the stores. The food court can get very busy through the day.  Luckily, my girlfriends and I decided to eat at a nearby cafe.  More healthier choices and intimate setting to dine and chit chat.

I come here to see the people that I know since I used to work in 3 different stores here. But everything else, I don't really feel safe about this mall no matter how much security and cops they put on patrol here.

Robberies and shoplifting is frequent. And I have seen the stall vendors get into altercations with random kids, you know, wannabe gangbangers that wanna earn their stripes.

I have also seen taxi drivers fight over parking spots, and a incident between a bus driver and a cab driver because the cabbie is parked on bus property that was meant to unload passengers. 

The people that go to this mall are the most inconsiderate drivers ever. They would rather hold up traffic in a parking garage stretching 20 cars, just so they can take a spot on the lower levels instead of just driving all the way to the top. Fights break out in the garages too.

Most of these problems are caused by LOCALS, not the tourists. The locals that come here start the drama, and the tourists either are driven away by it or see it as mild entertainment.

For those that are complaining about the "deceptive pricing", I will tell you this... Prices for outlet goods are decided by the BRAND, not the mall! For example, Coach Factory Outlet bags are considerably cheaper than their full price counterparts. However, Michael Kors Outlet often have similar price tags to their full price cousins, although the silhouettes are actually completely different. That means that depending on the brand, you can either get a actual discount  from a "transfer" item, or... You could actually be buying a entirely different product from the same company.

For each brand there are often at least three categories, Full Price (Boutiques), Outlet, and Department Store (Nordstroms, Neiman Marcus, Macy's). Boutiques are pretty obvious. But for Outlets, which could be a entirely different part of the company, they MAY get transfers from full price stores, which will get marked down. Otherwise Outlets will have their own collection to sell.

This is the REAL Las Vegas Outlet! There are a few other lame run down outlets in the Las Vegas area, but make sure you go to this one, LAS VEGAS PREMIUM OUTLET!

Who says there's nothing to do but gamble in Vegas? I personally hate shopping maybe it's a guy thing, but I hate looking at the same crap that's  never on sale. This outlet is great for men! I'm not into men if that's what you were thinking (that's what he said). Let me explain. Most malls are composed of 95% womens products. This is no joke! And the 5% of stores that are not women's I am counting the food court and gift shops that don't even sell clothing. I admit malls are great for guys to go window shopping for eye candy (go on ladies do your thang), but if you want some decent clothes there is no mens clothing! This outlet actually has stores that men will  shop at! Also, unisex clothing stores have a men's section and not just on rack hidden in the back of a women's store. There's nothing more embarrassing than wondering if something is your size and it turns out to be womens clothing. That's a nightmare for a straight guy. 

Van Heusen, Nike, Reebok, Adidas, Nautica, Calvin Klein, Keith Cole, TIMBERLAND!! One of the last Timberland stores open. Other outlets will only have a few big names and no section, but the premium outlets have what you are looking for. There's too much good stuff! Usually, I only get halfway through the outlet because I have bought too much stuff before I make it all the way through. 

If you are going to shop for reals, the Las Vegas Premium Outlets is for you. If you just want to look around, still go... but you should buy something because the prices are awesome. This is a must stop everytime you go to Las Vegas. The only bad thing is you may freeze your ass off in the winter and you will melt like a ice cream in the summertime, because this is an outdoor mall. I still don't get what the designers of this mall were thinking! Outdoor mall in Vegas?

Written via blackberry
So many better stores than the local outlets in my area.  This place is always clean and easy to find parking generally.
Love this place. Lots of stores. You find things you usually don't find in our beautiful Colorado since we don't have lots of st.

When I was at the LV North Outlet, the first thing I checked out was the directory so I would know which unique and rare stores I should visit. This outlet has most of the common outlet shops like coach, Nike, bcbg, nine west, DC shoes, converse, etc. Yeah so I skipped all those.  In the one hour that I had, I spent 45 mins at the l'occitane store and 15 mins at the Diesel store.  Wise choice.  I got the best deal ever at l'occitane!!! If you went to their regular store before, you would know that their stuff ain't cheap.  A shower gel normally costs $30, a 1 Oz.  Eye cream can be up to $100... A 0.5 oz hand cream costs more than $10. But guess what,  I bought a travel pack that normally costs $55 for only $32 which includes a shea butter soap, a lavender soap, shampoo, conditioner, shower cream, hand cream and foot cream all fit into a l'occitane clear plastic pouch nicely wrapped and placed in a beautiful and colorful l'occitane gift box! I couldn't wait to use everything when I got home. I bought 2 of these gift sets and a facial cooling mist for $9.60. I got a 10% off discount that day too of my entire purchase so my total came to $66. They gave out a free shower gel of $30 value to customers who shopped for $65 or more. So, my total bill was only $71 and I was taking home two gift sets, a cooling mist for face and a big bottle of rose shower gel. I looked at my shopping bag. I could not believe what I just bought. My friend later came to check out what I got after we went our separate ways. She spent 1 minute in the store getting the exact same stuff I got because that was the best deal I've found after spending 45 mins there! The staff were helpful and did recommend a lot of things, but I really didn't care for the shower products. There are not many l'occitane outlets in the U.S. If you are in Vegas and if you like this brand, this is the shop you must visit.

Another store. Diesel. I like a lot of stuff from Diesel. It's not your common American store because Diesel is indeed an Italian brand so it's not surprising that the outlet is not easily found in every outlet. Of course I was going to check it out! I was a bit disappointed that their women section fell short. If you're a guy, this is certainly a good place to do some shopping for stylish clothing. They have men's t-shirts for only $18, reduced from the original $55 markup, can you believe that!? I saw a bunch of Italian tourists in this store, duh...

The outlet has a lot of stores to choose from. It's big. Plan ahead and wear comfortable shoes! Shame on you if you walk out this outlet with anything that is full-priced!

I love the l'occitane outlet...

If in Vegas and you have an itch to shop, definitely one of the better stops. Just won a load of cash? Spend it here!

A good selection of stores to choose from, and decent inventory. Plus outlet prices. Not a bad shopping location

I had a great shopping experience at this outlet! Everything was affordable and so many sale! DONT GO TO THE ONEILL STORE!!! Rude ass people! I would not step foot in that place again! Rude girl with short hair! She should be fired! And another Caucasian hillbilly coworker cracking jokes and laughing at the customers! Bad bad customer service!!!! Besides that, all the other places were super friendly and great way to shop before the holidays!

I'm sort of a fan, but I wish they had a few more of the greats at this location. The other premium outlets across the country have some good deals. But this location is so close to the strip, not many fabulous bargains as one would expect. But it's cool.

I like the outlets in the fact that you can literally go in to the exact store you want and leave! And if its planned perfectly you can even park to where it's a direct shot to the store you want to shop at! Like any other mall try to avoid the obvious peak times such as the weekend and afternoons! It's most definitely a tourist trap for sure! I prefer to go to town square but if you want some good deals then this is your mall! Don't expect all of the normal designers stores like Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Prada etc you gotta go to Crystals or Fashion Show! Other than that great outdoor mall!
I love this mall but I was driving around looking for parking for 30 minutes. I couldn't find anywhere to park so I ended up leaving. I learned my lesson not to go on Saturday.

Don't go to the outlet all tourist have to pay a $5.00 for parking that's a rip off. Before it was free now Vegas is getting greedy all the casinos you have to pay for parking. Now this outlet is getting greedy better go to the outlet by the airport free parking. All the people from Hawaii we stay close to the greedy outlet before or after you get to the airport stop by the Las Vegas outlet by the airport and whatever you want the deals are as good or better than the one by the Cal and Mainstreet ! So what do you think should we pay $5.00 for that outlet outside of downtown Vegas?
Love my 6 pair of tennis shoes from the Nike factory^ thank you friendly staff^great deals^always stay packed up in there..lol!

Horrible! Horrible horrible. Parking is just horrible and especially the food court. I bought pizza from Villa and customer service is ridiculous. They look like they're mad at the freaking world. Cashier girl especially looked like she didn't want to be there and she had a really rude attitude. I mean, isn't customer service suppose to be about attending their customers with kindness. That's pretty much what upset me. My boyfriend as well had a horrible experience with the food court. Besides the food court, I love the prices at SOME stores. I would give this mall a five star rating but customer service is poor.

Good prices and just about everything is 50% off. The store was well lit so I didn't feel I was getting slightly defected clothes like some outlets offer, the Employees were friendly and very helpful, and best of all short lines! Only minus 1 star for lack of selection compared to online!

These outlets are the best, all kinds of designers have their outlets here. They had a Wilson's leather outlet, and nice and very resonably priced, great place to stop at either on your way into or out of Las Vegas.

A pretty good outlet with all the essentials but lacking kitchen essentials.

The parking garage here is horrible and getting in and out of it a challenge in itself. It took us 20 minutes just to get out of the parking garage.  It didn't help that we were there during the holidays, but we came out with the good deals.

These days, I find myself getting more and more disillusioned with outlet shopping. The merchandise is only so-so and you can get better deals at the mall. In fact, a lot of the stuff is made for the outlets which to me, defeats the purpose. 

I guess not everyone feels this way because there were TONS of people! What recession?! Between my mom, grandma and myself, all we got was a LeSportsac laptop sleeve, which ended up not even fitting my macbook. If you want to buy it, check out my ebay auction haha!

I was also super excited to see a Catherine Malandrino outlet and while prices were an additional 50% off the tag price, there were probably only about 20 different styles, 18 of which were hideous. The girls working at the store were also more concerned with gossiping and putting makeup on than helping any shoppers. 

Skip the outlets and head to the Fashion Show Mall!

Beware. They now charge an outrageous $5 for parking.  We used to stop by here every trip to Vegas -- spending hundreds each time.  But as a matter of principle, we refuse to pay for parking for a shopping mall.  They've lost our business permanently.

This is my second favorite outlet mall.  In my opinion it's better than Barstow, Primm and others.  The only one I feel is better is Camarillo, CA.  This outlet mall has a parking structure that is close and keeps your car out of the sun, and a bunch of great stores.  They don't fill the mall with stores that you don't care about!  It is a true outlet mall with true outlet prices.  My boyfriend and I both find stores we love and prices are great :)

A very nice shopping experience except for it being outside.. I'm not use to the Vegas heat yet so that was the only downfall. But they do have trees throughout the center that include misters. I always made sure to walk through these! 

The selection of stores were great such as PUMA, BURBERRY, ALDO, COACH, LeSportSac, and others... There is something to satisfy everyone (except for the little kids, no toy stores, possibly a good thing for parents!). 

You can definitely get a great deal here... Prepare to spend at least 2 hours here!

The outlet has many luxury brands that you don't see often in outlets, like Burberry, dolce and gabbana and sacks avenue. The outlet has a small food court with very few places to eat. The parking is $5, unless you have a Nevada, it would be free.

This place gets crowded on a weekday and it take awhile to find parking so just work your way all the way up the parking structure. There's not many men's stores and walking around in the heat really makes shopping time feel a lot longer. Not sure if there's really any good deals overall. If you already know what you want then shop here.

Every time I make a trip to Vegas, I make sure that I make a stop here. The first time I came here, I was in awe with all the stores and got lost and probably walked around in several circles before finding the stores I was looking for. Oh, they have maps, but that doesn't help me. I'm hopeless. /After my umpteenth time here, the novelty wore off.  Anyway, they offer a AAA coupon booklet, so if you happen to have AAA, you might want to get the booklet, which is located at the information office. Don't know where that is?  Just ask a tourist, they'll be able to help  you.  

Obviously, parking here blows, especially during the weekend.  But if you come on a weekday, it still stinks, but not as much. You'll actually be able to find parking, provided that you get there early, that is. Or, you can be one of those annoying people who block traffic while waiting for a parking spot to open.

The food court is decent, with a few food options.  The Starbucks, though, is always packed.  It seems that tourists think Starbucks is synonymous with America, or something.  There are a lot of stores to browse if time is not  your enemy.  Personally, I like going into Gap, Banana Republic, Van Heusen, J. Crew, Quiksilver, Adidas Store, Skechers, Nine West, Bass, L'Occitaine, and Crabtree and Evelyn.  I am usually able to find something in these stores. As a tactic to get you to go into their store, there are always sales going on, although from my experience, the sales aren't really sales.  Plus, I'm not in the mood to fight others for the sales merchandise.  

So, in summary, this outlet is a good stop if you're taking a break from losing money, er, I mean gambling. If you're going to give your money away, you might as well get something in return for it.  Just make sure that you get here early if you want to find a parking spot. Happy bargain hunting!

Las Vegas Premium Outlet North is the best outlet center in the Las Vegas area that offers high fashion at an affordable price. Some great stores are 7 For All Mankind, Burberry, Dolce & Gabbana, Joe's Jeans, Kate Spade, Salvatore Ferragamo, True Religion and my personal favorite, Tory Burch.....Yes ladies, Tory Burch which is always my first go to store when I visit this center.
 
The only downfall is that it is located outdoors, which can be unbearable during the summer heat when it's in the 3 digit degree. Overall, it is an outstanding outlet center with great finds.

I've only been to these outlets a handful of times but each time I leave with a ton of stuff for way less money than I expected. The parking garage near Saks is a pain to park in on weekends because of how long it takes to snake up to the top, but other than that this place is fabulous. They even have the stores arranged such that if you're just looking for one style of clothing (women's work wear for example) you can easily hit up all the relevant stores within a very short walk. Definitely worth a visit if you're looking for sales!

Oh, the typical outlet stores that you'll see at almost all outlets. But this place stood out to me cause THERE WERE STARBUCKS ALMOST EVERYWHERE! Okay, maybe not everywhere but I'm pretty sure I saw at least three.

To get to the parking structure from the freeway is a little weird. GPS told me to make a left when exiting but you actually can't. You'll see it when you get there.

10-15 minutes away from the strip, lots of great deals, tons of stores, parking is pretty convenient. 

I could see myself coming back again!

I think the North outlet has better stores than the South outlet.  My major complaint is that it's outdoors. And in Vegas, temperatures go past 110 degrees.  Even with the misters, I cannot stand the walk from the parking structure to the stores and in between the stores.  Parking is another issue as well. It's so crowded that you might not find a spot until you circle all the way up to the top level of the structure!

My favorites here: Burberry, Michael Kors, Tory Burch, Kate Spade, etc. Selections at these stores are pretty comparable to those of the premium outlets in other locations.  

If you go to the information center, you can buy a coupon book for $5!
Easy to shopping. Price is good but with limited selections. Location is good and free parking. Recommended.

I give this place 5 stars, because of all the outlets I've been to in he country this offers the most options in terms of shops and high end boutique.  Don't come to Vegas and not visit this outlet make it a point to stop and shop.

great place to kill time before heading home. lots of stores with a good selection of styles and sizes. i'm sad french connection shut down but this outlet still has many of my favorites: jcrew, boss, theory, joes, 7, and nike/adidas.

i don't recommend parking in the structure . it can get really backed up.
Awful. It's Sunday on Memorial Day weeken and Absolutely no parking. They had the north parking garage completely closed do not come.

These outlets are awesome. Huge selection of stores with really good prices. The Polo Ralph Lauren store usually has 40% off deals but if you ask a salesperson for help they will give you a flyer for an extra 15% off! We paid only $36 for a nice original Polo shirt. I prefer these outlets over the outlets south of the strip.

Nice Outlet in Las Vegas and very big here I spend time like 5-6hr for shopping and walking around. And so many tourist here too a lot a shop have special discount for customer and about parking they're have building for park for free but so busy. I hope they're have a lot a Restaurant in the future Coz sometime I want something to eat too. Lol

This outlet mall has a lot of shops to offer with a lot of high-end names attached. I had fun going from store to store and checking everything out. The parking was kind of far away, and the whole place felt a bit 90's, like I had walked onto the set of an old Saved by the Bell episode. Outside of the Kate Spade outlet, which was having a great sale the day I was there, the prices didn't really seem reflective of an outlet mall. While there were a few deals to be found of sure, most of the prices were pretty close to what you would find in the regular version of these stores but the items were overall of slightly lesser quality (lots of hard, thatched leather and plastic instead of pebbled soft leather, etc.). Some of the shops had lines and doormen the day I was there, which made for some interesting people watching. Overall, I would possibly stop by again the next time I'm in Vegas, but I can't say I would be terribly sad if I missed it.

Always a fave! Love how close it is to downtown. Scored some awesome deals at Disney & The Watch Station! My husband also finally found the Hurley surf shorts he'd been on the hunt for. I love that they now have valet. Maybe they've always had it but this was our first time using it. It's pretty slick in how you need to text when you're ready for your car. $8 is worth it. Also cannot wait to have Shake Shack literally minutes away from us. They will do so well there. Yay for no more going to New York New York for Shake Shack.

I have always visited the South outlet and I never questioned why I never visited the North outlet. I have been missing out this whole time! The North outlets are about 15 minutes further from the South outlet and is located near old town Las Vegas. Instead of being an indoor outlet, this is outdoors, but with a structured parking lot (weird that the indoor outlet has an open parking lot, right?). I recommend visiting in the late afternoon or evening during the summer as it can be scorching hot during the day. Why do I like this outlet more? There's similar brands on both locations, but this has a couple more high end brands that suit my tastes more, for example Kate Spade. I do have to say that the food court at the South outlet is much better than the North outlet. I don't think you need to visit both outlets in one day like I have, but if I were to choose, I would definitely visit this place hands down.

okay, i hate outlets.

Its like a curse. I can never find anything for myself. maybe its because i work in retail and know why outlets exist. but still i'm always down for a good deal. everyone always gets stuff but me. Wah. Crybaby moment of silence.

anyways the store selection is actually really good compared to other outlets and the stuff is pretty good. but never finding anytihng for myself is an issue. some of the stores the prices arent even outlet prices. they're regular retail prices. so dont be fooled!

These outlets are so awesome and are a must stop if you're in Vegas. There are plenty of shopping options, all with really nice premium shopping options at affordable prices. Some of my favorite shops are Off Saks, Scotch and Soda, Neiman Marcus, and All Saints. 

Be sure to stop by the Guest Services booth and check in with Yelp to get a free coupon book with most of the retailers. If you're staying on the Vegas Strip, it's about $10-15 one way to get to the North Outlets by Uber it Lyft.

Also, one cool thing the city of Las Vegas has is a shuttle bus called "Downtown Loop", which is complimentary and runs frequently. It picks you up and drops you off at destinations downtown such as the Outlets, Fremont Street, Mob Museum, and The Gold and Silver Pawn Shop (Pawn Stars shop). If you take it from the Outlets, it picks you up behind the Nautica store.

This is very similar to the desert hills premium outlet (Cabazon, CA) and livermore premium outlet (Livermore, CA). 

Even though it is hot outside, there are plenty of shaded areas along the walkway.

The parking structure is awesome. They have lights above each parking spot. When it is empty, it lights up green and when it is occupied, it lights up red.

Shoppers paradise.  Unbeatable deals.  High end retailers.  
'nuff said!

Be sure you stop by the info/security office to get your coupon book. AAA members get it free!

Surprisingly good selection of stores and good selection of merchandise within the store right in the heart of the city.  I found non-outlet full-retail merchandise at the Brooks Brothers store and Neiman Marcus Outlet.  Much, much better than the Las Vegas South Outlets, which was super ghetto.

Nice bustling place, full of tourists and foreigners (Croatians, Central Americans, Australians, Chinese, Korean, Filipino, etc.) speaking their native tongues. Yep, world travelers make our economy great! And most are ready to spend lots of cash and credit. There's even a guy at a center plaza playing some ethnic Chinese, dream-like music. 

I noticed a lot of people buying bags and rolling luggage. Are they really that more of a bargain here in the US?

Stores that I thought had good deals was the Timex store and the Nike outlet. Now if you want the best of the best an have $$$$, go to the Bally outlet, and find some limited sizes for Men's fine shoes. Yes, they are still $500-$600, down from $900-1,200, and they are exquisite AND made in Switzerland, yep from Schweizverein, so to speak. NOPE, not made in Italy as most Bally's are. 

Time goes fast here, best to identify where you want to go first then hit all stores pertinent to you.

Not a fan of this Outlet because there weren't many shops that I was interested in and it was outside obviously because it's an outlet. I wasn't a fan of that because it was cold and I didn't really want to be outside. One thing I like about is though is that they have a food court, and so when my sister ordered these fries with bacon, cheese, and sour cream on top, I got to sit down and eat while my parents went shopping. :) But, overall I'm just not a huge fan of shopping in these areas.

I'm never satisfied with going to outlets because it's always a miss with me. However, these outlets had very good denim stores like Joe's and 7's which I really liked. They have many different types of washes as well as fits. I added 4 more pants to my wardrobe. 

Also, while I was in the changing room at the 7's store, an employee knocked to ask if I wanted water...service can't get better than that. 

Why I didn't give it a 5 is because the parking structure is kind of a mess & those mist fans don't really work.

Outlet has a lot of high end stores if it's something you are interested in. Very similar to other outlets I've been too but not as big as other cities such as San Marcos outlets. Descent but nothing special.
Everything you can possibly need or looking for they have several shooing stores and everyone is friends they also have a large parking garage.
The north outlets are a little nicer than the south location, though they do have pretty much the same stores.

Came here to kill some time, and pick up some new threads/toys!

The Las Vegas Outlets are world renown for their selection of stores, and (sometimes) very good deals! While shopping here, I spent a total of 45 minutes (being a man who knows what you want helps - plus, guys can't hang like chicks can when it comes to their shopping). Snagged myself some slightly discounted electronics, and significantly reduced brand name clothing.

If you're in Vegas and have an hour or so to spare, definitely hit up the Outlets! Oh, and don't forget that parking is INSANE. Maybe you'd be better off catching a shuttle from your hotel, or taking a cab/Uber over here.

Woot for deals!

These outlets are the best when ice to visit Las Vegas ice to come here and get great deals now that I live here and I'm a local I get even better deals present your Nevada ID and show them that you live here and they would definitely give you an additional 30% off of whatever the markdown prices got a love the premium outlets

$5 parking! 

I come here at least once a year, and  this year their starting to charge for parking for tourist ONLY! I know it's only $5, so why bother? It's causing traffic going in and out cause everybody needs to stop and dig for money... might need to switch to other outlets... same great stores, indoors, less hassle...

Let's see.....Coach....Dolce & Gabana....Kenneth Cole....True Religion...Armani....Dooney & Burke....Donna Karen......Nike.....Burberry...Guess...Nautica....Ralph Polo Lauren.....Movado......i think you get my point. Enough said really just get here if you got some real cash to spend and you won't be disappointed. Eat, Drink...and Be Merry my Friends!!!!!
Lots of stuff' I loved the Disney store! And Godiva. The Disney store had $10 towels. That was awesome. Slcoukd have more bathrooms. There is also a cosmetic store for really good price.

I have never been to such an outstanding outlet mall.  This mall is packed with quality retailers, and I didn't see any vacant spaces for lease.  The mall's website is excellent and has a printable map/store list - you will need it, it is huge!

What is even better is that it is services by RTW buses to and from the Las Vegas strip.  This is 2 miles north of Stratosphere.

Banana Republic, Seiko, Kate Spade, Burberry and Diesel were some of the memorable and harder to find outlet stores.   There are a few low-end retailers too.

I come here quite a lot for someone who doesn't like outlets.  Usually outlets depress me and make me want to run for the mall.  This outlet is different: the stores are pretty good and the selection is pretty big.  I am usually a little too successful here and end up spending way more than I wanted to.  I tend to go on Sundays, probably one of the busiest days to go.  There are a lot of places that have specials on Sundays.  

I usually hit up...

Coach: they usually give you a daily coupon for 50% off everything in the store, etc when you walk in.  This store is filled with Asians buying everything before they go home.  I usually come here to get a cute wristlet or wallet for a birthday or xmas present.  I grabbed some sunglasses when I was here last.

Coach mens: I haven't gotten any coupons here but it has a good selection of briefcases and wallets that are on sale, good for gifts for my dad and brother.

Michael Kors: Haven't bought anything here but I always like to look for any deals on their iphone wristlets.  Most useful thing ever.  Perfect for clubbing.

Steve Madden: Help yourself here.  It is like DSW where you just look below the shelf for your size and if they don't have it, they probably have some in the back.  Last sunday they had BOGO 50%!  I got two pairs of heels for $70.  Can't wait to wear them.  I am a shoe lover :)

Cole Haan: Nike air heels?  I always check out their wide selection of heels.  I heard they are discontinuing their line with Nike though.

Banana Republic: I stock up on my work pants and work tops here.  Sign up for the emails and get coupons!

Sometimes I am more successful here than at the mall.  Its a nice outlet t omix into your usual shopping routine.  See ya there on Sundays!

They've got enough money to terrorize their Latina cleaning crew, who can't stop shaking, and hassle the tourists for parking fees, but not enough to keep their websites updated with the actual businesses who currently reside there.  Hence, you can spend a great deal of time wandering around looking for businesses which phones and computers tell you are there, but it's only accessible through a magic portal in the beauty school which only their students can see...

Shows you how low the bar is to win prizes from the Harvard Business Review.  Overrated and strictly for people who lack access to better alternatives.  And prepare to pay $2.00 for a bottle of water in the scorching heat and concrete; I'm sure a major profit center given how empty many of the machines are and, you know, all those prizes.

From Mandalay Bay hotel, it's a $20 cab ride to the outlets.  If you wish to drive, good luck finding parking.

In the end, it's worth it.  With stores like Juicy Couture, Ralph Lauren, J.Crew, White House/ Black Market, Banana Republic, Ed Hardy, Theory, Armani Exchange and run of the mill stores, like Gap and Sunglass Hut, I've become my worst enemy:  a credit card wielding, cash throwing, window-shopping-is-not-good-enough shop-a-holic!!!

Bring your bf.  You'll need an extra pair of hands to carry all those shopping bags.  

Stick to Subway and skip the Chinese food at the food court.  Too much msg.

I had not been here in awhile but remembered that there are not that many shops that I really wanted to visit.  The parking structure has been improved with lights that let you know when a spot is open (red for used and green for open).  The misters are necessary considering it was about 106 degrees while walking around.  The place was clean, but I would preferred to see more options for snacks or beverages.  The food court does not have that many good options.  The deals were also not that great.  Definitely a tourist spot.  Everyone seemed to buy more suitcases in order to carry home their new purchases.

Won't forget my Boxing Day experience here. Crazy!

Phenomenal selection of stores here, with an emphasis on clothing. It's not all big names either; lots to choose from.

It's outdoor, which is worth mentioning. More importantly, it's impossible not to pick up a bargain.

Poor food options for such a big mall. Get it sorted!

Love shopping at the Premium North outlet!  It has some of the better brands compared to the South outlet which is a little less designer and a little more 'blah'.  My main problem with the outlet, though, is the extreme lack of parking on busy weekends and their security's ineptitude in handling it. 
If you go there, stop by the customer service office and pick up a coupon voucher book with lots of coupons in it for $5 or free with AAA.  It has a lot of great discounts inside of it.
This mall is great! The cosmetics store was my favorite!!! The lululemon outlet was a dream come true. Everything about this mall was amazing!

This large outlet mall is located several blocks from the hustle & bustle of The Strip. This is not walkable from the Strip so you should plan on some form of transportation to get you there. It is not as large as some of the other Premium Outlet Malls I have been to but they have quite a few nice stores.
