Some of the stores are Banana Republic, Dolce and Gabbana,  Benetton, Kenneth Cole, Coach, White House | Black Market , French Connection and Calvin Klein.  I found a great deal on a shirt that I wore to a Christmas party last year.

Huge outlet about 10 min drive north of vegas. It's an outdoor one and there are lots of stores like Nike, Juicy, Pacsun, Vans, Gap, Coach, Tory Burch, etc. There wasn't much of a sale going on Mother's day weekend and the size of the shops are actually pretty small compared to other outlets. Overall I'd say it isn't worth your while to go out of your way here. I actually prefer the Indoor outlet at Primm or the outlet near the airport

Why have I not shopped here before! This mall is seriously awesome. With stores like Guess, Marciano, Juicy, J.Crew, Banana Republic, Joes Jeans, etc etc you will walk away a very happy shopper! I came here recently for a few business casual outfits after discovering this was the last standing J.Crew shop in Vegas and fell in love with the mall. Ive always been an avid Fashion Show girl, but this def comes in a close second. I couldnt believe how cheap everything is. I will no longer be paying $300 for a pair of Joes Jeans hooray! If you can ignore the rude tourists then I highly suggest this place.

I've been to this outlet a few times and it's always a hit or miss.  I'm generally not a fan of outlet malls but they have good stores.  

It's a good layout and close proximity to the strip if you had to take a cab.  Lots of parking available if you're driving.  I've never taken public transit here because ain't nobody got time for that.  If you're a visitor, it might be worth your time to rent a vehicle if someone is comfortable driving.  Renting a car is inexpensive in Las Vegas with free parking anywhere to be had, but I digress.

One of the better premium outlets - but I'm comparing this to Seattle Premium Outlet which isn't so great.  They have a lot of middle end stores and you'll likely find something for yourself.  I can't speak on the dining choices as I've never been here long enough to get hungry.  From the directory it lists some limited and pretty regular choices like Subway, Auntie Anne's, Starbucks, etc.  Come already fed.
No different than the premium outlet malls in other cities, but the discounts here at too good to ignore. Worth a visit if you're in Vegas for a couple of days.

I'm not an outlet connoisseur be any measure, but I will say that the LV premium outlet is definitely premium.  

Top tip: Before you get there, map out your plan of attack. Be like the Chinese tourists and bring an empty suitcase. Saddle up and get to work!! 

Things I learned: Nike is the anchor store and it's nowhere near the Uber drop-off (by Cheesecake Factory). IMO the North Face doesn't have a lot of desirable clothes and the staff was pretty rude.

Enjoy the ride!

So the fam and I come here everytime we go to Las Vegas. Living in San Diego, where else can you get the best deals on swim wear, and clothes in general. They have a few beach-y stores, beach in Las Vegas? I don't think so. So whenever we go here I end up buying an load of Billabong, Ripcurl, Hurley, etc. you know those kinda brands. Luckily we usually go to Las Vegas during Christmas, bright sunny days and 40 degrees or less weather. Who doesn't love outlets? They have a variety of stores where you can find fabulous bargains.

Standard fare of outlet malls.  Slightly better offerings in terms of luxury, Dolce and Gabanna, Armani, Burberry, Tory Burch - and others.  -  But not even comparison with the outlet malls near Palm Springs.  Just OK.

BECAUSE, I used to work in this crazy outlet, I am writing a review. Let me just say, the Las Vegas Premium Outlets center is by far, the best one I've been to as far as actual "shoppability". Unlike The Las Vegas Outlet Center on LV Blvd. that has outdated and generic stores in its directory. 

I used to live in Hawaii for a few years, so, the fact that this shopping center is an "outdoor" shopping center, it adds to my overall satisfaction with this place. 

My favorite stops here are:
Gap, Banana Republic, French Connection, Puma, Levis and American Apparel!
A few mentionables: Nike, Kenneth Cole, Robert Wayne, Quiksilver, Volcom, Pac Sun, White House | Black Market, Lacoste, Calvin Klein,  Armani Exchange, Charlotte Russe, and some others that have slipped my mind at this moment.

I worked at one of the women's retail shops here for a 1.5 years and have to say that I've met some awesome out-of-towners! But, I do have a few complaints in the time I was working there:
1) NO BURGER JOINT in the food court.! Out of all the things to eat, sometimes I just wanted a simple burger... -sigh-
2) HORRIBLE time finding parking even with TWO multi-level parking garages/lack of employee parking only spots.
3) The "local" shop-lifters/less-than-friendly patrons.

Besides that, I've been to this shopping center 2 times for the "Black Friday" Sales, and have never walked out with a thing, but still was satisfied with my window-shopping. On most other random shopping days, I walk out of the center with at least 3 tops! score..

Definitely would recommend going on a weekday, early! When the shopping center is about to open to avoid the crowded walking spaces, and parking garage hell-hole.

Great stores at this spot, just a short drive off The Strip...great boutique outlets like Ferragamo, Armani, Tahari, Levi's, Ted Baker...
 
If you are a total fashionista/fashionisto, plan to spend a few hours since you'll want to take your time going through all the merchandise.  The food options aren't great, but, then again, you don't come here to eat...

I have a love hate relationship for outdoor shopping.  When it's scorching hot outside I absolutely hate it! 

There are a fair amount of reasonably priced stores here. I didn't find any crazy deals! I regret not visiting the Michael Korrs store. My friend found a really good deal on her bag!

Great location with a great selection of stores: there is something for everyone here. I am alway happy to see a Coach outlet and this location has one. The food selection is nice also honestly you could spent at least 6 to 8 hours here easy; but do your self a favor an are in the spot that is directly behind the shops otherwise you are left to lug are all your treasure back to the parking structures located on both ends of the Outlet.

It wasn't that great. 

Although reduced prices were cool, their selection simply sucked. I went into Juicy, Hugo Boss, Diesel, Ralph Lauren, Guess, FCUK, AX, Lacoste, Seven for all Mankind, and True Religion... but I only walked out with a shirt for work. yeah, sad, huh....

to me, shopping at the Beverly center, Santa Monica Promenade, Century City or The Grove seems a lot more worth it. 

Save yourself some time and go to the Fashion Show center or Venetian.
Much better than dessert hills in terms of brands, Helmut Lang and Marc Jacob store ate pretty good with more sizes

CONS
1. Outdoors (only because every knows its ridiculous hot in summer and chilly in winter.)
2. Parking- South or surface lots are a disaster! (Suggestion: Try to parking in the North Garage. Its smaller but usually less congested.)
3. Some stores are not really outlet stores they are regular retail stores.
4. Not a great food court (so don't get hungry while your shopping here.)

PROS
1. Great variety of stores.
2. Great prices year round (in the outlet stores.) 

With all the being said the PROS still out weigh the CONS because great prices and great selection conquer all!  I always enjoy my shopping experience here and it is the better of the two outlets here in Vegas. If thus place wasnt sucha mad house to prk i think it owuld have gotten 5 stars from me.

Outlet malls are one of my favorite things in the world. 

Before I elaborate, I have a caveat. I actually dislike the crowds, food courts, unnecessary discount stores (charlotte ruse, rue 21...these stores are already cheap in regular malls and there is absolutely no reason they should have an outlet store) and the general reminder of the materialism/hedonism in society. 

Other than the above, outlet malls are one of my favorite things in the world. Not only do they provide many reasonable purchase options, they are also an amazing workout tool. Walking around multiple times in the outlet mall perusing selections (esp in the sauna like heat in Vegas) will guarantee a loss of at least a pound. 

The Las Vegas Premium Outlets are just a class above the rest. The area is neat and well organized. There is plenty of parking (note to locals: avoid holidays and weekends as it gets crazy there) and the most important thing of all: the stores that are featured in this mall are out of this world. 

I personally love the Kate Spade, Michael Kors, Banana Republic, JCrew, Ralph Lauren, L'Ocittane, Gap, Calvin Klein and Company Outlet (makeup) stores. I cannot tell you the number of deals I have scored here. I am currently using a Kate Spade beautiful canvas beg with brown piping for my laptop that has a red and gold polka dotted inner lining...CUTE! And guess what...all this fanciness for under 50 bucks. My entire cardigan collection has been procured from JCrew (the Jackie O collection) and it was at a very attractive price of $19.50 each. There are so many things in my closet and home that I thank this outlet mall for. 

The LV Premium Outlets have also never disappointed any family/friend that has come into town to visit. My New York living yuppie girlfriends swear by the Theory outlet store here and my mom and aunts have spent hours in the Coach store. Even my dad (who buys like one thing every 5 years) did some damage at the Dockers store. If you are spending any time in Vegas, be sure to spend an afternoon at this mall. It's a great way to spend an afternoon walking around, having fun and procuring some cute items at great deals! You will be very very happy you did.
Very big outdoor mall! Has good stores like my favourites: j crew, gap, banana republic, etc. there's a store for everyone. There's also le sportsac outlet, which I have never seen elsewhere!

We were not planning on visiting this location as we had been to the South Outlet Mall and had spent a very pleasant afternoon shopping there.  However in our attempt to go to Fremont Street to get a Fried Twinkie we ran into a HORRENDOUS traffic jam and street closures.

Every Free Parking structure had a sign that parking was $20.  We knew something was going on as the Police presence was ENORMOUS.  However we were clueless as to what.
It took us forever to get out of the area and our GPS was not helpful as it dumped us right into the traffic going to this mall.  Lots of folks going to the event on Fremont Street (which turned out to be something called Life is Beautiful- it sure was not BEAUTIFUL STUCK IN TRAFFIC)
decided $20 was too rich for them and had infiltrated parking at this mall.  A LOT of Cabbies were also dropping people off.  It took us FORTY FIVE MINUTES to get to the parking structure to park.  We were lucky and got a spot on the first floor.  

Now onto the review of the mall. 

It does not even begin to measure up to the South location.  It does not have the stores or the selection. It seemed to attract a differen kind of clientele. many of the stores blared music that was so obnoxious it  deterred us from going in orvstaying in the store. The Nike store being one of the worst and clearly we were not the demographic they want in their store.

If you want a pleasant shopping experience go to the Outlet Mall South.

Note to self: 

40% Lesportsac outlet discounts for the entire store

Cole Haan - Scored some good stuff here with additional 30% off.

Las Vegas Premium Outlets has always been the better of the Las Vegas area outlet malls. However, since they have redone the outlets down on the south end of Las Vegas Boulevard and made them into Las Vegas Premium Outlets North the original location has really lost its edge. The store selection here is now only SLIGHTLY better instead of being way better. And the southern location while crowded is not as mobbed as the original. This place has great hours; especially a plus is that it is open late on Sunday (after 6 PM). Considering this is 2014 and the era of internet shopping and a 24-7 town, they often get my business when I need to shop on a Sunday and the malls close early in Vegas. This mall is great for people watching as well! However, this mall is also the 'United Nations' of Las Vegas because it is so overrun with foreign tourists, many whom are rude or stupid and roll suitcases around and shove clothes in them. I guess this is why they sell heavy coats and fleece in many of the stores here considering you will only wear those on a handful of instances during a winter day in Las Vegas and maybe 30 times at night a winter. The only negative about the location is it is not in walking distance to any tourist areas (maybe downtown if you really want to walk) and for locals near the Spaghetti Bowl which is a major mess most of the time due to traffic. If you are on the south end of the valley, try the south outlets or even consider driving to Primm to the Outlet Mall there.

Great shopping close to Main Street and the downtown casinos.  It's also down the road from the Strip and is a great place to while the hours away if you don't gamble. 

I shop here twice a year with family and friends as it's pretty affordable.  We split up and shop for a couple of hours then meet at Makino's for AYCE Japanese food and sushi buffet and show each other what we found.   

This trip my friend found $10 Fossil watches and a $6 long-sleeve t-shirt at The Gap.  I had some luck at the Tumi store this time with 50% off of some of their leather goods and luggage.  

I've never had much luck with the clothes and find it hard to find anything decent.  I've also noticed that some of the stores don't really offer much of a discount.  I've had good luck at the Coach and Cole Haan store where they often have 30% off of their sale prices.  The Le Sports Sac store is extremely overpriced and empty.

This review is more for the food court than the stores. First a brief review of the stores mainly they have a great selection of stores Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G and many more expect at least more than a couple of hours to go through the whole thing keep in mind this is all outdoors so dress accordingly especially during the summertime. Now on to the food court well not much of a selection you have Japanese and Chinese, Subway and Italian I actually had pizza for lunch it was ok good enough for my taste buds i also got to sample the teri chicken from the Japanese place and orange chicken from the Chinese place both were good but they could have better food.

Nadia was so kind and know exactly how to provide great service. However I was very displeased with the Latin lady with long hair. My mother asked the lady how much a shirt cost and she told her dismissively "40% off the tag"... mind you after my mom said "the rack says 40% off, can you tell me the exact price?" The lady walked away.

In the fitting room I asked the same lady, if there was a different size. The lady said, "I don't know, go check the rack". Wowzers!

Great selection if you are looking for purses or high-end fashion.  Not the most fun place for an average guy to shop.  After shopping at the fashion mall on the strip, I'm convinced that the prices are exactly the same.  They seem to just START the prices higher, so that they can be marked down more.

As we drove to Vegas, I watched the outlet malls pass me by one by one. Tanger, Primm, Las Vegas Premium Outlets South. I was worried... those outlets looked big and awesome and I was worried the LV Premium Outlets North would disappoint. But my boyfriend assured me that we were going to the best outlet of them all.

Thanks Andy W. for recommending this outlet mall, it was everything my little heart desired and more. My favorite stores were: 2b by Bebe, Aldo, Coach, Nike, and of course Joe's Jeans. The bf was an amazing sport and shopped with me for over 4 hours.

I hate crowds and so this outlet catered to my picky shopaholic self perfectly. Everything was right there and not overly crowded. For any LA or OC people, the layout of this outlet mall is exactly the same as The Block at Orange. I seriously felt that I was walking around at the Block, but at outlet prices. Way better than the large, non-pedestrian friendly design of Camarillo or Desert Hills outlets.

The food court was severely lacking and if we hadn't been starving we would have skipped it.

= ALTERNATIVE ACTIVITY IN LAS VEGAS =

I had to find some ways to burn off the calories after I stuffed my face at the buffets, and I know for a fact that sitting in front of a blackjack table or slot machine is not going to help much.

You can only window shop when you are shopping on the strip, but you can really shop when you are visiting the Premium Outlets.  There are many stores available: Nike, Puma, Oakley Vault, Burberry, Michael Kors, Coach, etc.  There is something for everyone.  

I wouldn't say they have the best discount, but anything discounted is better than regular priced, right?  The only downside to shopping at this Outlet is that it is outdoor and it makes me want to melt when I am trying to cover all the stores with my purchases in 110 heat.

Overall, I wouldn't say I love it, but this is an outlet worth strolling around if it is not too hot.

When ever I am in Vegas the outlets are a must, there are always good sales going on at my favorite stores and I make it a point to stop in before I leave Vegas. The only problem I have is the attitudes the taxi drivers have, if drive is not long enough so they make money, they refuse and make up an excuse to not drive you. I hope they fix that, other than the taxi's I will still go there and hit up my favorite stores.
Expanded food services and parking is excellent.  Good variety of retailers.  Summer weather can be stifling but October was comfortable!!

This is a pretty cool space to walk around, even if you don't intend on buying anything. Though obviously, shopping is the main reason one would come here.

Parking can be a little chaotic, even on a weekday. It's free with a local ID, otherwise it's $5.

If you check in on yelp, you can receive a savings passport book at the guest services kiosk. Some stores have better deals than others.

It's pretty well-maintained and there are so many shops to choose from. I was surprised to see that the stores were so well-organized, considering the massive amounts of people who were shopping.

My husband and I were mostly browsing, but we did find some good deals. My husband bought two pairs of Vans shoes for about $75, which is a steal.

I will definitely be back the next time I need new clothes or shoes.

I absolutely love these outlets!! Especially the coach outlet! I left vegas with tons of great memories and a fabulous new purse!

Regular price: $ 359

Price I paid: $98!

Oh yea, it was worth it :)

Premium Outlets are Premium outlets. The North is outdoor where the South is indoor.  I think North has better stores than South but that's my preference of stores. You get Kenneth Cole at North versus Quick Silver at South.  But some are duplicated at both.

Food court needs improvements. Out of 5 restaurants, 2 are Chinese Panda Express -like. They have other eateries but the food court area only has 5 restaurants.  Needs more variety and/or just more.

Diesel outlet. That is all. Even though I've never bought anything from here...it's just cool to see.

The North outlets is definitely much better than the South. Its got more and better stores all around, and looks nicer overall. The only bad thing about it is that it's further away from the Strip than the south is, so be prepared to do some driving to get here.

The "security guards" are seriously the biggest dicks ever.... The parking is horrendous and they actually TOW THEIR OWN EMPLOYEES OUT OF THE DESIGNATED EMPLOYEE PARKING.  Go to south outlets... At least you know your car will be safe.  Security calls the tow truck drivers to tow their own people... What the hell?  They are rude and no offense, but if there really was a serious situation that would happen at the outlets,  they would be the first to Segway outta there and leave you stranded and helpless.
Found such great deals here expect to spend the day here.. Look slowly u will find ur deals

Great stores. Very clean but gets low marks for two reasons. 1 parking is next to impossible. 2 the food court is awful!!

New Michael Kors is going in now (can't wait). Coach, gap, the children's place, dress barn just to give you an idea. 

One last grip..when a store relocates it takes forever and a day for he mall to update the directory. Which I'm sure hurts business. 

Very clean and love the outdoor atmosphere.
After the south premium, didn't like this one. Music is loud and awful. Tons of slow moving people. one time visit.

Don't let the variety of stores fool you.

I just came back recently from Vegas and when I stopped by last Monday, there wasn't much selection. Styles are dated. Sizes are limited. It's either REALLY small or REALLY big sizes. If you are on the smaller end of the spectrum, you won't find much selection at the higher end stores. Quality is poor too, some of the nicer items are damaged... why pay for something you can't wear?

I did like this mall for the fact that it had nice misty stations to cool off on a hot hot day...

Save your time and go elsewhere... if you are a coach fan and plan to pick up nicer purses here, go to Las Vegas Outlet Centre instead (it's at the south end of the strip near the Town Centre)... it's close to the strip and you can bus there for $3.

One of the better outlets in and around Las Vegas.  Even though it's outdoors, they have plenty of shade blocking sheaths that try to cover the walkways so that you can at least avoid the sunshine.

They have plenty of popular stores.  Click here for a listing:

http://www.premiumoutlets.com/outlets/store_listing.asp?id=58

There are two covered parking lots.  I usually go to the more interior one since it seems as though more people park at the one that's right at the entrance.

My wishlist is for them to have a better food court.  They really don't have much to choose from, but at least they have Makino, the AYCE sushi buffet.

I'd rather go shopping here than lose my money at the tables!
Nice variety of shops, what's not to like?

Pretty good store selection here.  Some of my favorites include:

Coach, Burberry, 2B Bebe, Guess, Pac Sun, BCBG Max Azria, Aldo, Juicy Couture..

What I love is the second you walk into the store you find out they have everthing in the store a certain percent off, sometimes up to an additional 40%!!  

Couldve used some better food options, but then again, who wants to eat alot when you're trying on tons of clothing n what not

I wasn't too happy with this outlet this is by far my 3rd time coming to this outlet and I never really find anything that I'm interested in. I find better deals at the malls in Vegas rather than the outlets.
Shopping, shopping and more shopping! Wonderful place to spend the day. If you want/need it this place will have it. Don't forget to get your coupon book from the Information Center.

One word: ghetto.

But if I were to give more detail.. well let's just say I expected much more. First Siri usually takes me the highway route (she usually LOVES highways) but she ended up taking me through the shady part of town which is down the street from this outlet. The location is not great & the crowd there reflects that a lot. It was busy but not so busy that I should have worried about personal space. I got unnecessarily pushed around a lot by people high on consumerism. Lot's of shopping crazy tourists rolling their suitcases around .... to fill them up with crap I'm sure & some locals with zero manners. Literally just people grabbing things from right in front of me instead of saying excuse me & bumping into me just to look at merchandise. Yuck. 

To me the stores basically reflect your ordinary mini mall with the exception of a couple of high end stores like Dolce & Gabbana, Marc Jacobs, Burberry, & Tory Burch. It was weird to see those stores surrounded by your average mall stores like PacSun & Hot Topic. I don't really see why they didn't just make this into a mall because although it was outdoors there was nothing giving off a classier then mall vibe such as grass, flowers, a nice outdoor sitting area, etc. Most outlets have something like that to separate it from the mall experience. I don't like malls but I'd rather go to Galleria or Fashion Show (neither of which I particularly care about but can at least deal with on occasion) then come here. 

I'm not a huge fan of shopping in general but I came looking for a pair of cute new flats & found nothing that interested me. A lot of cheap crap & a lot of rejected high end items they sell for full price using big names here. Don't care about the stores nor do I care for the environment. I don't see myself coming here ever again.

Not that great, very busy and it seemed every store I entered was out of what I was looking for.  Parking is horrible as well.  I don't plan on ever going back to this place.  I gave it two stars instead of one since the misters are nice in the summer.

Most of my friends were excited to come here because of the sales, but honestly I didn't find any! At least at the Nike store. Only certain items were actually on sale. I can find cheaper Nike items in different stores. Just sayiinnnggg. There was nothing special about this place. Many stores were messy. -_- 
I walked around and went into almost every single store and I would rather go to the mall than here.

This specific outlet has better stores than the one on the south side of the strip and has the out door shopping environment which I like. I know they are working on the parking garage but it seems that there is always a back up when it comes to parking and you are sitting in traffic for what seems like forever. I also feel the human beings act differently Not sure why but i had some "strange" experiences with some travelers here.

We had fun at these outlets - i think we visited twice on the last visit. Great great selection of stores! Prices are pretty reasonable. It's FULL of tourists, so beware! We had a car and drove in so it was convenient, but there is public transport (The Duece/SDX?) that takes you here from the Strip. 

It's a typical outlet mall - so not much to say - lots of higher end stores though so that's nice. Selection is pretty big!
you might or might not find a good deal and gets really cold out during the winter nights.

Good prices and lots of options available at this outlet. Organized well with a central food court and decent (recently upgraded) parking.

The location is convenient - just off the 15.

I go to this outlet every time I'm in Vegas. If this outlet doesn't have what I want it probably does not exist. It's not a huge outlet but on a hot day carry some water and keep hydrated because the walk around all the corridors feels very long. Plenty of shaded benches to relax and even water misters to help cool off in the heat.

It's close to the freeway, and it has a taxi stand.  Those are the best features, oh and the bathroom was relatively clean.  We stopped here to try to find some comfy shoes and fun tops when the weather did not match up with the stuff we packed.  

There were a lot of people milling about.  People, shopping is a participatory sport!!!!  Grab an item, fondle it.  Determine if it's really worth the price they're asking.  Try on a few bits and pieces.  Don't just stand in the store and stare aimlessly at the wall.  Do not stop in the middle of the walkway and have a conversation with your third cousin twice removed about your bunion surgery in two months.  Thanks!

There's a Dairy Queen!  Now that's premium! 

However, most of the stores are NOT premium.  There's Spyder and Ellie Tahari, but when is the Gap considered a premium store??  And Coach had the lousiest selection I've ever seen.  I got a great suit at Tahari, so it was worth the $20+ roundtrip cab ride from the strip (the Circus Circus end).  But I dont think I'll be going back.

When visiting Las Vegas, this is a place not to miss. Just a short distance from the strip. Theses are the outlets you want. Many  high end establishments. You have armani, Bebé, Nike, etc.... Prices are really good, I paid about 100$ for Armani jeans. What a steal.  This place is super busy. Seems like a lot of people from California were here. There is even a food court, I did not eat anything as there is an In and Out burger with in a couple of miles.

I've been to the one at the South end of the strip on several occasions.  I was meeting a friend for lunch downtown and decided to check this one out.  I was there late morning and it was 110°, and not much shade except by the food court. In the 2 hours I was there I got sunburned.  For the most part there was a good selection of stores.  I was surprised there was no kitchen store.  I like the enclosed one better but if I was in the area and knew something could be had that I was looking for I would stop in.

Where do I start...? Every time I come here, I spend one whole day to finish up all shopping wings that this mall offers. It's heaven! 
I never bother going to the South outlet, only to the North one. They have all the stores I'm interested in like Lululemon, Guess, Ferragamo, Lacoste, Kate Spade, Rue 21, Loft, Nike, etc. 
I love this outlet, it's a girl's dream come true! The only thing I wish they had more of are 1)more restrooms (because girls forget to go to the bathroom when they're in shopping mode so by the time they realize it they REALLY gotta go but the restrooms are miles away) and 2) Large locker spaces so that us girls don't have to bang into everyone and everything with all of our accumulated shopping bags from store to store!! 

All in all though, I like the variety this outlet provides. A girl can shop here alone for 5-6hrs (or more) while the bf enjoys his downtown solo gambling time!

Pretty decent outlets ESP since they added more stores in the last two years. Faves are the juicy store, Cole haan, And Michael kors. The coach store is ALWAYS insanely crowded- I tend to avoid that one. Like any outlet mall, you just have to catch the stores on a good day when not many people have ransacked the merch and they just got in new items.

Las Vegas Premium Outlets to the rescue. My sister was invited to a wedding and I decided to come along. My sister needed a few extra items which thankfully she found here at this outdoor mall while. The venue wasn't too far from this location and it made everything very easy as it's near downtown. That is why we chose to go to this shopping mall as oppose to others in the area.

Parking wasn't too bad especially since they have a parking garage. We came on a Friday afternoon; the mall wasn't super crowded but there were a good amount of people present. We were able to get in and out of stores in good timing. This was my first time here at this outlet as I usually go to Fashion Show Mall.

After all the shopping we spotted Chipotle Mexican Grill and that's where we headed next.

Hours
M-S 9 to 9
Sunday 9 to 8pm

An outlet that has barely anything on a "discount".

Idk how people are walking around with pants, shoes, shirts, and jackets in 105 degree weather.  Freakin ridiculous!

08.09.2017

We came to do some window shopping today. First thing we noticed is they're installing new parking sensors to help with available spaces in the parking structure. Note to self, bring your own water. The machines are a hit or miss for buying any bottled water or drinks. Luckily there was a Starbucks on the end we were on and was able to get a cold, refreshing water from in there. 

Good thing we came early (and on a weekday) because there weren't any crowds. 

Hubby wanted to look for some new work shoes at the Clarks store. Sadly he didn't find anything he liked but we saw some other cool things, like luggage and backpacks at the Tumi store. 

It's a great outdoor outlet with a wide variety of stores. There used to be misters but this time I didn't see any, so I'm not sure if they still have them. But come prepared with your ice cold water, cooling towel, HeatGear clothing and/or umbrella.  Whatever works to keep you cool out there...

Ow! My feet, my poor feet!  I walked so much that my feet started aching.  I ended up buying a pair of running shoes at the Reebok outlet.  I'm not complaining, I love the shoes I bought there.  

You would be consider a loser if you don't come out of the outlets with at least 1 item!  I made purchases at the Coach store, Kate Spade, Bass, Reebok store and Zoo York store.  I win!

Great outlet for the las vegas area.  Like most folks have said, this outlet is way better than the outlet closer to the strip.

Came during the peak time so as expected, it was pretty busy.  Parking wasn't so bad, there's a big garage you could park in, as well as lots of outdoor parking.  

Unlike for example, the Gilroy outlets where everything's separated, this outlet is pretty much in one area, so you won't have to constantly drive from one area to another.  Store wise, they have plenty so I'm sure you'll be able to find something to your needs.

Since the bay area is filled with this sorta stuff, no store really stood out like a sore thumb...price wise pretty much on par with the bay area. 

Food wise, just OK...there's a food court and plenty of snacks and drinks.  But I'd recommend passing on the food and finding a great restaurant after a long day of shopping.  

In terms of getting here, unfortunately it's pretty far from the strip.  You could take the bus, but that will take too long.  There are many taxi's by the parking lot, so the fastest and efficient way without a car is taxi

Great amount of tourists around mall, makes me fell like I want to travel too. Major difference differences last time I've been here. New parking and  addition of cheese factory. Great amount of foot traffic in morning and afternoon. I go around looking for good deals at adidas, Levi's, and nike. Get hungry and go the the food court.

Great place to kill time shopping.  I've found that most prices offered here advertise 30-40%, but the MSRP is priced higher than standard.  I would venture to say you're netting out a comfortable 15-20$ true discounted value.  

I would definitely stay away from here prior to any major holidays, and the crowds get uncontrollable and the inventory gets sparse.

The name is super fitting.  An outlet of premium stores!

Located off the strip, about 20 minutes drive but worth it if you're in the area and have some time to spare.  Didn't have enough time to check out the entire outlet, but I visited Kate Spade, Nike, Addidas, and a few other stores there.

Large parking lots to accommodate all of us shoppers.

Tired from gambling? Head here. These outlets are fantastic! Many high end stores as well as those you would find at a typical mall. You can easily burn a few hours just shopping through the many stores! They also have plenty of food stalls here in case you need a quick energy bite! 

Also yes parking is a pain but it's organized enough with those little red/green dots that indicate a spot is open or occupied. It really gets the drivers moving when they just have to look for the green vs looking at every car spot to see if there's a opening.



Now I wouldn't come here when that brutal heat comes running to lad Vegas. Too hot!!

Love this outlet...  Great high end designer boutiques and excellent dining places! Biggest down fall is parking. Always full to capacity and garage is way too far from the mall. Otherwise it'd be perfect.

lesportssac, american apparel, ferragamo, etc...can we say awesome? ok i only shopped at 2 of the 3 i mentioned but whatever. the prices were good. the service at each store was awesome too. the best part? it rained! so the blistering heat wasn't so blistering and the rain dried up quickly as we walked around the outlets. i wouldn't mind coming here again.

Well, we basically committed shopper suicide by deciding to go here on Black Friday. What were we thinking? Maybe the mountains would have been a better choice. Aside from the fact that there were millions of people here and parking was very hard to find, this outlet actually is pretty good. There are tons of stores for every taste. The prices seemed really reasonable, although that may have been Black Friday. I am not a huge fan of outlets or shopping in general, but this is a place that I would recommend over the traditional shops.

I'm a girl, and if I'm guilty of anything, it's that I love to shop.

There are plenty of decent and high-end shops (store listings: http://www.premiumoutlets.com/outlets/store_listing.asp?id=58), but when I go to an outlet, I expect great deals. Unfortunately, the "deals" here aren't actually deals. In the few stores that I did walk into (huge crowds are a deterrent), some of the merchandise had zero mark downs, and the ones that were on clearance weren't even steals...despite the long lines that may suggest otherwise. Fighting off annoying kiosks and crazed holiday shoppers is not fun. By the time we circled around, I was hungry and the food court options were far from appetizing. Ugh.

Because I rarely stay off the strip, coming to this place was quite the drive and not worth the gas. And since it's almost Christmas time, my best piece of advice is to avoid the parking structure because it's very difficult to turn back around to get out after your patience runs dry (I don't understand why drivers decide to park and wait where they're not supposed to park, making those behind him pull dangerous moves to bypass him by driving into a lane where there's oncoming traffic...C'MON!). There's side lots that are easily accessible.

The covered parking is a big plus because it gets so damn hot in Vegas.  The open air floor plan isn't so great but at least they installed the misting poles & beverage vending machines throughout the mall.  They seem to have better stores (brands) than the one on the other end...South Premium Outlets.  The food court is better too.

Being a Chinaman, I'd rate this Outlet five stars just on value alone, since there is a great selection of stores and it's a helluva lot closer than driving out to Cabazon.  Two things bring it down to four stars though:

1.  I don't enjoy shopping when it's 108F outside.  

2.  I think I saw a coffee shop in the food plaza - because we all need coffee when it's stupid hot outside - seriously, where's the bar?  I'd love to shop here longer if there was a beer garden.

I freakin looove this outlet! They have very good deals and it's close to the strip. You might have to buy another lugguge after going through this outlet. On the plus side, the lugguges will be on sale too Hahah 

This is an outdoor outlet. It's like a regular outdoor mall but with sales everywhere! Good sales too ;)

This place is huge.  There's a store for everyone in the family.  It's a great place to shop for a good deal.  And if you get hungry, hit up the food court.  Only negative is the parking.  There are some really bad drivers in Las Vegas and they all seem to meet up in the parking garage.  Minus 1-star.

pros...if you are interested in doing some shopping then this is one of those places that you need to visit while you are in vegas.  the outlet store is a bit off the strip, but well worth the trip.  large parking lots around the mall.  and a lot of stores for just about everyone.  

we were in search of some workout clothes and my buddy was after some new golfing clothes as well.  with lots of sports stores we were kept busy: nike, adidas, reebok, izod, and a whole list of other stores.  just walk around and you can find most popular stores and brands. 

cons...parking is crazy here, just a ton of people going to this mall.  prices are still a bit high for an outlet mall, but selection is good.

Finding a parking spot at this mall can be a nightmare.  It's because there are so many cool stores with great discounts that it's so hard to leave!  Sign up for VIP club for additional discount coupons.  Some merchants will accept coupons on already discounted items!

TLDR: 175 Outlets stores and counting, lots of quick and sit-down dining, kiosks galore, free coupons for VIP club members

A Simon Property Group location, Las Vegas Premium Outlets North provide a getaway destination for travelers and locals alike. With fashion stores like Burberry, Coach, and Neiman Marcus Last Call, you are bound to find something you like. I particularly enjoy the distinct Coach Men's store and the variety of options for children's presents. 

They have a VIP shopper's club that is free to sign up. Online you can find extra coupons limited to members in addition to the coupon booklet you can pick up at guest services, even with the Yelp Check-In. They are usually only good on prices without a discount. But if that doesn't tickle your fancy, some stores offer AARP, AAA, military, and student discounts. Just ask!

The property is well-maintained with multiple garages and side parking that's free! Mind the stop signs or just get a taxi. In the winter, they have heat lamps and in the summer they have the misters.

I love shopping! 
This outlet mall has a ton of awesome stores! I got a couple of really cheap items! They have a Juicy Couture outlet there, and I got some stud earrings for $20! Which is cheaper than paying $50 for a pair of earrings! 

Me and my friend spent an entire day walking around looking at all the amazing stores! I am totally coming back here! The good thing about these outlets, is that sometimes they will have sales, which makes their already discounted price even cheaper!
Pretty good deals in all my fave stores.  I can see the allure if you don't live in a big city.  Very crowded.  The stores need to lower their AC.  The dressing rooms all felt stuffy!!

This is definitely the better outlet in town! But the prices may not be the most competitive.

Conveniently located just both of the strip, easy access right off of the 15. There are 2 parking structures and a parking lot situated at the 3 corners of the mall. The store selection is pretty good: has most of the premium boutique stores like my favorites Ann Taylor, BR, Coach, Elie tahari etc. 

The food court is very small and during the holidays, it was extremely hard to find a seat to sit down and the bathroom lines get rather long.

I spent an afternoon here with my wife and sister-in-law (and spent a lot of time waiting for them to shop - haha!). Parking is easy and the mall is nice. There are plenty of your typical mall outlet stores like Gap, Nike, etc.

If you're looking for a place to find your favorite clothing stores without having to drive 10 different places, check these outlets out and you'll save yourself some time.

We will be back.

Un-huh un-huh un-huh...
just throw it in the bag...
Un-huh un-huh un-huh...
Just throw it in the bag!!!!

Fabolous - Throw it in the bag
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uf_461DHByQ


Last July 2009....
I'd rather drop here than at the casinos.  I have a fat wallet for Las Vegas Premium Outlets.   I had ideas on what to get the future wifey for her upcoming birthday.   Definitely Burberry.... Kate Spade.... some bling .... and added extras to go with the ring!     



TA-DOW!



Thanks Serbelle for helping a brotha out!
Thanks Alvin and Bobby (Lorilla brothers) for taking us out here!
.
.
.
.

I had never been to the North outlets though I'd spent a fair amount of time at the other South outlets. I don't know, my mom hates to be outside and when I outlet shop, it's usually with her and I guess it needs to be inside, whatever. Anyway, I walked down the stairs from the parking ramp (total nightmare, btw, find a lot to park in, you will not get out of that ramp unscathed) and it was magical. Diesel, Banana Republic, Nike, Quiksilver, and the elusive Bare Escentuals outlet. (Although, I think I figured out where Bare Escentuals makeup goes to die when you return it to Macy's, Sephora, Bare Escentuals, etc. retail--I think it comes to the outlet to die. Can't verify, but I put together the puzzle pieces and I'm pretty sure I'm right.)

It's enormous and I would not recommend going on a weekend--you will get run over by hoards of people and their dogs, literally. All in all though, a good place to go for good deals not too far away!

Absolute best outlets anywhere.  Love the children's polo, baby gap and children's place.  I refuse to pay full price for kids clothes so this is the next best thing.  I also hit up the converse store and scored a couple pairs for the little one.  
Love the Dooney outlet here, probably the only one on the West coast.  The parking is a bit crazy, valet fills up early too.  This is a must do when in town.  I rather spend money here than gamble it away.  Can't wait to return.

Normal Outlet mall, has all the regular stores: Hugo Boss, Juicy Couture, Banana Republic, French Connection, Pac Sun, etc.  They have an indoor food court with outside seating also.  They have a Subway, a Japanese place, a chinese place, a pizza place, etc.   The only thing I could prob recommend is to not go on a weekend...Parking and Food Court is Crazy!  But then again, that's when most of the sales are, so if that's the case..go early!

I'll have to admit, I thought this mall would rapidly decline over the past 3 years since I wrote my last review.  With the economic downturn and the overall decline of Las Vegas, I thought for sure it would suffer.  However, I was wrong.  It's time for a review update...

All of the Pros/Cons from my prior review still hold true.  The only thing I can add is to the CONS....this mall has a ton of those annoying kiosks that sell perfume, jewelry cleaning, and other stuff....what makes it annoying are the sales people who make cat calls at you as you walk by....it feels like I'm at a Middle Eastern "souk".  I just act like I can't speak English and walk right by them.

Besides that one annoying item, it's still a solid place to do some shopping.  There are some great stores here and I'm surprised they didn't leave during the economic downturn.

Return Factor - 95%

This outlet is HUGE!  It has lots of parking, designer stores, and a decent sized food court.  I love how it has those spraying water towers everywhere! It's very effective since it's hot in Vegas.  There's so many stores, I spent couple hours here just to walk around the whole thing.  I've never spent so much time at an outlet before.

There's so much people that at this outlet, so it makes it hard to walk around.  There's not much clothing stores, just mainly designer purse stores and such.

The only stores I really care about are: Coach, Michael Kors, and Juicy.

Occasionally, Banana Republic

But today... Sooo disappointed... There were no good sales or cute stuff. I usually leave so happy but today... Emptyish. I did buy three shirts from Banana Republic for $16 win!

Make sure youre hydrated and have sunblock bc this is all outdoor and its hot and humid during the summer.

Not many stores but its good. I gety Michael Kors fix.

I'm in shopping heaven!! Usually I'm a little skeptical about going to the outlets. It's just overwhelming and I usually am dissatisfied. We were in Vegas for the Turkey Holiday and we decided to go Black Friday shopping at this outlet. 

Oh jeez, parking was a nightmare. Hubs just shoved me out of the car so I could shop and he drove off to find parking. So many stores! Where to begin?? Just start walking. This place was so crowded, but it got me excited because there were so many great stores here. Much better than the ones back home in Cali. 

Kate Spade, Coach, Michael Kors, Columbia, so many more!! All my money went here instead of the casinos. 

Make sure to stop by before you leave.

Yeah, I'm a regular here.  When I forget to pack some clothes or swimming gear, this is the best place to go.

$9 for sunglasses for the weekend @ PacSun
$24 board shorts for swimming @ Zummies
$8 flip flops @ DC

Nike Outlet Store, Seiko store, etc.

Plus they offer valet, so on a 108 degree day, just valet it and save yourself the heat stroke!

This place has ample parking. 5 levels of parking.

This place doesn't have knick knacks and small items. This place has premium type items, dolce, ferragamo, nike, Kate Spade, Tag heuler type items. This place is like a discount outlet like Camarillo. This is like a live version of Amazon. There is a food court in the middle, not the best premium type food but it's good enough.

Black Friday Review:

I would NOT taxi there if you can avoid it, the line for a taxi at the end wrapped around and very far back. It was way longer than any of the lines to get inside the popular stores!

I have been going to Vegas for awhile and I'm surprised I haven't been here before now! It is about 10 min north of the strip. Of course the traffic getting into the parking structure and finding a spot took awhile but my dad dropped us off to get started while he took care of that :)

We headed to the food court first to fuel up for the busy day instead. There is a Chinese place, Subway, pizza/spaghetti, philly cheese steak, and a salad place. There is outdoor and indoor seating. It was packed as hell, but the Chinese food wasn't half bad! The outlet itself looks rather small from the outside, but once inside, there are actually a bunch of stores! The directory was super helpful because there are so many twists and turns. A part of it is also still under construction...

Worthy mentions: Banana Republic, J Crew, Kate Spade, Ann Taylor. I get a lot of business clothes for work, if you can tell. They had 50% off everywhere! The Kate Spade long was prob the longest but they had 50% off everything PLUS an additional 20%!! They even give a handy price list so you know exactly the sales total including tax. Other long lines were for Michael Kors and Tory Burch. 

I don't know if the discounts are usually this good, or it was just on steroids for Black Friday, but I def love the selection of stores here!

AWESOME experience! I called to see if they had any sales going on & they we´re kind enough to tell me the prices and available stuff in my size. I´m so happy I made the drive because I LOVE every single thing I got & was able to get even more than I was planning because the prices were so great! All the staff were so nice & helpful, especially Dani! Even their playlist was dope, I´ll definitely be back!

If you get your shop on like I do, and you've exhausted the shops at Bellagio and Venetian, The Mag Mile at Planet Hollywood, The Forum Shops at Caesars, and The Fashion Show Mall, then your next stop just may be the Las Vegas Premium Outlets. 

Some of the stores - Benetton, 7 For All Mankind, A|X Armani Exchange, Banana Republic, Calvin Klein, Bebe, BCBG, Ann Taylor Loft, Ann Klein, Burberry, Diesel, Brooks Brothers, Chicos, Cole Haan, Kenneth Cole, Ferragamo, Nine West, Stuart Weitzman, Timberland, Puma...the list goes on. 

Now, this is not the BEST premium outlet shopping center, but if you have the patience an the time, you just might find some great deals.

Seriously, you want shoppers yet you have half the sidewalks torn up?  We were there on a Wednesday at 10am.  They had 30% or so of the sidewalks blocked of and we only saw 3 workers?  get it done, why so slow...
The selection of stores is good, some big names in here.  The prices are not typical outlet mall.  They are marked up for the tourists like me who thing we can get a deal in Vegas..  So wrong, deals in Vegas are long gone...  Anywhere you have to pay for the privilege of a lounge chair at the pool no longer is a cheap place to visit,  I digress..  
The parking was tough even that early.  Clearly we were there at opening and the staff working the stores have taken all the 1st floor parking in the garage.  Pretty stupid guest service.   Then you hike from the garage to the shops.  If you can get lucky and find a parking spot on level 2 you can take the bridge and escalator and drop in by Nike.
The only real deals we saw were at Kate Spade.  After that we could beat every price and home or at regular retail..

And the final straw...
The food court bathrooms were closed.  No one working on them, but closed.  that is pretty crappy.  The next closest restrooms were the opposite direction of the parking garage.  
First visit, last visit.

Pretty good, we have been travelling USA and the prices here are not as cheap for the same items at the same stores in LA.

This mall has a better range of stores than other outlet malls.

For the same item, please see prices in different malls:

$190 - adidas shoes in LA in mall of Hollywood 
$39 in citadel outlet LA
$60 in Miami outlet
$99 in LV outlet north

My Daughter,Sister,Brother-n-Law and myself were there in  8/08, we had the best time there and spent loads of money. My favorite was Coach I purchased 3 beautiful bags. Everything that you could possibly want is there. Even though there are outlets in every city this one was special!

I used to come here when I was little and was never a fan. This place has grown a lot since then. They've added a lot of different stores. The outlet has a different feel since it's outdoor. Honestly, it can be a nightmare during summer because of the heat, but it's nice during the fall.

Stores I like to frequent include: Kate spade (they have random 60% off every now and then), Charlotte Rousse, Fossil, Michael Kors, Nike, Pac sun

The parking structure next to Adidas is bigger, so parking is better around there. They're building underground parking and adding to the structure next to Adidas. Hopefully they get done soon. 

Don't bother shopping the day after Christmas. If you go a couple days before, a lot of stores have the same sale all week.

This place is out of control and the parking is terrible. Since our last visit, they added another parking structure, but it's still awful. Every time one person waits for a car to back out (after taking five minutes to put in the baby seat), the entire line of cars going in gets held up. They added the red/green lights to help you find a parking space, but many of them are broken - you'll chase down the one false green light only to find someone parked in it because the magnet is broken. 

I used to like coming here for Nike and Banana, but now everything just seems like regular price. Nike used to have shoes at outlet prices (mine were $49.99), and now everything is $80-$120. It's the unideal combo of retail prices with Outlet frustrations. Good luck with the fitting room line at Banana. This used to be a place we always stopped by on any Vegas trip, but this has really gone downhill.

This mall is very busy! The reason it's busy is because of the deals that are offered. I have a list of stores to hit every time I go to shop. Robert Graham has one of the best sales staff I  ever encountered at a mall. I will continue to shop there no matter what. Tumi has great seasonal deals and you can't do better then. Ted Baker is hit or miss but I'm a London guy. I prefer to buy Ted in London. 
I fly into Vegas to shop since I don't gamble.

The stores here are pretty high end (Burberry, Marc Jacobs, Juicy Couture etc.) and the deals aren't THAT great, there's only minor discounts from the original price.
But it is a pretty big sized mall and there's many stores to pick from.
The way the stores are set up is nice and spacious. 
This is an outdoor mall however so it's pretty chilly at night.

This is my favorite outlet in Vegas.  Although it's a few minutes north of Vegas, it's definitely worth the drive.  The outlet is huge and has all the main stores, including BR, GAP, Coach, Polo Ralph Lauren, etc.  

I usually come here in the summer, so the weather makes it tough to walk through all of it.  Therefore, I would recommend coming during the spring or fall.  The food court is not that great though...my hubby and I ate at the Japan Cafe grill, and it was not satisfying at all.  

Shopping = excellent
Food court = eh...could be better.

Two words: Coach Outlet.

One of the best Coach Outlets, in fact, that I've ever been to.  They always have a crazy selection in clearance & pass out 30% off coupons at the front door.

Other outlets/clearance shops include:  Bebe, Burberry, Calvin Klein,  BCBG, Ralph Lauren, Cosmetic Company Store....the list goes on and on.

It's an outdoor mall so come prepared for the possible Las Vegas heat.  They do have water mister stations set up everywhere, but not a lot of shade.  The foodcourt has your standard mix of pizza/Subway/chinese/hot sandwiches.  There's also a Godiva shop & a Starbucks next to the court.

Elevators in the parking structures are sooooooo slow, but parking is free.  It can be really busy here on the weekends with tourists so try to to hit here on a weekday if you're a local or your vacation allows.

I have been here four or five times and I always leave with nothing.  I am not a shopper to begin with but I came here for a specific reason to check out items in one particular store.  I do like the lights above the parking spaces so you are aware of empty spots and being outdoor does not bother me even when it's in the 100s like it was yesterday. 

As it turned out, the store to which I was going was on the opposite side of the mall and I should have used the south garage.  My error.  I could have checked online.

I stopped at two stores and didn't purchase anything at either.  I think I should keep a sharp instrument handy and when I think about going to this outlet mall, I should poke myself in the eye so as to remind myself to stay away.

I went specifically for the Ferragamo store and was very disappointed with selection and the price points. Prices are hardly outlet on most of the shoes and the inventory was very weak. I find shopping online to be a better alternative. Not impressed :(

You need to go to both north and south outlet malls.  I personally like the south outlet mall more because it's not as picked over as this mall.  There's more stores catering to women in this mall, but I found it hard to find a store here I liked that wasn't in the south mall that's better stocked.

Last month they started charging  $5 to park  in the only lots anywhere near the outlets.  We needed handicapped parking. They have limited spaces surrounded by empty valet spaces 20 to 1. Once they have your $$ they don't care if you spend an hour trying to park. They are not directing traffic efficiently either. We will not waste our time coming here again!!  Paying to park to shop in North LV forget it. Shame on these outlets.

Leider ist es als 3XL Träger unmöglich etwas zu finden und das in diesem Land. Sehr schön aufgebaut aber zu kühl. Einige Läden sind schmutzig am Boden, als wenn hier nicht geputzt wird.

Schade ,(
5 bucks for privilege to spend your money here. Totally not cool. I know it's only 5 bucks but why?

The outlet mall is large in scale and pretty crowded, even on a cold November afternoon like the day we visited.  There are a couple free parking garages flanking the shops and we had no trouble finding a good parking spot.  While this outlet mall does carry some higher end brands like Burberry, Dolce & Gabbana, Ferragamo and St. John, you probably won't be going on a mad shopping spree.  Pricelike the day we visited.  There are a couple free parking garages flanking the shops and we had no trouble finding a good parking spot.

Take a taxi, leave your rental car at hotel because parking garage is a nightmare.  

Hard to find parking, long walk to mall and at closing time, it's bumper to bumper to get out!

Avoid the summer its too hot unless you go early.

Lots of kids stores: Carter's, Children's Place, Disney, Gap Kids, Gymboree, Nautica Kids, Osh Kosh, Stride Right, Tommy Hilfiger Kids, Strasberg Children.  

Food court is huge but not a huge selection.  Pizza, Subway, Sushi, Chinese, Great Steak and Dairy Queen.  

There's also an Orange Julius, Starbucks for some Passion Ice Tea and Annie's Pretzels. 

So get something cold to drink and a snack before you start shopping because after the kids stores you'll want to treat yourself at some of the designer stores like: J.Crew, Michael Kors, Perry Ellis, Lacoste, Oliver People's, Polo, DKNY, Coach, Armani, 7 for All Mankind and I heard my all time favorite Tory Burch has a store here! But I didn't make it on this day.  

Oh, well...

Happy shopping!

Always enjoy an outdoor mall because while I'm not into shopping, there's plenty of benches so I can relax while the other half goes in and out of his stores.

Before going be sure to sign up online for the VIP club because you can print off a coupon before arriving that gets you a booklet with discounts at quite a few of the shops.  Even if you don't have this, the stores here have mostly outlet prices so cheaper than the same ones closer to the strip.

When this place is busy it's really no fun (well ok the people watching is pretty great) but it's too full to leisurely walk around.  Tue-Thur are quietest days but regardless get there when they open at 10 because the afternoons are typically too crowded.

We use a rental car while visiting Vegas but plenty of people take taxis to this mall and there's always a row of them waiting to take customers elsewhere.

Nice outlet!

It's got most of the stores that you would like there....  (However it's not like the Cabazon Outlets where premium shops are abundant)

Pros:
- Lots of stores with new expansions
- Affordable shopping option because it's the outlet!

Cons:
- Parking, yes... they have made improvements but parking is still a pain in and out of the garage (2 garage lots available)
- Too many people!  Store distances across from each other was approximately 15 - 20 ft. so when there's lots of traffic it's hard to get thru at times...

Tip:  Best shopping days are 1-2 weeks before black friday, and also during the month of December running thru the 1st week of January.

Overall I do enjoy this place, just gotta decide what I was going to purchase before heading there, then get there as early or late as possible!  

Have fun shopping!

awesome shopping mall, you can find everything you want just in a mall, and of course it's outlet, very good prices :))
all the shop are super friendly, super cute. they also help you to find the size in another outlet near by and let you know everything you want :)

While the girls were in town making sure that I did not get lonely over Fathers Day they decided that some shopping cures most ailments. Their visit did help numb the emotional pain that I was having, and shopping here at the outlets made me begin the healing process. With all of the love and support from beautiful friends. 

Having many shopping experiences here in the past this particular trip I seemed to really connect with the sights and sounds surrounding me. Maybe because this is the first visit here in my lonely new life. Through the vastness of my new world I have discovered many wonderful things that I had no prior knowledge of here at the outlets. There is a Shake Shack located here currently across from the customer service area. Now individuals can enjoy fantastic burger and shakes while doing the most all American sport ever. Shopping!

The selection of stores is not the typical outlet type stores. Here most of the stores are a higher quality and standard of goods. Such as St. John, Burberry, and Vince to make a few of my favorite choices. It is an outdoor mall with lots of walking and people watching opportunities. The parking area is covered and highly secure. Plus parking is free here too, unless one feels the opportunity to pay for closing parking. With such fabulous stores that we all know and some we could only afford shopping here this is the place to get some great deals no matter what your seeking!

I like that everything is outdoor, a different experience then in Canada! has the usual designer brands that a lot of people like.The food court is however; isn't impressive at all (not much of a selection to choose from, would skip it if not totally hungry.) ADIDAS was having a fantastic sale when I went which was (06/29/16). Spend $150 and get $50 bucks off, not bad!

Got the girls all there nic naks for the bargain , Make up, purses, wasn't to crowded but price was worth some of the hassle , I don't leave reviews to complain but the homeless loitering made me uncomfortable but that's what I realize you have to tolerate in this city
Rude not friendly. Expensive. Have no seating for even disabled people. Violation of the ADA I would think !  Don't shop here. I gave them one star because I can't give the NO STARS.

They have Theory and Vince.  That's all that matters.  It's a nice, clean outlet.  Not as big as the Cabazon outlet near Palm Springs or the one down in Carlsbad, but it will do.  One gripe, though... the men's section at Theory/Vince is pretty small.  *sigh*

The parking is insanity! But once you are in you can spend the whole day here! Adidas, Bebe and Disney are my favorite stops. 
This place a gigantic with all the best stores with in going sales. You can buy all the best brands on sale. 
Premium outlet means they carry both the regular stores clothes as well as outlet clothing (sale clothing). 
You have a much better chance to buy your favorite things at a lower prices. There's lots of food to choose from as well! I'm the summer they always have there misters on to help with the heart. 
The holidays, beginning of summer and back to school you will find the best sales!

This place is usually very well organized with parking and the stores. 

My 1 star rating is for the POORLY EXECUTED parking structure! Sections were blocked up all the way up the structure. That caused so much confusion and traffic for customers. This definitely needs to be improved...

I am a big fan of outlet malls but this one is not very impressive. Traffic in the parking garage, overcrowded stores, small food court and prices are still relatively high and some store don't even have outlet prices. Still I keep going back there because of lack of alternatives so far.

Las Vegas North Premium Outlet

I am not a big shopper and I prefer to do my shopping online.  I was never a fan of this outlet's layout. It's confusing and I easily can get lost here.  The Las Vegas North Premium Outlet is an outdoor mall.  It is scorching in the summer, freezing during the winter, and extremely wet when it rains.  But I must admit it, this outlet has a lot of deals at some of my favorite stores.  In my opinion, the Under Armour and Nike at this outlet has the best selection and deals.  And most recently, North Face had some bargains that I just couldn't pass up.  The restaurant options at this outlet is better than the south outlet.  This outlet has a Cheesecake Factory, Chipotle, Shake Shack (expensive small burgers), and even Amorino for some legit gelato. Overall, you can say I'm a fan of the Las Vegas North Premium Outlets.  However, I'm still not a huge fan of the layout.

By far my favorite outlet and probably mall! Last year I went the Saturday before Christmas and couldn't find parking (totally my own fault) had to jump out of my husbands car and run to the Michael Kors store. worth it!!! The gift I purchased was 60% off with an additional 20% off! So awesome! Same sale I hit this year. Because I planned ahead and went on a Tuesday afternoon this year I instantly found a parking spot and was able to leisurely stroll the mall finishing up my shopping completely. This is my new tradition for Christmas shopping. I didn't even need a few cocktails before attacking this task.

I love our nice downtown outlet mall but my god, they need to do something to fix the parking situation! It is next to impossible to find a parking spot here! It's so bad that locals like me are actively avoiding shopping at this place! Be prepared to wait and wait (and wait) to (maybe) score a parking spot in the garage! Although the garage has been recently expanded, parking is still a pain in the butt! Don't even THINK about attempting to shop here on a busy weekend or on days with super nice weather. 

It's a shame about the parking because this is a really nice mall. There are some mid-range designer shops and lots of fun places to browse. I'm not sure the prices are truly "outlet" prices, so know the retail cost before you go. There also aren't a lot of options for dining or drinks / snacks, so you can't really plan to spend an entire day. The Starbucks location here is always packed with no seating and lines out the door. 

Note that this is an outdoor shopping mall so if it's a super hot day or if there's bad weather, there is no shelter from it. I repeat -- avoid this place on super hot or rainy days! I've also noticed that there have been more sketchy people hanging out here. If you are a group of girls, get ready to face catcalls and more from male shoppers. Last Saturday there were a ton of security guards around. I don't know what that was about but it didn't stop the catcalls. 

I still prefer the Premium Outlets South since they have more "down to Earth" shops that normal people can shop in everyday. They also have a much nicer Disney Store Outlet there and parking is never a problem.

This is a very nice place to find any clothing you can never think of from any brand install the pricing is very depend on what you want to buy. 
Your tourist and you come to town to the right place for you to find the best deal from all the different stores. 
very recommended

My favorite mall in Vegas, many upscale brands to choose from.  They even have an Ed Hardy outlet here.  This is an outdoor mall and they are dog friendly, our mastiffs go shopping with us here all the time.  There is plenty of parking unless you go on a holiday and there is even valet parking.  We never stay to eat though, the food in Vegas is TOO good to waste it on fast food.

Note, if you are into Architecture behind this mall (east of it) there is a new Geary building, it's really awesome and a must see.

OMG - this is such a crap hole.  How on Earth did this place get 4 stars??????!!! Junk ! JUNK! JUNK!  

And the prices ARE NOT a deal - try the Amazon scanner app.  Unbelievable. 

What a trash heap.

Pretty disappointing actually.

I had expected a lot more coming here but it was really small and not impressive at all. I spent only about an hour walking around and going into a few stores. Most of my time was spent in Guess due to a long line. Walked into Charlotte Russe looking for deals since it was an outlet mall but found the same prices, same styles as the store back home. Super let down with just that.

The food court was even worst. A small room with 4 choices of food, which didn't taste great either.

Overall, the time spent traveling from the strip to the "outlet" in 100 degree weather wasn't really worth it. Despite that, I did however score a cute bag from Guess and new kicks at Nike.

Visit again? I'll pass.

I think I can start spelling "disappointed," "Las Vegas Premium Outlets." 

"Vegas has amazing shopping." "The outlets get you amazing deals." I guess I may have heard these phrases one too many times because I went there and my heart broke. My dreams were dashed. I think I heard the sound of a unicorn dying as well... 

Maybe it was the time of year, maybe I'll try again but despite the amazing number of shops nothing was actually a deal. Everything appeared to be normal price and the selection at every store was seriously lacking. The same stores at the Seattle Outlets yield a lot more selection. And as far as price, I did end up buying one dress, and after the exchange rate (didn't have to pay duty though) I saved a grand total of $4 from buying it at home. 

The cool thing was the mist spraying trees in the concourse to keep you from melting, I really appreciated those. Also, if you're taking the bus, you might want to rethink it. The deuce will get you to the transfer point quick enough and then the 108 bus only comes once every 25 minutes there, consider cabbing if you have the cash. 

All in all, I would just say that there HAS to be a better place to shop.

When in town, we do most of our clothing shopping here at the North and South Outlets. Las Vegas North Premium Outlet is also referred to the "outdoor outlet" and the South Outlet is the "indoor outlet". The North Outlet is the one that is "downtown" and the South is the one by the strip. Just remember "S" (South) for strip. 

As of today (03/27/18), the North Outlet charges non Nevada residents a $5 parking fee. With a Nevada ID, the fee is waived.  This is the only reason why I didn't give it a five star and this reason alone will not stop me from shopping here because the savings alone in all the merchandise you will purchase here will exceed the parking fee. 

This Outlet has all the major brand clothing stores. It's really busy here and merchandise do tend to run out fast. Most of their products are in the floor but already ask a sales rep to check the back for you I've got lucky a few times. If they don't have it, they will be more than happy to call their sister store at the Las Vegas South Premium Outlet and place the item on hold for you, if it's in stock. If they don't offered you this option, ask. They will do it.

To my surprise, as of 3/26/18 they charge $5 for parking unless you're a local with ID. This charging for parking has gotten out of control. I had to go back to the mall to return something not even buying anything and it's $5! The stores are great but who ever heard of paying to park at an outlet mall???!???!!?!

it's huuuuge of life compared to the outlet home in Hawaii! Nothing really wow you tho the prices almost the same as back home too! however so much nicer the set up! Just the outdoor walk was wonderful! Thank you for the experience of your outlet

It looks like they finally managed the parking problems! At least on a weekday. Don't know how it works out in the weekends but there is an extra parking garage at the south side of the outlet.

The outlet is completely outdoors. So hot in summer! They spray water, but not enough to withstand the dessert heat. So if that bothers you, go to the south location that is indoors and airconditioned. Compared to the south location you'll find 70-80% the same stores. The rest is more high end than on the south location. 

In the last years the outlet has been expanding, and it looks like they still are. So enough options. There is a below average foodcourt but the're also soda vending machines and yesterday I noticed two food trucks. Can't be worse than the foodcourt. The're is a Starbucks with wifi. The outlet offers no wifi.

Oh. My. My heart skipped a beat. I LOVE the North Premium Outlets. LOVE them. My first day here... I didn't even make it through all of the stores and I had TONS of bags. The variety of stores is GREAT and the prices are even BETTER!!! The Nike outlet is HUGE!... Steve Madden you have my heart... and of course you do too Ed Hardy and Juicy Couture!... I could go on and on, and well, on. I came back here AGAIN during my trip to finish up some shopping. Just LOVE it here. If we had this back home... gosh that'd be dangerous LOL! A little bit of everything for everyone here. Lots of parking and valet if you can't find a spot. Decent size food court. Drinks are pricey though, beware!

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE shopping, and this outlet mall has it ALL for me!

First of all, I have purchased two deeply discounted, beautiful, buttery leather Coach purses here at two different times, and both times, I received an additional 30% off coupon. These purses are wardrobe staples for me, so I love that I got them as bargains. Like so many others have raved, the Coach Outlet is THE SHIZ.

This mall has plenty of other great stores to choose from to include J. Crew, Gap, Brooks Brothers, Oakley, Juicy Couture, Nike, and so much more that it makes my head spin with retail longing.

If you're in Vegas and you're really into shopping but you don't have the dough to afford the likes of the Caesar's Palace Forum Shoppes, then you need to stop here. It's an outdoor mall, so bring plenty of water to hydrate with because if you're like me, you'll want to walk the whole mall more than once to make sure you've seen it all.

P.S. I live for the Calvin Klein store here.

Just got back from a recent trip to Vegas and MORE STORES ARE NOW OPEN!!!!!!!!
Burberry, Catherine Malandrino, True Religion and Juicy Couture were the new stores I visited and I was in utter heaven.
I believe Ferragamo, Missoni, and Ed Hardy are opening soon too. I saw that they were fixing up the stores and looked almost complete.
They have the usuals also - Polo, Guess, A/X and FCUK to name a few.
I was also really happy that they had a Lacoste, Dolce and Gabbana AND OMG OMG OMG OMG!!!! A SOLSTICE OUTLET STORE!!!!!! OMG I was about to faint when I entered. Designer sunglasses for more than 50-60% off? I'm getting lightheaded just thinking about it!
I spent about $1k in a matter of a couple of hours but oh lordy, I sleep and cuddle with all the  beautiful things I got. I'm so in love.
The BF and I are planning yet ANOTHER trip to Vegas before the end of the year, just for the very fact of going to the Premium Outlets to go shopping.  We are such label whores.

omg this is my outlet to go to when i am in vegas. 

some of my fav shops i always come visit are Burberry, ted baker, boss, bally, Salvatore Ferragamo,d and g, swarovksi, and time watches place. 

i really like how this outlet have nice fancy brand names with the price up to 75% off which is a killer deal. i love coming here to find accessories such as leather wallets, leather shoes and etc. the outside setting of the outlet is nothing fancy and seems casual which is a plus if not in the mood to be dressy. 

also they added a new store to this outlet which is ballys if your a ballys fan which i finally went inside and looked at their products and made some purchases on the wallets. 

i always shop like crazy and spend and arm and leg. i always will find something inside the Swarovski store and make a purchase because i love the sparkly accessories here.
Great place to come and purchase whatever you are looking for.  Better to go shopping than gamble as you have something that can bring back home.
Completely OK mostly-outdoor mall with a large parking structure that fills up quickly yet says there are nearly 200 open spots when there are just a handful on the upper/outdoor level.

This mall is pleasant and much more reasonable than say the Forum Shops at Caesars.

I usually go straight to the Adidas and Nike stores here.  I run a lot and to save my knees I switch out running shoes every 2 months, so they stay bouncy.  You can get a solid pair of Adidas running shoes for $45, I like the Duramo's, which are as good for your feet as the $120 Nike Shox they sell at Foot Locker.

I never eat here, the food court is blah-and.
$5 to park your own car? Really? The owners of the center should be ashamed. I will never be back. I wish I could give them zero stars.

I guess coming from florida and having all the outlets down here I just wasn't that impressed. We went over as we stayed a week and needed to pick up a few more clothes.
