Good variety, prices were nothing great, a lot of foreigners and very crowded long lines. If its your only stop while in the states, and you can't get this stuff at good prices at home, then go. If not, wait till you get back home and see some other sights instead.

If you love shopping and ur in Vegas, you gotta hit up this outlet mall! It's located not too far away from the strip, and easy to get to via the freeway. It has a lot of pretty good stores, including Burberry, Coach, Guess by Marciano, Juicy Couture, BCBG, kate spade, bebe...just to name a few of my favorites. I wish there was a gucci outlet though...and I must say that the food court / restaurant selection could be better. There's only one real food court and the selection isn't very great at all. But I guess you are here for the shopping and not the food, so it's all right.

Las Vegas Premium Outlets, what can I say....this place will always be packed because well Coach, Juicy, Nike and many others all at discounted prices. Of course there will be a lot of people here! 

This place is not a good place to go when it is super hot, because well its an outside mall! It is a pretty big outlet center, and well there isn't much to say because it is just like a mall but with cheaper stuff of course. 

They do have a food court here as well, which thank godness is indoors, good selection of food. Their Nike outlet store is pretty big, but nothing like any other nike store you have been into before. 

Other than that, usually this is a place you have to go to during a Vegas trip, just to check if maybe something you like at the regular store is there, and a lot cheaper!

Holy moly - this must be the only place in Vegas that makes more money than the casinos. I have never seen so many people walking around with shopping bags. Several people I saw came with their own suitcases to take home their new purchases and / or needed to buy new suitcases to cart all of their belongings home.  We made a pact only to go to two stores since there was so much more we wanted to do in Vegas.  We opted for Ferragamo and Polo.  Both experiences were wonderful with friendly employees and lots of good deals to be had. A lovely place to walk around and get some good deals if it is possible to pull yourselves away from the tables and all of the other activities in Vegas for that long.

Good variety of stores, including a few premium stores if that's your style.

This place was busy (as expected) on Black Friday and there were pretty good sales going on.

We found parking in the garage, but closer to the top of the roof. Their garage is even premium showing how many spots are free. But it's a tight fit going in and out.

Shop here before spending all your money at the blackjack tables.

Didn't even go shopping, because we waited in the parking garage for over 30 min trying to park. Didn't end up parking. Therefore we didn't go shopping here. Plenty of open parking spots that the security has blocked off. I WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE TO SHOP.
Me encantan todas las tiendas !!!! Es un excelente lugar para poder ir de compras y en familia

On my last trip to Las Vegas, we had a rental car so we decided to put it to good use.  This outlet mall has a parking garage so parking isn't a problem.  This location has nike and lululemon.  They have a few other high end stores.  I was able to get some shoes at Ferragamo too!
It's exactly like any premiumo outlet I have been too. The only shop that I don't have back gome is Oliver Peoples. The staff are weary about tourists, which I understand.

The new parking fee at the Las Vegas Premium Outlets obviously is designed to stick an additional $5 cost to out-of-state visitors.  We have shopped at these outlets on every visit to Las Vegas.  Not anymore!  I hope out-of-state visitors take their business elsewhere.  There are many shopping opportunities in the Vegas area.

OK - this is MALL...I'm a girl...what's not to love!  :)  This is an outdoor mall, so if you want to brave the heat (especially during the summer), then this is the mall for you.

They have everything you can imagine, from a food court, to shopping for the family and even Starbucks!  I didn't get to spend as much time as I liked, but for what I was looking for, I was happy.  I went to Starbucks to grab a nice cool drink.  Went to LeSportSac to get a good deal on a versatile & functional backpack.  I even stopped to grab some make-up at Bare Minerals.  

Went to Vegas for a little mini vacation before moving to Dallas and for the wedding of my god-brother, so this was a nice break in my gambling adventures.

I will be back for sure to check out the rest of the eateries, especially the sushi buffet and shopping. :)

So I must confess that for the majority of my adult life, i have hated outlets. I didn't like the idea of items that were not good enough to be sold in stores to be sent here, and really, how much less were you paying? Really?

When I arrived in Las Vegas I admit that the selection of stores at the outlet amazed me, but still, why pay brand name (outlet) prices if it was not worth it? 

Fast forward to a couple of months ago, when I came back after a two year hiatus. I only went to a couple of stores, Banana Republic and the like, and I was amazed! AMAZED! I could not tell the difference between the store and the outlet items. Holy crap! After that visit I was sold, and now I don't see a reason why people go to the mall. 

I agree that parking is a nightmare, so I suggest you get there a little before the stores open to get a good spot. Although I love shopping as much as the next girl, I really just like to get in quickly and get the heck out of there before it gets to packed.
the best of the vegas outlets IMO. drop off the relatives, go for lunch, gamble a bit and pick em up after 3 hours. DONE!

This outdoor mall, just off the 15 and 95 freeways (Spaghetti Bowl) is our favorite place to shop, in Las Vegas. We've come so often that some sales people here know us, at several stores. We do some of our Christmas shopping here. There are so many places to shop- Coach, Dooney & Bourke, LeSportSac, Harry & David, Adidas, Quiksilver, Banana Republic, Gap, Oakley, Clark's, Ann Taylor, and Disney, just to name a few. This is a way better center than the Las Vegas Outlet Center (formerly Belz). (Tip: Additional 10% discount to AAA members at Banana Republic & The Gap when you show your card at checkout. Senior Discount on Tuesdays- 10% off. If you join the website, you will receive insider sales & additional coupons.) So many options, so many ways to save money, such a great place to go shopping! Pretty much something for everyone. Ok, sometimes we just like to walk around and window shop- so we don't always buy something- just wanted to clarify. Definitely, good people watching. 

The Welcome Center offers discount booklets for free to AAA members; just show your card with your ID. This is where Gift Cards are purchased (center wide). The Food Court is ok. A plus- outdoor seating that is semi-covered. Many snacking options like Starbucks, Auntie Anne's Pretzels, and Godiva. Vending machines in the beginning and near Adidas. Makino's is not as good here, compared to the Decatur/Flamingo location. Five bathroom options throughout the center. Security presence seems to be more visible; maybe because there are a lot of tourists here. There are two parking lots here but seems to get crowded the worst around the Holidays, so get there really early (or you could be waiting in line to park for almost an hour- yeah that really happened to us, last year). Midnight Madness, a Thanksgiving tradition, seems to be a big hit with shoppers and retailers alike. (Note: Ultra Diamonds seems to have slightly different hours than the rest of the mall.) Yes, might not be so sun-safe during Summer months especially July & August- at least the misters are on! Either avoid it during peak UVA/UVB hours or wear lots of sunblock and a hat. If you are prone to overheating, avoid it in the summer time. 

Needs a recycling station for out of town shoppers who like to toss their shoeboxes into the already overstuffed trash cans. I've heard that stores refuse to keep the shoeboxes. Donate your shoes to Timberland and get 10% off your purchase. Donate your shoes to Nike- which is recycled into material for children's parks.

I am a frequent Las Vegas visitor and this is my favorite outlet mall in Vegas. They have a wide selection of stores, I'd say more than any of the other outlets in Las Vegas. Its a nice outdoor outlet center to walk around. They even have a pretty decent food court. They have a Makino. Some of the highlight stores...Coach, Burberry, Juicy, Theory, Benetton.

This outlet mall has improved dramatically since the last time I was there a year ago.  The range of stores is outstanding and it has the higher end stores.  The Cole Haan and Joe's Jeans stores are great here.  The sushi buffet at this mall is also outstanding.  The Polo store could run a few more sales.  It is my least favorite of the Polo outlets.  I prefer the one in Austin, TX, and in Phoenix, AZ.

This is an amazing place to shop at. From Nike to Nautica to Sunglasses Hut, everything that is important is here. Nike has plenty of basketball shoes to choose from, from Air Jordans to Huraches. Nautica and Ralph Lauren Polo offers the newest designs that is consistent with the seasons. Sunglasses Hut offers Pradas, Guccis, Ray Ban, and many other sorts of brands. Overall this outlet has everything and each store is fully stocked with the best of the best. There is plenty of parking and it is overall a very nice place to spend some time with the family.
Las Vegas premium outlets north has better selection than the premium outlets south in my opinion.

Concurrir a este buen oulet de principales marcas. Muy bien organizado y muy buenos negocios. Es a cielo descubierto, fui a inicio de primavera, y no había mucho calor. Tiene cafeterías y patio de comidas no tiene wiFi. Utilice una cuponera q salió 10 dólares y  no me resultó muy provechoso. Llegues en un bus que me dejó enfrente y allí mismo te lleva de regreso.
Great outlet with lots of variety. Discounts are not that much but is always a place I must go when in Vegas.

I remembered these as the go to place for shopping in Vegas but on this recent visit was disappointed to be charged $5 for parking and found very little worth getting excited about. With all the shopping on the strip I'm not sure this is a spot worth the trip anymore.

We decided to do some shopping and chose the Las Vegas North Outlet since it was on the far side of the Strip from us and it gave us a chance to see both ends. We took an Uber over and it was about a 10 minute ride from Aria. 

This is an outdoor mall, so consider the weather when choosing this place. It was over 110 when we went but the stores are really well air conditioned. There are lots of misting fans and shade elements placed along the sidewalks to help reduce the heat between stores as much as possible. 

I found a great pair of new work shoes for next to nothing at the Adidas Outlet and my Fiance was excited about the Marc Jacobs Outlet. There were a few options for dining as well like a Cheesecake Factory. There were lots of options and plenty of deals to be found. If you can stand the heat, it is worth checking out.

This outlet was well maintained and clean. You have a variety of stores to shop from and even though it is an outside outlet they have places with shade so you can get out of the sun.

While visiting Las Vegas, I didn't rent a car. It was super easy to get here via the SDX bus on the Strip. You can even get on the free Downtown Loop bus right by the outlet mall. I was heading in another direction so I just rode the RTC.

There were plenty of vendors and food places here if you want to avoid the crowded food court. I think what really stood out to me is that the outlet mall had a Chinese New Year performance going on around the shops at the outlet. That was awesome!

First came here seven years ago, I was amazed as the north premium outlets were a place I could find deals and do some serious damage to the credit card that I had to put self control to task or I'd have a huge CC bill a month later. Nowadays the deals are less and less folks. Sure the shopping has many options per store but the deals that were always 40-70% off are now 25-50% with less and hard to find 50% deals. On this visit many stores were in the 25-30% range? What's happening premium outlets? You used to be amazing for deals??!? Now it's just like normal shopping to me? 

From the Wynn it was a shade over $15.70 for a taxi ride +$2 tip and on the way back it was $16.50 +$2 tip to Caesars palace. Considering I didn't buy much I will not come here again next visit if this is becoming a normal mall (masking as an outlet).

Tax is 8.1% on purchases here in the state of Nevada. Keep this in mind.

Outdoor mall!! Wooo. I love outlets! I came in an uber and they are all located by the taxi area. Find Kenneth Cole.

Since I came early December, lots of stores had sales. Has high end to low end stores, an interesting inside food court, and pretty decorations for the holidays. It's a long walk but there's usually one store I'd like to walk into. Plenty of seating for those that are just accompanying the shopper or just really need a seat. Definitely check out this outlet if you're bored of gambling and want to put your money elsewhere!

They started charging for self parking and the only free thing is the garages that get full after the first hour of the mall opening. So stupid. They should make it easier for people to come and visit the stupid mall.

Loved this outlet! They have all the brands that everyone loves. Plenty of parking. Hi tech parking space monitors and directory. Still the same outlet prices you'd expect. They have a big food court and Starbucks kiosks scattered throughout the mall. Beware: this is an outdoor mall so if the weather is off be prepared. Only bummer, which is not their fault, is that there's lots of construction on the freeway and the street on the way to the mall. So trying to get to the parking alone is a bit of a challenge, but so worth it!

I tend to always hit up the outlet when im in vegas. its a nice place for brands I like. the only downside is the food court.  OMG its so bad...its small with only 5 options to chose from and I did not like any of them.
we settled for the china food and it was nasty... :(


I like the bebe shop there (since im a member)- the staff was very nice and helpful :)
xoxo

All my fav stores :) even dinner at my fav pizza spot. However I was disappointed to hear that we weren't able to go back and shop earlier on a Sunday. We are from out of town and would have like to go around 10 ..... Over all had a blast.

Nice outdoor setting. Good mix of shops. Loved that they had a DQ/Orange Julius place. Sales staff in every store we visited was super friendly & helpful. If you want the coupon book, the office charges for them. We got a free one for unlocking the offer on Yelp so make sure to check it out if there is one available.

BEWARE!! i was shopping for a cellphone case and saw this stand near to carter's this sale associate grabbed my phone claiming that he wants to go in the back to see some cases with my phone im like hell no give me my phone ur not gonna take my phone with you and he got the balls to say im racist cause hes black weither ur black hispanic or filipino idgf ur not taking my things with you. He came back selling me this 30 dollar case where you can find on ebay for 6 dollars LOL other than that shopping experience here is awesome

When I'm in Vegas I always wonder what is more expensive: hanging in the casino or buying a bunch of junk here you don't need?

I do like this outdoor space but it is cluttered with aggressive salesmen and women desperate to make a buck off you. The hide in small booths in the middle of the outdoor walkways and pop out as they see you walking by with a less than perfectly purposeful walk.

This lady selling skin care stuff did just that to me. She grabbed my arm after popping out of nowhere like a bird in a coo coo clock. First she rubs sea salt on your arm without asking. Then she gets a black bowl and before you know it she is washing your hands. In the black bowl she shows you the oil that comes off your hands and arms. Then she will tell you to buy the sea salt. Next she will tell you your hands are too dry. Sell you some more lotion. On and on this goes till she does a sales pitch for each product in her booth. Watch out!!

Forget all the junky low quality stuff here specifically desinged and manufactured for outlet malls. Skip all that skin care nonsense too. Just go to the Plaza hotel and casino and live it up.... its just down the block

The misters here don't work very well so when it's really hot it's unbearable to go. Also, the deals at the South mall are better. Same stores better prices. I probably would have enjoyed it better if it were an indoor mall.
The second time I came here, it was just ALL WRONG. Lesportsac and Juicy were the only interesting stores. Then again, I've been spoiled by Sawgrass Mills, so if you'll excuse my brief review. =)

Ein Dorf in der Stadt, das ist das Las Vegas Premium Outlets. Und zwar ein Kaufdorf, bei welchem man von einem Haus zum nächsten geht, bis man immer noch mehr Tüten in der Hand hält und nicht mehr weiß wohin damit. Für uns Deutsche sind die Klamotten in den USA sowieso schon billiger, hier gibt es aber auch noch Abschläge auf die sonst üblichen Preise. Die großen Marken sind alle vertreten, Hersteller wie Nike, Puma, Adidas, Converse, Levis, American Apparel, dazu auch noblere Marken wie Armani und andere. Ja, auch bei Armani habe ich zugeschlagen, ein Sommerjäckchen für unter 100 Dollar, da konnte ich nicht nein sagen, obwohl ich ja sonst nicht so der Markenfetischist bin. Und Chucks von Converse gibt es hier für etwa ein Viertel von dem, was sie bei uns kosten. Ich sage jetzt mal, wenn man eine Komplettausstattung benötigt und einen halbwegs günstigen Flug bekommt, ist es vermutlich günstiger, nach Las Vegas zum Shoppen zu fahren als sich die Sachen bei uns zu kaufen.

Stopped by a few weeks ago because my wife wanted to do some shopping. On our last visit we hit up Coach, Crocs, Godiva, Nike, Adidas, Banana Republic, and Michael Kors. There were some deals to be had so we got some stuff for ourselves and we checked a couple people off of our Christmas Shopping List. 

Overall, they have a great variety of stores and an indoor food court. You cant go wrong with that.
Nice outlet mall with nice choices but packed with noisy customers all looking to shop.

Great outlet mall with tons to offer. I love the Nike outlet, they have great deals throughout the store. A definite must if you're in Vegas. The worst experience I have had here was back almost ten years ago when I flew to Vegas to meet a girl I had never met but only talked to on the phone. Let me tell you this girl lived on her stupid phone and she snorted like a pig when she laughed. The only enjoyment I got that day was going to the Nike outlet and buying a SWEET pair Nike Shox. But anyways this place is a lot of fun and great place to bring kids since they have a giant mary go round in the middle of the mall. I don't get to Vegas often but next time I go I am defiantly stopping here to do some shopping.

I love this outlet because all the high-end stores have an outlet here! Also, they opened up a Lululemon outlet here recently and I was able to get 2 sports bras for $30 each!

The parking structures are great because they have lights on top to show you if the parking spot is available.

We came on a weekday during off-season and were very happy that the crowds were at a minimum! 

I highly recommend the North outlets because they are nicer than the other ones.

For an outlet mall, this is one of the best I've been to. The wifey and I always make a point to stop here to pick up some nice gear for the Vegas nightlife. We can both find stores we like to shop at with ease.

They've got pretty much all the major name brands here, like Tommy Hilfiger, Banana Republic, Ralph Lauren, Nike, Adidas, PacSun, Charlotte Russe, Calvin Klein, Coach, and many more!(full list- http://www.premiumoutlets.com/outlets/store_listing.asp?id=58). Whatever brand you are into, most likely you can find it here.  Lots of really good deals around too!

There's plenty of parking available but I suggest trying to find a spot in the parking structure to keep your car cool during the summer months.  It's also an outdoor mall so if you are there too long you may get a nice farmer's tan. Oh and the Food Court is crap. Might as well save your money for something better to grub on in Vegas. 

It's definitely a good place to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Plus, it's nice to come home with something tangible than just spending all our money in the casinos.

Since were staying at the Cali in downtown, and had driven by the mall on the way, I wanted to check it out before checking out of town. They have a wide array of stores and with us getting there around 7:30 and it closing at 9:00 pm on Saturday, I had my plan of attack. Look at directory, see stores I like, rush in and out. It usually works. I wanted to start with Burberry, but the guys didn't, so we walked around and then I ditched them. Went to Banana Republic, Puma, Nike, WhiteIBlack, A/X, Ferragamo and made quick purchases. I think I did pretty well and didn't break the bank too much. What is weird about this outdoor shopping plaza is that it looks like it's not quite open yet. It was dark already, but they didn't have any of the courtesy lamps on in the walkaways. So you'd turn down one way or another and it'd be kind of dark. A little creepy if you're a girl shopping alone. Good thing I always have my pepper spray handy. 

Saw the comments from everyone about the heat. Don't go during the day. At night on a Saturday, this place was completely dead. No one in sight, except for a few stragglers here and there. I was overheating a little bit since it was a tad humid, but doesn't everyone sweat a tad when they're trying to cram in a bunch of stores in 90 minutes?

Good stores, good prices and all the salespeople I ran into were really nice. Will go back when I have more time! Never made it into Burberry. Probably a good thing, though, since I would've dropped a few more Benjis.

I went only for the Gap Outlet where I can spend $50 and walk out with a new wardrobe of basics. Tanks, jeans, shirts, shoes. Great deals on guys boxers and jeans too! I really love the rush of finding something that you couldn't find in your size when it was in the regular Gap stores! yay!

The rest of the outlet was scary. It was like a ghost town when we went and the other stores did not appeal to me at all. Their American Eagle wasn't even an outlet. I know they are cheap already but i want to see outlets in an outlet shopping center!! 

Coach outlet.......oooooooohhhhhhh
Kate Spade......aaaaahhhhhhhhhh

i was a bad girl.

This shopping center is relatively new and there are a lot of shops to check out. Make sure you bring your own water bottle of some sort because it is an outdoor shopping center. Especially in the summer when the weather gets hot, its important to stay hydrated.

Sales were pretty good too when I visited during 4th of july weekend. They have a variety of brands from Adidas, Nike, Pacsun, Banana Republic, Kenneth Cole etc
Great prices on the merchandise, but forget the food court.  Bring water or else you have to pay nearly $3 for one 16 ounce bottle. The food ain't so tasty.

Everything seemed way overpriced, like normal department store sales.  There are some good stores and some good merchandise, but the prices are not really outlet prices.

Parking wasn't too bad and things were clean.  3 stars.  I wouldn't go out of your way to go unless you really need something.

This is like Las Vegas version of Disneyland minus the roller coaster. It's an outdoor shopping center. There's like 150 stores with all your favorite brands like Nike,Levi,Ecko,Quiksilver,Vans,Reebok,Juicy Couture,Gap,Disney Brooks Brothers,,Coach,Billabong, Zales, Bose, Fossil  and so many more.It gets  super HOT in the summer & super cold in our 3 days of winter. What do you expect? Great deals can be found here-$5 T-shirts, $20 Warm-Up suits at Nike, 2 prs of Nike's for $60. Best time is Holiday sales. Save big $$$. I love this place & everyone tourists should make it a destintation on their trip.

Every time we go to Vegas we always get excited to come here. Until we get there. 

There is something about it that makes us always forget get that while they do have factory outlet stores of a lot of cool stores, this place is a dump! 

The food court alone is enough to make me gag but, with all of the carts in the middle trying to hound you, you have no choice but to quickly turn into a store to get away from them, then while shopping in that store you realized, that everything is 30% off of a 50% markup, and then they slap the word "outlet" and then stand back and collect money. 

I realized this trip that everything they have there you can either find online, or at the same price as the regular stores, it's only worth going if there is a store there that you don't have where you live, but then you have to figure out if it's worth the $20 each way cab ride.

10 minutes away from the strip on the freeway and maybe 5 minutes from downtown Las Vegas. They have a lot of stores and selections: a bit of everything. I came here in December so it's holiday shopping season and it's busy. I can't say for regular months. The outlet looked clean and well maintained. There's plenty of parking spaces and valet parking.

One of the best premium outlets around! Every time I come to Vegas, I make a stop to shop here. It's a big outdoor shopping complex a few miles north of the main Vegas strip. Personally, I think this outlet has better brands compared to the outlet south of the strip. They have a variety of stores including high end brands such as Burberry, Theory, Helmut Lang, Carolina Herrera, and Salvatore Ferragamo. They have the best selection and prices as well. Make sure to give yourself at least 3-4 hours to shop around. 

The only negative is that it gets really hot in the summer and walking around outside can be difficult. But most of the stores blast the AC! 

Tip: Yelpers don't forget to check in or use your AAA card to get a free VIP coupon book (extra savings on top of the already discounted prices).

Parking here is tough, but not impossible they've opened a large garage recently you just have to sit and wait and possibly walk a while from where you park. Great selection of stores, new restaurants. Expect to walk, but if the day's nice, it's nice.

Love this mall. The food court sucks but it's a food court at a mall, not meant to be fancy. One tip to help you save money.....take the monorail to LVH then at LVH get in their cab line and take a cab to the mall. Your fare should be around $15 plus tip. One time it was 10:05 and Puma had not opened yet. A lady got all belligerent over it. It was shopping and a show.

Went to the Coach Store. They have a large selection and everything is almost half of the original price. The store was very crowded with tourist so its hard to get to look at everything. There is no waiting for checkout. The staff is very helpful. 

Parking is crazy. It took me 30 min to find a parking space. I recommend you come early for easy parking and to avoid the crowd.

One thing I could say about this outlet was, SPYDER!!! I don't see many outlet that has SPYDER outlet. During this visit, I don't really need anything from them, but it's nice to see their items were on DISCOUNT! Yes, I'm a snowboarder and SPYDER is so expensive on retail, at least $350 and above, except kids size. This outlet has shown me that I can have it for about $200 or less, sweet deals! 

Loved the outdoor shopping and the watermist. For the first time, I see no lines at Coach store either. The parking structure is a bonus, plenty enough for those Vegas visitors. Located just right by the freeway, you can't miss it! It was my first time coming here 2 weekends ago and I'd say, I'll be back in the near future!!!

An outdoor outlet. They have a great variety of name brand outlets.  I recommend stopping by if you in the mood for discount shopping in Vegas. Parking is in a free parking structure.

I really do like this outlet mall, it is way better than the south outlet! The whole mall has great shops and yummy restaurants. I also should say, the mall looked really clean and beautiful. When walking around, I mostly walked in shade, loved it! All the shops are either high-end or low-end, there are many choices of shops. To get here, I really do recommend taking an Uber to your hotel. Plus, if you have a car, the parking lot has those lights that tell you if the spot is available or not. I'd so go here instead of the south outlet.

These are the best outlets by far I've been at. First of all, you will find all kinds of stores from Armani to Vince, Diesel to Pandora, John Varvatos and Uggs. I try to check these stores every time I come in to Vegas, and always leave stocked up with shopping bags. Parking is located conveniently right by plaza, you need to walk only 5-6 steps. Two Starbucks are on premises as well as Food Court. Anyway, this is a great place to shop. Enjoy!

This is where I do all clothing and shoe shopping for my family.  I love the selection of stores and can find everything needed for myself, husband, and 2 young kids.  I have found it is a lot less crowded during the week or later in the evening on the weekends (as opposed to during the day on weekends).  I can only think of two things that are a little on the downside.  I wish Stride Rite would have not closed.  Also, the cigarette smoke does seem to be quite heavy here.  It would be nice if smoking was limited to certain areas, but I'm not sure if there is anything the mall can do about it.  I will always be a return customer though!

I must say I do enjoy the LV Premium Outlets. 

Although it is outdoors, I might still find myself heading here in the middle of the summer just based off the fact they have stores I 1. enjoy and 2. actually have decent prices.

Parking can be a hassle, but there are two garages, so pick your poison between garages. Be forewarned: it is outdoors, so summer months could have you sweating between stores. 

A lot of tourists. TONS of tourists. It is not a "local" place by any means.

Still, gotta love cheap shopping. The structural layout is actually pretty decent and the signage is helpful. There's an eatery and a Starbucks that is always busy. 

I think overall this a good premium outlet.

L o v e. T h e s e. O u t l e t s. 

Once upon a time I grew up in a fashion deprived city. The nearest shops were hours away. I've never been much of an on-line shopper, so I had to know where all the nearest shops I liked were (Cure? LV Premium Outlets).

Shops here that I love: 
- J. Crew 
- French Connection (R.I.P. It's dead now but had been on my list of favorites for years)
- Kate Spade (another bag please!)
- Banana Republic 
- GAP (even though the factory stores tend to resemble Old Navy at times, what do you expect for factory prices?) 
-Ed Hardy (hahahahahahahah j/k!!!!)

I like the outdoor shop locations, but be warned, it can be bloody hot in summer (they have mist machines, but when its 100+ degrees out it evaporates immediately) . 

The food court is small (only 5? eateries) and during busy summer months seating can be hard to find. Outside is an ice cream shop and Godiva, so if Chinese Orange chicken or 1,000 calorie pizza slices don't appeal you can eat chocolate. 

They keep the facilities clean & they have covered parking (makes all the difference in that kind of heat -hot leather seats & short skirts don't mesh well). They also have valet and the area stays pretty clean.  Go there. Today. This weekend. Tomorrow. Just GO. Anyone up for a road trip???

They have some great stores here and I have to say the sales are pretty good too.  The great thing about this place is there is a parking garage so you don't have to park in the vast field of black-top asphalt.  The one thing about this outlet that stands out to me is the misting fans they use to cool people off.  The heat didn't bother me at all and it was 108 degrees and I was actually feeling cool.  The one is Florida doesn't have the misting fans and it could be 90 degrees outside and it could be unbearable!!!  Maybe the difference is in the humidity.

The Coach store offers the 30% off coupons at all their outlet locations.  The Vegas and Orlando locations are the biggest I have ever seen.  The selections are great and I love how you got to fight all the Chinese or Korean people buying the purses, so they can take it home to go make knock-offs to sell for just as high of a price.  Honestly, how many men do you see buying 30-40 bags??  I doubt they are cross dressers or they are buying it for their wife or girlfriend.  LOL

I like the Vegas Premium Outlet a lot.  If they have a store you like, you'll like it.  If they don't, you won't.  That's the whole thing to outlets I think.  If there are stores that you actually like to shop at, you'll be excited to browse through and find things that you like.  If you don't like a store, no matter how much you convince yourself to like it because it's so much cheaper, it's not going to happen.

Each time I come here, I really only go for two stores.  The Coach Outlet and the Guess Outlet.  The Coach Outlet always has a really good selection, including a lot of things from Coach Retail.  (Where I live, the Coach Outlets suck).. Also, I always liked Guess Outlet, but I no longer have that near home, so I get excited to come to this one.  This Guess Outlet is also pretty big.  

The Premium Outlets itself is nice and well maintained.  There's also a food court. Overall, if they have a store you like, I would definitely check it out.

One of the better malls in Vegas except that its outside which everyone knows that its hot as Hades in the summer. I do like it for the fact that it has a lot of cool shops that I like to check out. The place has a nice circular pattern layout but with the addition of the new wing a few years back makes you back track some.

I haven't been to too many outlet malls but this one is probably the best out of all of them. It's an outdoor mall and it's not too small or extremely large. It's also pretty easy to navigate once you make a few rounds; I think it pretty much loops around in a complete circle. When we went it was moderately crowded but still able to navigate freely, and it was on a Tuesday afternoon. Parking was okay, although we got kinda lost initially since this was our first time here. They have a 4 story (?) parking deck right next to the mall.

They have plenty of stores ranging for MK to Pacsun to Charlotte Russe and everything in between. I was able to find some good deals at GAP and O'Nelil but unfortunately my gf couldn't find anything :(

The ratio of higher end/designer stores to your typical chain dept. store was like 10 to 3 so if you're more into that fancy stuff, then this place has many options. There were plenty of good deals going on when we went as well.

The only downside is their limited food options.. we ended up just getting an Auntie Annes pretzel that seemed like it was sitting out for a bit..
Exit 41B on the highway. Typical outlet location. Nothing special beside the problems of finding parking. Must get there early to be the crowd.

I have been here many times before. But 5 years ago, I remember this place having lots of good deals. Lots of cheap things. Now its not so much. I think I will be better off going to the Portland Premium Outlets.

The place has expanded alot. But again there are so much traffic at this place. Parking has improved a lot. They have sensored parking spaces. This means that if you leave the parking spot, the system will update itself and show how many spot is available. I like this. So fancy. As a tip don't go after 1pm because parking will be crazy.

Their coupon book is fancy. Its a booklet. Not a pamphlet like other places. So there are more deal. Again I did notice Portland has more better deals.

Maybe Vegas is about going to the strip not really shopping. I was disappointed. I expected more.

Close to the strip. 
I drove here before and always have to fight for parking. 
This time, I rode the Express bus. I was zipping in and out. =)
 
Tips: I bought ticket but no one was checking and people just hop on and off. So, I am not the Express is free or not. Just so you know... 

After shopping, I rode the bus to the Fremont Street Experience. It was perfect.

Question:  I always see people shop with thier luggage (yes, the one you check in at the airport) in this mall.  Why is that?
Average small mall - had a couple of good stores I like: Guess & Bebe. Food court wasn't really a food court very limited food choices. Overall it is an ok mini mall.

Good selection of shops but way too crowded with tourists. The parking is a nightmare and is now chargeable $5 for non-Nevada residents. For this reason alone I will never return. Most of the shops have discounts from inflated prices or simply have designs that are made for the outlet in the first place - very few true bargains here in my experience.

I hate to be the party pooper among the sea of raving 4 and 5 star reviews, but I just never am too excited about this particular outlet. I feel the stores don't have much to offer.

Even the Polo Ralph Lauren, Lacoste, and Burberry here are whatever for me.

A funny memory I have of this outlet was once I was wearing a green Lacoste polo, cream khakis, and matching white Lacoste flat sneakers with green trim and was inside the Lacoste store, just aimlessly browsing with my dad. About 3 people came up to asking about the sale and prices, etc etc because they assumed I was an employee there. Hahaha

Ok and probably the only reason I'd ever come to this outlet is to eat at Makino, the Japanese buffet. The prices are reasonable and the food is GOOD.

It's outlet shopping! what else is needs to be said?

The unfortunate thing is this place is outdoors so during the summer it's super hot and you just keep hopping from store to store to cool down. They have misters on to help with the heat.

I usually hit up Coach, Banana Republic, Gap and Ann Taylor. The list of stores is here: https://www.premiumoutlets.com/outlets/store_listing.asp?id=58

They have a pretty impressive list. A lot more high end stores than the other outlet in town. You'd have to go to the one in Primm to see similar stores (however, even the one in Primm is starting to lose stores to this location)

I only use this mall when I truly need something. Like right now, I need work shoes and I use Sketcher Shape Ups! Got here and they don't open till 10am!!!! I don't know if it's just Sunday or every day but no stores are open and there are plenty of people pulling handles.... IMO with the lag in the economy right now if I was a store owner/manager and saw someone trying to come in I would rush to the door to let them in....

The last time I was here was for Black Friday and it was INSANE I had to get black Levi's and the sale was pretty decent. I recommend getting here REALLY early if you're planning on coming during Black Friday...

Has all the good expensive stores! Burbury, Kate Spade, Coach... as well as Banana, Bebe, Disney and Fossil.  Nice wide variety.  Nice outdoor mall to walk around.  When it's crazy hot they have some misters that help and a starbucks to  quench your thirst.  One of my favorite Vegas outlet malls.

It's a nice outdoor mall with premium brands, just don't expect spectacular bargains. Like many "outlets" the listed price usually is marked up and then given an impressive discount to make it seem like you're getting a great deal when in fact you're paying the retail price.

Das zweite Outlet Shoppingcenter in Las Vegas, was mit günstigen Preisen und Angeboten lockt. Der Einkäufer sollte sich bewusst sein, das Outletzentren im Regelfall Auslaufmodelle und speziell für dieses Segment produzierte Waren der Markenhersteller anbieten. Dieser Verkaufstempel ist offen gestaltet, man ist unter freiem Himmel unterwegs und flaniert zwischen den Ladengeschäften. In beiden Outlets dieses Betreibers gibt es jeweils ein Couponbuch, das Sparpotential beginnt aber oft erst bei Einkäufen über 150$ in den jeweiligen Geschäften. Preisunterschiede zwischen den beiden "Premium" Einkaufszentren konnte ich nicht feststellen. Aus meiner Sicht, genügt es jedoch eines zu besuchen, in meinem Fall eher die überdachte Version nahe dem Flughafen, da es bei den lokalen Temperaturen angenehmer ist.

What can I say: its an outlet mall that has brand name stores. Good stuff to be had if you find a good deal and the parking garage is a big plus. I love the fact that they actually have a L'Occitane en Provence store.

I can get my shop on here. 

Really, all my favorite places are here, and they're all cheaper than they are at the mall. Plus it's like 10 minutes away from my parent's house, and there's quick freeway access, so it's easy to get to!

I wear a lot of boring clothes for work. That is, a lot of plain button-up shorts and pants and stuff. This place allows me to get all my good business casual work clothes for a deal. They have a J Crew, which is a personal favorite, Nike (sup running shoes!?), Banana Republic, and a Gap. So I pretty much get the whole gamut of needs in one place. I love that I can pop into this place once every few months, and be set for a while. 

There are cons here, though. Parking is nuts. I hate it. It's probably better to park at the Clark County building across the way than it is to park in their lot. Also, it's an outdoorsy-type place, so shopping here isn't the best when it's 110 out. Also, I can come here and spend more money than I meant to. Thrift fail.

I'm gonna keep coming to this place. It's closer than the Belz outlet or the stateline place, though both of those place are ok, too.

Best outlet in Vegas. Parking lot can be very stressful but they do have the red and green light sensor on each spot, so you can see if the aisle has an open space.

They have improved and expanded a lot of stores since the last time I came. You can find all the major outlet stores here and then some. Can get really hot in the summer. Also gets very crowded after noon time.
Best sale when there is a sale! Although parking is hard when there's a lot of people. Very good deals
For shoppers this is a great place to go.  They have shops that most outlets don't have.  They have a black and white market that my was really want to go to.

LOVE this outlet!! For people who loves to shop and won't mind spending the whole day shopping, this is the place to be! GREAT sales and its so big that I got there noonish and left at closing time!

Best part is that they have a pretty good selection of food choice when hunger kicks in after a long day of shopping!

Gambling is not my thing, shopping is.  And when I come to Vegas, this outlet is a must-stop (must-shop?).  The bonus is that it's so close to downtown, which is where we stayed twice this year.

I love this outlet for the sheer sake of having a LeSportsac store.  Sure, I love the LVs, the Guccis, the Tods, but I'm a mom on the run and during the week, I like to carry my junk in a durably cute and casual manner.

Also, because I usually come here during the holidays (non-Christmas ones), I ALWAYS find great deals.  I recently came here during the Thanksgiving weekend, and got a lot of stuff for 1/3 of the listed prices (go mommy, it's yo berfday...).  And because this is a Premium Outlet, you can print out additional coupons as well as get a voucher for a VIP coupon book (claim at information center near Adidas) via the VIP Club.  You can also use your AAA card if you have one to get the VIP coupon book.  Otherwise, you'd have to fork out $5 for one (and people do pay for them, believe it or not).

So, I may not fill up my wallet with winnings from gambling, but I do empty it out and fill up my trunk with purchases.

To me, an outlet usually means getting quality products at deeply discounted prices and that is what I expect walking in. Since I have been duped in the past by phony outlet centers like this one, I always come prepared with my Iphone scanner to make sure I am getting a deal. 
 
After browsing around for more than two hours in the 100+ degree heat, I can state for certain that this place is nothing more than an ordinary mall with the word OUTLET written on the sign, with the exception of handful of stores of course. 

The only stores worth really visiting are Polo RL, Lacoste, and the Famous Footware as pretty much everything else was overpriced.

Hope this helps.

I was debating for awhile about purchasing the 2016 Agenda. I called 3 days prior to showing up and it was 60% off, when I made it to the store, there was only one left and the promo went down ro 40% off. I was in the store debating for about 15 minutes. I gave the agenda back to the Manager and said I'd changed my mind. She seemed genuinely concerned about what my issue was and wanted to make sure I was pleased! She honored the 60% off and was extremely gracious and professional. My cashier Jacqueline was awesome! The store was perfect and I highly recommend shopping here. Such a great experience

I LOVE coming to this outlet when I'm in town.  I always find great sales.  Parking can sometimes be a hassle when trying to find one under roof covers. Also, the elevators are super slow and stuffy..especially with the Vegas heat.  But still worth going to shop there!

I prefer the North outlets over the South, in terms of store selection. They have more designer stores, such as Theory, Dolce and Gabbana, and Burberry. The food court is pretty basic, but across from the food court is a pretty tasty fudge store. Despite it being an outdoor mall, there's enough shade that you don't get too overheated.

Great place to shop when you're here in Vegas! Prefer this outlet as compared to other outlets as it is smaller, easy to walk around to get the things you want as well as good variety of shops. Got quite a few good deals from a couple of shops. Simply love this place! Parking is free and it is conveniently located next to the shopping area. Makes it easy to lugged your loots back into the car after your shopping spree.
My favorite go to outlet when I come to Vegas. Got so many good deals at Kate Spade 70% off everything. What a steal!!!

Every time I visit Vegas with the fam, we always come here #truestory

NORTH is the better one of the two outlets (the other is SOUTH) because of its larger selection of stores, BUT the price you pay is a greater hustle-and-bustle of tourists and annoyingly slow walkers milling around the outlets. They have great stores with awesome discounts from Calvin Klein to Kate Spade and Banana Republic. Watch out for the HUGE foreign tourist traps like Burberry, Coach, Kate Spade, STARBUCKS (HAHA), and Nautica, just to name a few...

There is a good range of people who come here to shop from the locals to huge tour buses of foreigners to young kids looking to take a break from the Strip scene. 

This isn't my favorite place to go because of all the secondhand smoke that is destined to happen, but anyone and everyone can definitely find a great deal at the store of their choice.

If you happen to be in Las Vegas and would like to go shopping for some premium items at a bargain, be sure to check out the Las Vegas Premium Outlets near downtown. It is definitely worth your while if you want to get some retail therapy done. It offers a great array of shops in a well laid out manner and rather easy parking options that make it a good spot to shop!

The center features a plethora of clothing retailers for men, women, and children. From Banana Republic to PacSun, Ed Hardy to Gap, they have them all. They also feature a good selection of accessories, kitchen, and bag shops. You can certainly pick up some new things for you, some gifts for friends, and the bag to pack all of it in. Note, it is an open-air complex so be prepared on those hot summer days!

The parking lot is generally full when I've gone, but if you drive around for a bit, a stall is bound to open up. If not, check out the structure since there seems to be better chances to park there, plus you car will be out of the blazing sun! Be sure to hide your valuables since tourists do frequent this spot and I'd imagine could be an easy target for questionable individuals. 

Food options are rather limited with the food court fare or Makino Chaya, which actually is pretty decent if you are willing to spring the wallet strings a little. So plan accordingly...

For the cheap shopper in all of us, Las Vegas Premium Outlet is certainly a good choice to check out!

Outdoor malls in Las Vegas are a bit tough for me. Either too hot or too cold to shop but if you like the outdoor concept for malls this place is for you.

Great outlet stores to select from. They also have Cheesecake Factory here so that's a good chain restaurant for an outlet mall. 

Kiosk vendors can be a bit pushy, some very cheesy vendors for the kiosks but that's expected for outlets would just expect a bit more with the stores that are around.

Little Yelp tip, they have a coupon passport book here if you check in. Some pretty good deals inside. Make sure you pick yours up at customer service near valet.
Love this place.  We come here about every other time we come to Vegas.  It's convenient and it has many of the high end stores we like to shop.
They charge FIVE dollars for parking to non residents now! This outlet is a hit or miss. Sometimes you'll find a lot, sometimes you won't.

I went to both south and north and I liked this one better. if it's a cold or rainy day, then go to south but if it's a sunny day go to north. north offers more products while south ranout of many things north had. come early to catch parking right infront to avoid those big parking lots. fully outdoors beautiful for a sunny day.

Came here for the Reebok store. Got greeted as we entered and later asked if we needed help. But already found what I was looking for, 4E shoes! Yes!

Checked out the Coach store. Didn't buy anything.

Picked up some goodies at Harry and David. Offered some samples.....mmmm!

Next up Dooney and Bourke. Got a bag for my gf's friend. Staff was very helpful.

Pros: there tons of high-end stores at this outlet for your shopping pleasure. I've been here many times and always find something awesome. Just a casual stroll can take up some time because of the many stores at this outlet. There is a free parking garage and easy access to the outlet as you walk across this bridge and you are there. 

Cons: as with outdoor malls, it can get really hot in Vegas so stay hydrated and find shade where you can! 

Overall: if you have a free half a day to a day, I would recommend coming to this outlet from some good deals in shopping!

Stop at the info booth & check on some theater last minute ticket deals.  Get the map here which will save you time roaming around getting lost looking for the 2 directories they have.  90% of the security guards are working the Parking Structure.  Parking is a nightmare here and the cab lines are long, but you will find some of the car service drivers working the line to take you back you back to the hotel.  

DKNY, BCBG,  & Ted Baker are some of my favorites at this mall.  The BCBG carries some of the BCBG Herve Leger dresses and shoes which I have never seen at an Outlet.  I scored some great dresses at the 50% post Holiday sale. Ted Baker with the signature shirts with the cuff links are always a sharp clean style that is great for men and women, if you wear size 0-4, you may find a cute dress here.  I deeply dislike the overly embroidered Ed Hardy scroll over type shirts that scream douche bag or on my way to the Rodeo, so guys don't stop at this store.

This is a great place to get a quick outfit if you have flew over Spirit Air and was allowed only the clothes off your back.
EH, this place isn't that great. I like outlet shopping but so many places don't live up to it. This is one of those places.
I like the outlets lots of variety of shops to choose from. I'll shop at Coach, Reebok and The Loft to name a few stores.

Left the mall with heavy packages and lots of early Xmas shopping completed. Could've stayed longer but pretty much reached the boyfriend's shopping time limit. Got good deals at Michael Kors (40% additional reg priced items), quicksilver had buy one get one 1/2 off back packs and the stance socks were pretty much 2 for 1. Lulu lemon also had great specials of the day and everything is marked down. the salesperson gave me an extra 10% off of I would "bust a move" for 10 secs so of course I got my dance on. The VIP shoppers booklet is available for AAA members and you get extra discounts at at least 1/2 of the stores. I used it for 10% off motherhood and the Disney store. Nike outlet is hit or miss but specials can allow you to buy shoes at $40. Great weather makes it even better for an outdoor mall
Always finding great deals here. Got deals at Oakley, Banana Republic and Disney.  Lot of shops so just go for it!

This is THE best outlet mall in vegas (and quite possibly the best outlet i've been to)!!!! With tons of stores, there's really something for everyone. I also liked the layout - all the stores I wanted to hit were grouped up in the same section. Some highlights:

- snagged a pair of Juicy terry pants for $15!!! what a steal!
- they have THE ONLY Ted Baker outlet in the US! I made friends with one of the guys there who happened to also work at the one in the Forum Shops. He also mentioned that store is a test pilot to see if they should open more in the states...so GO and BUY STUFF!! He was also psyched that I decided to buy this teal wool toggle coat that i loooved and fit me perfectly. 
- got a new pair of chucks for $40 but my freakin friend with midget feet snagged a pair of kids' ones for $10 since they were buy one get one half off!!
- my friends also went crazy at Banana Republic. between the already great discounts and the extra friends & family coupon this weekend they each dropped over $100 there. 

I am now broke as a joke but let me tell you I do not regret any of it. If you've got the cash, take advantage of all the sales!! Christmas is right around the corner...

Before you blow all your money away in vegas.

Go Shopping! they have all the brands and lots and lots of specialty stores. 

It is a great way to spend the afternoon in vegas. its clean, safe, free parking, 

if its hot they have some unique outdoor seating with fans place on top w water misting.

dont blow all your money away in the casinos. come shop here b4!

Tip:  Before you head out, take a look at the directory, and head their earlier on as opposed to later as it gets busy.

This outdoor "outlet" mall looks nicer when you're actually walking around where the stores are as opposed to circling the parking lot.  And if you were decided between South Vs. this Outlet, go to this one!!!

There's a nice mix of the typical stores, but also some higher-end stores I was surprised to see at an Outlet Mall.  I'm from Toronto and we just don't have this variety here!  Sadly, some of them I was unable to get to.

Another surprise at an outlet mall was that there was actually a sense of GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE.  Maybe they were on commission, but who cares, they seemed sincere and like they actually wanted to help.  Shout-outs to the guy at Adidas and helpful, sweet salesgirl at Sunglass Hut!

I cannot comment about the food sitch because I went there stuffed, so didn't eat there, but it's probably all the usual chain places.

The reason I LOVED this mall is because when you wear a size 11 shoe, your shopping choices are limited.  Now I have hundreds of shoes but it took a lot of work to build a collection like I have.  Most size 8's can go to a shoe store any time and buy what they want.

So my point was that almost every shoe store at this mall had my size!  And not just ugly granny shoes, but really cute shoes!  On top of that they have a Burberry and a Michael Kors along with a good selection of other stores.

TIP: If you're on vacation in Las Vegas, try to avoid shopping here during the weekends during the daytime ... sheer madness!!!  Then, you're fighting to shop here with the other tourists AND locals, UGH!

Come here during the weekday or even during the evening on a weeknight.  We spend the last day of our trip coming here on a Tues. night at 8 PM and it was dead - woo-hoo!

Boyfriend scored lots of good deals at the Ecko store:

- 2 t-shirts for $20
- 2 t-shirts for $30
- Cargo shorts for $15 

This is as good as it gets!  

We have one Ecko store in Honolulu, HI and they sell it at Macys', but you can't get these kind of prices.

Was able to find parking in the regular lots across the street.  We tried to come here on a weekend day (Sat. afternoon) & even the huge parking garage was filled!!  What was worse is there was a parking garage employee standing after the entrance telling us we had to turn around since da garage was packed ... umm, that's retarded!  Why not have this person standing in FRONT OF THE PARKING GARAGE ... that way, he can prevent people from driving into da friggen thing and having to waste time by turning around.  Argh.
good food like it aloot price was good

First time here and I'm definitely coming back. They have a lot of good quality stores and a food court. It reminded me of an outlet located in Washington. I was able to purchase a bag and a wallet for a cheap price. Just imagine 60% off and an additional 20%?!

Shopping and enjoying the stores is cool.. parking is TERRIBLE!!! It took us 45 minutes to go from the 4th floor to the 3rd floor.  Plus another 20 to get from the 2nd to the exit. Never coming here again.

It's a nice place, but it's not connected like the south outlets, so you have to walk in and out of the store. It's inconvenient when the weather is 100 degrees outside. We were here for about 20 minutes and just left cause it got too hot and there were no sales. Clean facilities though. You also get $5 for checking in!

We always visit this outlet on semi annual trips to Las Vegas.  We know what stores hold interest for us so we do not spend a lot of time browsing.  Of the 2 outlets, north and south, this is by the nicer one though it is more difficult to get to than the south outlets for people without a car.  There has been a recent expansion that added a few nicer stores and the availability of garage during the hotter months represent a real plus.

This is by far one of the best outlets I've been to in awhile. The Ralph Lauren polo store has the deepest discounts I've ever seen anywhere. Sooooooo happy I found this place! Nice that they have a Cheesecake Factory too so you can grab a hearty meal after all the walking around!
Was helped very much and great customer service from Ethan. He helped explain all items and deals to help me with a great choice on the survival kit. Ask for Ethan if u come in.
I personally think  that this outlet is better than the South outlet. Only reason I dock off a point is because it is an outside outlet and can get super hot.

Guest service is horrible!!! I was at Las Vegas Premium outlet on April 28 to get coupon book and redeem $25 gift card that exclusive for members. Guest service staffs are very unhelpful when I asked questions about gift card and coupon book. The staffs was just saying, they don't know what I'm talking even I show the promo email. Staffs even bother check the details for customers. Also the customer service staff refused to give out the coupon book. The reason I get is I have to print out the copy, unlike I typically just need to show my membership via device. I mean... seriously how the travelers in Vegas would get easy access for printer. 

Either this company doesn't honor their promotion or simply need to provide better training to employees.
I liked this outlet but I didn't really find anything that made me squeal. My mother did buy me the cutest Coach purse for my birthday so that gives mommy 5 stars and the actual mall a 3.

I have gotten several pairs of designer glasses here.  Best place to go when you want to save a few ducketts and still get real designer stuff.  

The last thing I got here was a new pair of Dior shades.  Saved $100 bucks.

Still the better place to shop of you can't get to the local indoor malls otherthan fashion mall. I always find something to buy when I'm here. So many choices you can't help but get at least one thing.

This one star is for the BULLSHIT SECURITY SYSTEM of this place. Again, it is for the SECURITY SYSTEM. The outlet is cool.
Here is what happened: It was the last of my parents and I visiting Las Vegas and we went shopping at this outlet. When we got back, we found out our car was broke into. One of the side window of the passenger seats was smashed and my bags and shoes were jacked (It was a Jeep, so there was no trunk to hide our stuff). Then two securities came. To put it simply, there was no surveillance camera and they had no idea what to do. They just asked me to write down the statement of what had happened on a piece of paper and called the insurance company. They didn't even write down any contact information or their names as the securities who was in charged of this on that statement paper. They didn't even look like they wanted to help us. They also told us that the police stations were all closed. SOB.
Been to a lot of outlet malls and this one is by far the best one in Vegas. The only other outlet that compares in terms of number of quality stores is the Cabazon outlets in SoCal. Enjoy!

Its nice to have a place to go with upscale outlet stores.  They have a lot of good stores and it is outdoors which you can love or hate depending on what time of year it is.

The CON is coming from the South traffic can get sticky getting up to Charleston and the place is always busy!

Last weekend I found myself at this mall and realized that its actually pretty good. I have not been there in a few years and really enjoyed checking out the place.
It has some really great stores and spring is the time to walk around and shop here. Soon enough it will be to hot for outdoor malls.
They could use some more places to eat. The food court is kinda lame and the sushi place was not open when I was there.
They would get more stars if they had more food choices.
not bad....
Awsome stuff! I always go to this place every year for black friday!
A really nice outlet in Vegas!  Better than the one by the state line!   Come and check it out.

Certainly worth a visit if you're in town. This outlet houses a lot of designer stores and other favorites. I got here close to opening and it was already crowded. 

Well laid out mall and if you need to grab some lunch there is a fairly large food court with in and outdoor seating. (One sit down restaurant too). 

Stores were offering deep discounts the day I went. At the end of your shopping experience it would be surprising if you didn't come home with a few bargains in your bag.

My wife purse was cut and wallet was stolen.  Reported to mall security office and police dept.  Mall security office was so unprofessional and basically no help at all.  Never shop at this outlet.  Heard other people got their wallets and belonings stolen by security office who said we are lucky we didn't have anything more important.   Is this right?  We lost total over  $ 1000 worse cash and gift cards and etc and we are lucky???   Worst experience ever at the outlet....

first, do not get this confused up with the other outlets. this one is about a mile away from the stratosphere. it's an outdoor outlet, so be prepared to run in and out of stores if you're there in the summer. I like the selection of stores they have. my favs are...

Dooney and Bourke, Coach
Banana, Gap, Old Navy
Bebe
Guess
BCBG
Jcrew
Aldo, Nine West

the food court is also yummy!
BCBG outlet is a great find.  Imagine $300 dresses at $40!  My sister from England went crazy there.  Quiksilver has some great bargains too.  Better than overpriced shops at the Strip.

I prefer this place to the Forum shops a million times over.  Huge, huge variety of stores, awesome prices, and it never seems too busy.  I can spend an entire day here, if not longer, shopping and shopping and shopping.

This place is a nice break from all the casinos, buffets, and hotels on the strip.

Forget about the high end stores along the Strip.  When I want to shop in Vegas, I head to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets.  They have a great mix of stores that usually have pretty good deals going, including the biggest Coach factory store that I've seen.  They also have a huge food court area, which is nice.

Only complaint I have is that it can get really hot during the summer and it sucks walking store to store when it is over 100 degrees outside!  Maybe that's their ploy to get to stay inside the stores longer to escape the heat, lol.

Customer service is awfull in The Guess outlet store . I bought sandals here for $22.00 and they broke within 2 hours . I took them back and they made it seem like I was at fault .RUBY helped me and was very rude. I also bought perfume and she tried to give me a damaged box. I asked for a newer box and she made it seem like I was pulling her teeth. Spent over $300.00 there and will never go back . They lost a customer for sure.
Kinda small where I am from. Wish it was bigger. Just like most outlet places just average.

Perfect one stop shopping.  The stores I would highly recommend are:  Coach outlet, Michael Kors, Jockey, Sunglass Hut and some very good gourmet food places who sell spices, etc.  It is fairly close to the strip and what is so great is that you can walk outside - something we Canadians always appreciate.  I spend a full day there while hubby is on the golf course.  Would highly recommend.

Very bad. They take now 5 dollar parking !!!!
We will not support them and drive either to Primm or the south outlets....

I recently found my new favorite Ted Baker dress here for an unbeatable price.  I can easily see myself making this a regular stop on my LV trips!  Aside from the parking fiasco (we ended up driving over a curb and parking in some dirt, which apparently is OK!), this place is great  :)

Plenty of shops, great deals, nice outdoor feel.  Maybe it's just that folks are nicer in LV than they are in LA, but I was super impressed by how calm and chill the shoppers are here -- It was the day after Christmas and nobody was yelling or pushing or being a general nuisance!  Way to go, civilized peeps!

Tons of shopping centers of majority of the top brands in the USA. Parking is 180 degrees west of the outlet mall but still can be difficult at times. Decent prices and savings compared to other malls. I usually could find everything I need here.
I thought it was going to have better selections and more stores. I was surprised at how small it was. Nonetheless the place is fairly relaxing and clean.

This is a good outlet. They have several good shops.  The kids got several pairs a shoes.  I found some great deals at burberry.  the Coach store had a good selection.  If you look you will find good deals.

I buy all my purses here. today I was buying one for a friend. 

The staff is friendly, despite the craziness of people the place was clean and I walked out with a nice gift for 70 dollars!

Ok so the shops here are actually not bad. I've found some good deals here. I like the Pac Sun....they have good shoe selections. However Robert Wayne Footwear...Not really outlet prices. Believe me I used to manage one of the stores in LA. Ask for a discount or mall discount. Even no tax to get your hookup. I like the kitchen gadget stores. The food court. Not so good. Try Makino if you like jumbo sized all you can eat sushi.  :) So the shops aren't so bad - Nike, Tommy, Ralph, Quicksilver. This is much better than the other outlet mall....

Always find great STEALS here. I don't mind the heat. I'm not outside much as I am a hard core SHOPPER. My husband loves lacoste and FCUK which always has great bargains at this location. I usually load up on coach bags for presents throughout the year. (You know, you forgot someone's birthday? No big deal, you have an already wrapped coach bag in the closet!) 

Way better than those other outlets that are indoors. Plus if you go to the website www.premiumoutlets.com, sometimes there are good coupons in the VIP club.
I only gave it 4 stars because I usually end up buying wonderful things I don't need, but have to have. Oh well. And the fruits popsicle dude isn't there in the winter time.

A good variety of stores, the surroundings is pleasant. It could get a little crowded but I suppose that is the case with all premium outlets these days. Better than the one out of town, so if you are in Las Vegas and want to hit an outlet, this is the one to go to.
Love the mall here. The two parking lots got confusing ):  very clean mall, would definitely come back. Bought lots of clothes, very good clothing stores and great deals.

So you visit Vegas, and want to get your shopping on? The Strip and Crystals is too expensive for your taste? Enter Las Vegas Premium Outlets of the North!

Here's the shops that have the best deals by discounts that I've found:

+ Calvin Klein (hit or miss, but check the clearance rack)
+ Aldo (great shoes for a reasonable price)
+ GAP (found a pair of jeans for 60% off)
+ Banana Republic ($13 polos, tons of colors and sizes)
+ Coach for Men (clearance rack has the best deals, the rest of the store, so-so)

I ended up dropping a huge dime at the stores above before leaving Vegas after picking through deals on a busy Monday afternoon. One can only imagine how crazy busy this place gets on a weekend. There's a large parking garage, but to avoid the madness, try coming here on a weekday instead of the weekend. You can't beat the deals if you're willing to sort through them and wait in what can be long lines. If you're an outlet shopper, hit up LVPO of the North.

This wasn't quit what I had expected. I wouldn't classify it as a Outlet mall, well at least not the kind I'm use to in California. It was a nice outdoor Mall but they sure weren't outlet prices. It's a nice mix of high end (coach, juicy,burberry) and lower end (Rue21,Charlotte Russe)store, but again, I didn't notice any price differences from the regular stores. We went the day after Christmas and even then the deals weren't fantastic. The place was jam packed with people and it was crazy trying to maneuver around the crowds. I also hated being asked about 500 times "where are you from?" from the employees. so irritating!!!

I prefer this outlet than the south. Their parking is very unique and the stalls actually tell you if it's vacant or not and how many are available on that floor.

There are a lot of branded retail stores and I swear I got lost maybe three times being there. 

My boyfriend and I are always here when we come to Las Vegas for vacation.
It's my first time at a Coach outlet and it looks huge! But nothing to my liking. The outlets are pretty big, so prepare to spend hours here.

Always make it a point to come here when I'm in town, especially when I have no time to shop back at home and can't find what I'm looking for. I always find it at the outlets and always score on such great deals! $6 for jean shorts from Guess? Sweet! Great selection of stores and brands, will be back again.
Didn't really need something but the prices here wetter too hard to resist. Clean space and very organized.

I could hardly wait to go to this premium outlet mall not too far from our hotel. I was ready to shop, but left disappointed that I left empty-handed after a few hours.

I stopped into Tory Burch, Coach, Coach for Men, Marc Jacobs, and Burberry.  Some of the shops had items specifically made for the outlet and didn't have the quality that I was hoping for.  

This was a nice break from the strip, but not very productive shopping wise.
id like more sales on a long weekend. been going here for years it could be better on the deals

One thing I love about living in Vegas--- outlet malls that are strategically placed in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city! 

The Charleston outlet is my favorite Outlet to go to because it is new, really clean, modern, nice outdoor mall and pretty much all the stores I would want and I love their food court too. There's something about this place that everytime I go here it makes me feel like I'm on vacation... which is a good thing of course! 

If you are visiting and are choosing between going to the South or the North outlet malls, it's a no brainer.. this one would be the winner!

Love outlet malls.. this one had a lot of different stores and the prices overall were very good.. spend about 5 hours here and didn't even had time enough to go into every store so a good place to spend a day !

I absolutely love this outlet mall. It is located just North of the Las Vegas Strip. Great parking and a huge area where taxis can drop you off and pick you up at. Some of my favorite stores are coach.. juicy.. Tommy hill... MK of course :) among many others! One summer I got 6 designer purses for under 500.00. Amazing!!
Love it here, great stores and even better prices ! There are just so many annoying rude tourists everywhere.

I'm not your typical chicka - I really don't care too much for shopping...yeah, yeah, I know! But, we had a bit of time to kill while in Vegas, so we wandered over to the Outlet shops - they have a pretty amazing variety of shops, and a lot of "premium" shops as well (Burberry, Coach, True Religion, etc.). 

The shops are outdoors, so I'm sure this place must REALLY suck in the dead of summer - but since we were there in October, it was perfect - if not a tit nippy!

Amazingly enough, I actually found some stuff that I liked and bought it for next to nothing!

I like this outlet mall, let me say this. BUT, its even harder to find a parking space here than it is @ the Outlet mall center on LV Blvd.  This store does have way more stores. However, the stores here are much smaller. The reason this place gets an extra star is b/c I dont rememeber getting hassled by the kiosk people. Another reason is b/c I have never been able to go here w/out buying something. There's so much to choose from. 

My fav stores:
Levi's- love their T-shirts and cute dresses, believe it or not.
Coach - self explanitory but again the girls here are so push - you dont need to tell me how much I save and how much it will cost for every single thing I pick up in the store to admire. This makes me not want to buy anything at all. 
The cosmetics co. -one of my favorites. why pay full price @ the mall? you can get lancome here super cheap. I once bought a 1 oz bottle of magnifique for $14.00!  and 8 juicy tube lip glosses for $14.00 and a full size one for $10. liquid lancome make up $20. its so cheap.
Ecko-my bf likes it
Calvin Klein
kenneth cole
Nine West
Sketchers-love the boots
RalpH lauren
Sunglasses Hut



I do have to say - eat before you come b/c its a nightmare in the foodcourt. Often no place to sit. The chinese food place we chose to eat at once was horrible. OMG. I had to throw it all away. I ate maybe 2 bites. One to discover its horror, the 2nd to confirm its sheer nastiness. Like eating a block of lard. The nxt time we went we waited to head over to Fitzgerald for dinner for $6 - ayce pasta and soup and salad bar. Take that Sweet Tomatoes!

Had pretty decent stores, but prices were not that amazing to me. parking garage was super crowded and took forever, I wish we would have valeted b/c after walking around the outlets I didnt want to walk back to the car. They had little spray misters like the ones at amusements parks to keep you cool in the blazing heat, but it started raining on us, so those didnt really do us any good. They have an inside food court but I didnt eat there.
This is better than the Premium Outlets - South.  With a better selection of stores and facilities.  Asics running shoes, Ferragamo, Burbery, Kate Spade, etc...

Next time you think about wanting to stop at Primm on your way to Vegas, don't! Just keep driving..... and when you get to Vegas...... keep driving on I-15 and go to these outlets. It's SO much better than Primm -- by a long shot.

The stores have more merchandise and there are better stores. Plus, an outdoor mall is more appealing to me than an indoor one. They offer valet parking for $5, but there is a parking structure with more than enough parking available so you can opt to do that if you don't want to spend $5.

There is nothing special about this mall. It is very tight, not a lot of room for a lot of people to walk by without bumping into each other.  I can only imagine what it's like during the holidays.  And you can find the same stores and lousy parking at any regular mall.  Besides, how many clothing stores does a mall need? And the prices are no better than you find anywhere else. Two types of stores that are missing, IMO: sporting/sports and wine.  I was looking for a wine gift here, but ended up at a convenience store somewhere else.  Also wanted a pro sports jacket, but nothing here. 

Best thing about this mall is its location.

To each his/her own.

This place isn't much better than the Las Vegas Outlet Center, but an easier-to-navigate layout, an open-air environment and a few other factors work in its favor slightly. 

Like the LVOC, this place is pretty much entirely clothing stores, so don't bother coming here if you're looking to shop for anything else. It's a pretty normal selection, and if you go in enough stores you are bound to find some good deals on clothes and the like. 

The food court selection is pretty normal, with some of it being portioned off and indoors. A nice idea that helps you get out of the heat, I must admit. Makino also has a location here. 

Like the LVOC, this place is more crowded than it needs to be due to massive tourist numbers, so if you come during peak hours, expect to be fighting through some serious crowds. 

Once again, this place is for clothing shoppers only, and even then, don't go out of your way to get to this place.

Excellent shopping here. Coach has an outlet here as well as a Men's outlet. I had already made my Coach purchases but it was still fun to look some more. 
Juicy Couture has an outlet here. I found a kickin charm bracelet for a friend of mine on clearance.

If I have only one complaint it is that this is an outdoor mall. In the desert heat that sucks, they try to combat it with a mister system but if its hot its bloody hot.

I would certainly go back here, just in cooler temperatures the next time.
The outlets are cool great place to get away from the strip great process and service is always good! One of reason I like to visit Vegas always nice people and good deals!

When I'm in Vegas I always make sure to hit at many out of the outlets as I can. I'm a bargain shopper and even if you are in the same store as one of the other outlets the selection can be drastically different. This outlet has a great selection of store.
