Nike is a must and we made countless jokes about the Ed Hardy outlet. Assholes can shop at a discount now. 

Since it's Vegas and it's hot in the summer and cold in the winter be aware that this is an outdoor outlet so plan for the weather and FYI beware of the stench of sewage, ass and hot garbage that can linger around the food court.

Really cool stores and a lot of selections, but why have an outdoor outlet in Vegas? There is some shade, but it's soo hard to walk from store to store when it's 115 outside. The restrooms don't even have AC, so waiting for a stall and using the restrooms were so uncomfortable. Outlets are supposed to be outdoor, but some fansand more shade around would be nice to have.

Ich finde die Mall großartig! Für gewöhnlich finde ich nie etwas in Outlets oder zahle am Ende doch zu viel unfein frustriert, aber die hier war zumindest für mich optimal: Converse, Levis, Fossil - ordentlich gespart, Sonder- oder Auslaufmodelle bekommen, die es so zuhause nicht gibt und das noch zu Schnäppchenpreisen. 

Tipp: Vorher kostenlos zum VIP Club online anmelden, dann gibt's an der Info nochmal ein Gutscheinheft - bzw. wenn man per Yelp eincheckt, hätte man es auch bekommen.

Wer in Vegas tagsüber Zeit hat - unbedingt vorbeischauen!

Great outdoor spot to go shopping. The parking although in a parking structure is cool because it is smart and tells you where there are open spots. Overall, lots of good stores. They have a great Tory Burch store which is expanded from the original one that used to be here. Cheesecake Factory, Nike, Timberland, Saks and Nieman Marcus outlet, Carters and a great motherhood maternity to name a few. Lots and lots of foreigners here. Buses and long taxis lines can been seen dropping off out of town guests to go shopping. A lot of people always buying more luggage which I think is funny. I don't like that they don't have enough bathrooms. The food court has them but If you are shopping you got to walk All the way to the middle of the grounds to go tinkle. Sucks!

btwn here and the South location, this one is much bigger and its an outdoors outlet mall. There are plenty of stores and have all the main anchor stores such as Nike, etc. Very clean and open. Plenty of area to get dropped off at and there is plenty of public transportation stops as well.

We ended up here because they were closer to our hotel than its southern sister.

The traffic heading into the outlets was pretty bad, and being in a taxi, all I could do was stare at the meter and the long line of cars ahead of us.  On the plus side, we didn't have to hunt for a parking stall.

ATMOSPHERE:
The open-air design is pretty big compared to other outlets I've been to.  The design is really easy to navigate through and is laid out well.  It's very crowded and naturally very touristy.

TENANTS:
They have all the usual selections including my favorites Kenneth Cole, Calvin Klein, and Hugo Boss.  The food court is weak, like at most outlets, but they've recently added a Cheesecake Factory restaurant.

When it was time to leave the outlets, the taxi line was super long!  Can you say Uber?
We went to the house some Wilson and got the best deals on their leather I'll kinds of good stuff love it
If you enjoy sales you need to come to this outlet. It has plenty of stores. I enjoyed shopping so much did it two days in a row. I didn't like the selection of restaurants.

Nice and quiet, a beautiful day, no long lines, great stores with super bargains. What could go wrong? Annoyed to the point of just leaving?  Let em tell you. 

In one of the intersections in the back there is a cluster of kiosks. You've seen them, hair iron, luggage, etc. well there these obnoxious guys selling some dark box or something like that calling out to people. Ugh

For me he starts speaking some gibberish sounding Asian something. Not cool. 

I just left, not done shopping but will go elsewhere. How the management allows these clowns, I don't know. To management: think I'm exaggerating?  Go watch for five minutes.  

I get they are there to sell something but to be addressing people who don't wish to be addressed is wrong. This is an upscale center, isn't it?

sorry this place sucks. most of the prices here are the same as retail. not a lot of stores for guys unless you like atheltic wear. Outlet malls used to be very cool and nice and you used to be able to get good deals. now the best you can do is get $5 off or some 2 for 1 deal that basically saves you $5-$10. not worth the hassle of parking and walking around in the hot sun all day. just not that great of an experience or stores.

Five dollars to park at a mall. You can go F yourself outlets. We used to visit every time in town but no longer. I hope all the stores see a significant drop in sales as a result. A few store managers losing their jobs and having their kids go hungry MIGHT convince them to reverse this asinine money grab.

One of my favorite Outlets in the USA next to only the Seattle premium outlets. The parking garage is shit show on the weekend so stay away on the weekend! This place is like a United Nations so, great people watching just don't get frustrated if they are in front of you in line.

I remember when this location was puny compared to the South location.  Now, the stores and the parking and even the restaurants are expanding on this side in ways that the South location couldn't ever manage.  Far more outlets here than in the South location or even Primm.  Prices are good but not always exceptional.  Parking is AWFUL (completely full, with people sitting in their cars waiting for spaces to open) on weekend peak times but fine on most week days.  This is the only outlet mall in the Vegas area that has a Mastercard discount deal.  If you use Mastercard, be sure to stop at the management office for the brochure that doubles as a discount pass.

Great stores, decent prices, horrible parking, and a shitty food selection.

I guess you've got an over abundance of food selection everywhere else on the strip, so why bother when it comes to an outlet mall.

Don't bother parking outside the parking structure, unless you get there before 10 am.  You're better off tailing someone leaving the mall and taking their spot, just like in college.  

They have a last call store for BCBG, so you're looking at better than outlet prices, if you're lucky to find something.  You have to rummage  through the racks like a madwoman, but you might just find a top for $9.  We had to peel my friend from this store, and even then, she didn't spend more than $100.

I have been here a few times and never really bought anything because outlet prices are ridiculous.  However, a few of my friends scored some good deals at Tory Burch and Dolce & Gabanna (if by a deal you mean a $200 purse or a $250 pair of dress shoes). The only stores that I go into are Jcrew and Diesel as I am not a Coach kind of girl and Burberry is not up my alley.

My favorite place to stop by each trip!  I love all the stores, and even the food options at this outlet.  Whenever I stop by I have to always get myself Amorino Gelato!

I always find great deals at the Nike store here compared to the ones in California.  This is better than the outlets located on the South side of the strip, trust me!!

Since I live so far away, I don't usually find myself at these outlets unless something else brings me in the area.  This particular visit came from an all company meeting for my employer at the Smith Center.  We had a couple of hours to kill, so we ended up coming to the outlets to shop and grad a bite. 

I really appreciate the entire experience at the premium outlets.  This place is packed with hospitality, shops and people!  When you walk through the front, the information booth never skips a beat to say hello.  It was a super hot day, but no worrries!  This place was packed with misters.  

This place is packed with different shops and dining options, so if you're ever in the area, come by and check it out!

This mall is a cluster fuck. It is always packed with Asians (my people) and tourists who are so rude and shove you out of the way lmao. Think of girls lining up at 6am for a exclusive handbag but all day fighting over piles and crazy lines. Besides their awesome prices, I will probably refrain from coming here unless my Chinese parents are in town wanting Tory burch HAHAHAH.

Ps their parking here has been a clusterfuck for 3 years hahaha. GET IT TOGETHER! I waited literally 25 min to park in the garage..

It's hard to swallow walking around in heat or generous gusts of wind which seems to happen on the few times I come here. 

I am the dope that rarely has found the crazy deals that people are talking about, but the brands and general discounts are decent enough to take a gander every now and then. I'm not into the usual top brands like Coach,Ed Hardy and Juicy that people seem to flock here for but some of the more less monogrammed stores are also represented so there is stuff for me. 

It's alright of a place, I don't go too often, but I suppose I'm a fan specially since it saved my butt on a gift for my mom....you can never go wrong with BCBG on that lady.

Visited here during our Dec 2017 trip to Vegas.  Took Lyft; there's a designated drop off area.

Mall was clean and set up fairly efficiently.  However, it was a nice day when we visited; I don't think I would have enjoyed it as much during a hot summer day (or rare rainy one).
This outlet has stores I love. The only thing this place needs is more places to sit and they NEED a family restroom where you can breastfeed a baby and change a diaper.

We were in Vegas for Thanksgiving and took the SDX to the Premium Outlets on Thanksgiving to do some shopping.  It seems lots of others had the same idea as the bus was pretty full.  When we arrived at the outlet in the morning, I was glad it wasn't crazy busy.  After getting off the bus we headed in and then turned right.  The first store we went to was Under Armour and we spent a lot of time there shopping for shoes and clothes for ourselves and others.  They had a great sale and the line up to pay wasn't too long which was great.  Next we headed into The North Face and it was busier to shop and pay, but glad for no line ups outside of the store.  Walking around the outlet, there was ample seating available and ability to walk around at a reasonable pace.

Although a handful of stores were closed and Kate Spade and Michael Kors had line ups that we didn't bother joining, we checked out a number of stores that had great deals.  It's too bad we had our hands full with bags, as we could have continued to browse and buy as there were some great deals (even with the exchange rate!).  The longest line I experienced that day was for the washroom! 

I checked the directory and map before we left so had a good idea what stores I wanted to go to and where they were located.  I've been to the outlet a few times on previous visits and have always walked away happy with my purchases.  It was also very easy to get back to our hotel with our bags as it's the first stop on the SDX heading back on the strip so we were able to get seats and it wasn't standing room only. I'm glad we didn't come on Black Friday as we were told the sales would be the same as Thanksgiving.

This is the Las Vegas South Premium's northern sister property. It's definitely more outdoorsy being open air. They pretty much have the same amount of stores and same brands Las LV South premium. This outlet is nice to visit in when it's spring time and it's not too hot. During the winter it's nice as well. They have people sing Christmas Carols, but be warned, Christmas shoppers are EVERYWHERE. However, if you're new to Vegas or want cheap clothes I recommend you visit and get some shopping done!
If its winter, bring a coat. If its summer, use flip-flops and tanks. I get lost here, but its a "good" lost ya know?!

For someone who hates shopping (except on the internet), gotta say I was pretty impressed.  Some of the stores had incredible deals and some gave me further deals because it was my birthday--thank you Kenneth Cole! (pays to wear that "Kiss me Its My Birthday" button!).  I got some great stuff.

Outlet malls are a scam now. In the 1990's they were actual places to shop for great deals. These malls today are complete marketing scams. No deals, just a lot of overpriced merchandise. Don't get me started on the aggressive kiosk merchants that are lined throughout this outlet mall pushing their junk products.

Premium Outlet North is the outdoor mall. I prefer this over the South because it's much bigger. However, the day that we went, it was storming. We got soaked. We only had about an hour to walk around before the mall closed. I'm sure I would have bought more things if I had more time to look around. We spent most of the hour in Adidas. They were running a great promo. It was buy one and get the second item half off. Plus if you spend $100, you get $25 off. I ended up paying around $80 for three pairs of shoes and six pairs of socks. I'm a shopper and know a good deal when I see one.

Nike, Guess, Sketchers, Hurley, Tommy Hilfiger, and L'Occitane were some of the stores that I'd seen. They also have a food court in its own little building. They had about seven eateries in that place. 

Around the corner from Adidas is the customer service location. If you check in with your Yelp app you get a free coupon book priced at $10. The guy working behind the counter had never seen the app before and said I was the first. He gave me the coupon book anyway. Funny, the same thing happened at the South outlet.

Always a nice place to soak up sun and shop away from the strip. I think all the foreign tourists think the same way. Don't be shocked when you see people rolling around their largest suitcases stuffed full of their finds. The entries/tour bus meeting points are constantly buzzing with people comparing buys and re-packing their suitcases in their foreign tongue. It is very entertaining and makes me not only hopeful when entering but so disappointed when leaving. 

I never know where to start but do know that I usually have a moment of panic when walking by the Coach store to see hundreds of ladies going crazy for the big 'C'. I am always curious to see what I may find but only make it to the first table maybe the second then turn and run out. Then I try the shoe stores that never quite work out but I have yet to give up on em. I tend to stay away from stores I have in my area but I had a few gift cards to burn and found some steals at Banana Republic.

I try to avoid Armani Exchange cause they like to blow your ear drum with the unsk-unsky music that makes you waste hours in there checking out insanely vibrant clothes that are priced so low you have to look through EVERYTHING while tapping along with the beat. Found a lot I would have purchased but couldn't quite handle the chaos. I am a bad woman I know. My girlfriend found a great dress for cheap as did her sister. I think it was that store that made me wish there were good outlets by me. I could see it being a pit stop for a girl in need of hottness.

Moving along we skipped the Puma store and a few other shops to be on our way. We were able to hit Lacoste and I always look forward to Lacoste as it NEVER has anything for me :) The boys like going there for the cheap polos but I never find anything for myself. I was just doing a quick walk through when I ran across a one day only Easter sale rack. It had a ton of tennis skirts, t-shirts, and sweats- FOR $20! I confirmed the price of the goods I wanted, tried them on and walked out with a sweater and tennis skirt for $40 and some change! It was a one day sale and saves my self over $200. Crazy.

Food court is decent. Great place to start the day and firm up the plan of attack with your shopping posse. Across from it is what I think is called the Fudgery and they were so charming helping me stay within my dietary needs after a day of shopping.

Overall a great place to kill some time and still get a brand name bag or two without wasting the winnings from the night before.

The first few times I drove to this outlet mall, I wasn't a huge fan.  There are some definite downsides.  The parking can be atrocious, and some of the stores feel a bit like flea markets... smelly people digging through piles of undesirable waste.  Can you tell I'm not really a fan of outlet malls?  I have been elbowed in the temple on each and every trip I've made to an outlet mall, so maybe my brain is addled.  But I digress.

I am giving this outlet mall 3 stars because I have occasionally scored a good deal or two at this location (helloooooo Kate Spade wicker basket purse!).  However, much like other outlet malls, this one has its fair share of bad deals as well.  Maybe I have a rampant shopping problem, but I generally know how much things go for at "regular" stores... and sometimes, there isn't a price difference at all.  I prefer to visit this mall at night.  It seems like there are fewer suburban housewives with excessively large strollers.  

Overall, I will probably visit once or twice more before I move back home to Missouri in July.  It's about as good an outlet mall as I have visited.

I decided to come with the husband after all the raving reviews. 

Parking structure: horrible despite of the notification of any open slots. I drove past a lot of spaces which were green but occupied. There are many spots they could have utilized for parking but marked slanted no parking lines instead. Waste of space and poorly designed. I am sure we spent at least 20-3mins for parking. 

Drivers: they drive like bats out of hell around the corners and are prone to either running into a pedestrian or another vehicle. 

After we finally got a spot...

We headed towards the outlet mall. This place has virtually NO SHADE! Yes, I know vegas has crazy weathered but come on, the designers should have thought to put more shade and rest areas in the 110+ degree weather. 

Bathrooms: Big ass outlet center with only a few bathrooms. We had to walk past two whole blocks of stores prior to finding a spot to pee. Geeze Louis!

Water spritzer: poorly designed and by the time the water is spritzed out, it has already evaporated in the heat. What a waste of water. 

Stores: "pose" to have an insane sale but in the end it's just false advertisement. 

We made it around the outlet but did not end up buying anything since there were virtually no deals. 

This place is over-hyped on yelp and I would not recommend it to anyone looking for actual deals. I'd rather go to premium outlet south location (indoor).

I don't enjoy shopping but when it's needed this location works for me.  it's close to the strip and has a good variety of shops for everyone in your group.  The layout is good because you can mindlessly wander and not get lost because most shops are in rows. 

The parking accommodations are not that great.  I have more luck finding a parking space in the outdoor lot on the north end of the complex especially when it's 108 in the shade (no one wants to walk in that heat let alone park their car in direct sunlight).

This is a large outlet with a lot of my favorite stores. Actually, each member of my party was able to get the items of their choice. We were all excited to see the Pandora store. Don't forget your check in to get a discount book. We did not use the books as you needed to spend more money per store than we were spending. It was not too crowded on a Friday morning while waiting for hotel check in time.
Nice set up. I didn't see anything I could live without though. All the stores are the same you would see at any other outlet shopping center.

I've to lots of outlets this by far has rude security guards .....not allowed to wait in car for my spouse to get off work .....So moved to a more convenient spot but apparently a no go.....any other outlet is cool with me waiting in the car with my kids.....other than the outlet has lots of good stores walk around looking for you need the only other bad thing is that's its a out door mall so be ready for the heat

This place is close to home. It's difficult to find parking, even on weekdays. It's outdoors, which is crazy hot in the summer. I really dread being there every minute during the summer but I love it so much in the winter.

I always like their food stands: dole whip, Churros, soft pretzels, and more.

I love their Nike outlet here, which tons of deals there. I bought a great our of Asics shoes for under $50 here, including tax, when everywhere else they are $80+. I've got to say my favorite store here is Rue 21. Their discount racks have the cutest clothes. I bought a for soft pretzel at Auntie Anne's for $4 that can be used in this mall. I have yet to look through the entire mall by it's one if my favorite malls to shop at so far.
despite the mall being outside, it is amazing...all the stores you like + discounted prices...Nike Store was my favortie

Outlet shopping is definitely up there on the top reasons to go to Vegas and this outlet certainly doesn't disappoint!! I've been going to Vegas for years and years and was super excited when this new outlet came about and even more excited when they expanded!  They've got a variety of stores from the classic Coach outlet to Banana, French Connection, Children's Place, Guess, etc to LeSport Sac, Juicy, and D&B.  The fact that it's outdoors is good and bad, sometimes weather makes it a little difficult to shop (too hot in the summer, too cold in the winter).  I love the addition of the parking structure, though I think it seems like a far walk from the structure to the stores - but I'm all for more parking! Another great thing about the place is that on Black Friday, it seems that they keep opening earlier and earlier for serious shopper like myself!!

I do think that they need to improve on their Food Court - there really isn't anything about it that stands out, but at least they have a Starbucks!!

This is an outdoor outlet mall close to the downtown area. An uber to this mall from an down town hotel is approx $5-$7. This outlet mall is pretty big with store like Nike, Nautica,sketchers, Dkny, Disney, Calvin Klein, Children's place, Oshiro Kosh, Toys R Us,Tommy Guess. They are open Monday thru Saturday 9-9 and Sundays 9-8. We enjoyed shopping at this mall but didn't get to the whole outlet mall. It's quite big and it was kinda of a cold night. We will go back maybe during the day! Happy Shopping!!

This is my favorite place to shop in Vegas.  

They have lots of variety here, including some higher end outlets like Coach, Coach Mens, Burberry, Kate Spade etc!  Many kid's stores like Carters, Childrens Place, Gap Kids, OGBG, etc.....And lots of sports stores, like Nike, Addidas, Reebok, and Puma too, so essentially everything you are looking for will be here!

Really wish they had somewhere for kids to play though.  And better restaurants LOL...now I am getting picky.

Only bad thing is that it is outside...so when it is cold/hot, rainy/windy etc, it slows you down, but still a great place to shop!
My wife is looking for presents for friends/family birthdays. I am following her around. Shopping ain't my thing but this is a good place to go.

***Pro tip, visit the information center to buy the coupon book. It will save you a lot of $$$ if you're in the mood to shop.

Love the variety of stores here and outlet discounts !

1. Great selection of brands/stores
2. Tiny food court. Eat elsewhere. 
3. Long line and slow service for Starbucks in the summer
4. Ample parking

My favorite outlet store is Banana Republic because you can find good quality clothes for a reasonable price.
We shop here every time we are in town. We filled up the whole car!  It get busy here so parking is challenging but worth the hassle. Highly recommended!

I love shopping, but I love outlet shopping more! 

This place has a lot of good places - Kenneth Cole, Guess, Ann Taylor, Coach, Bebe, Nike and others. 

If you like Guess - you have to hit up this one because they have some great deals.  My friends got jeans for $15 and the tops are cute.

I loved the French Connection - a lot of the stuff was an additional 30-50%.

Beware of the Coach outlet, they are great deals but it's full of other women wanting that Coach purse for 30-50% off the retail price.  

I do like this outlet though. A lot of the name brand stores do have good deals. it's outdoors so it's nice to walk around and enjoy the day.  But if it's REALLY hot, which it can be in Vegas then maybe you won't enjoy the day. Anyway, if you don't want to blow your money at a casino gambling or eating at a buffet, go shopping here and buy something nice for yourself.
Prefer this to the south outlets here in LV. Slightly strange layout but overall good shops. Higher end to the south outlets. Taxi right outside.

We went to Las Vegas Premium Outlets to eat at Makino's, and so I'm quite torn on how to review this mall.  I originally wanted to give it a one star because of their unorganized parking.  From when we exited the I-15 Freeway to parking in their garage took a whole thirty-five minutes.  Needless to say, I was not happy to be there.

Our trip to this mall was on a Saturday afternoon.  I figured it would just be like taking a trip to Town Square, as easy as eating pie.  But, I was wrong and didn't work out that way.

The reason for the three stars is because the stores are good to visit and the employees seem really nice.  Everything is inexpensive and there are always deals going on.  Deals are always good to have especially with me.  :)

I will probably have a better time if I went there when it wasn't a weekend.

I like this outlet. First, it is quite near the city, just a few minutes' drive. Second, it s quite concentrated, making the stroll quite easier. Third, it is more focused on American stuff. Also, the service is quite nice, and shop assistants are really helpful. I love the place.
First time to visit this outlet store in Vegas and i must say they have the best selection of nike merchandise. I found my favorite running shoes here.

Las Vegas!

I never knew there was an outlet here.
Perhaps, all my attention was indeed in dining and enjoying nightlife :p

Anyway, I was here on Christmas eve and Christmas day during the day. I didnt have that much time to shop on eve, so I basically just browsed around for an half hour or so and left. There were a couple stores that I wanted to go in but the line was way too long (Tory Burch, Michael Kors, and Ferragarmo).

I came back the next day on Christmas day, and things were even worse. Most of the stores were closed. Bummers. I kind of figured that some stores could be closed but why does it have to be all my favorite stores? Sucks, but this is totally my fault.

This outlet has many great designer shops to other more less expensive and easy-to-be-seen stores like Aldo, Quiksilver, Gap, and Nike factory outlet. 

Enough parking to accmodate all the visitors and shoppers in the parking structure and outside parking. Also have a few places to eat and many carts that sell 'snacks' as well.

Whenever I come to Vegas, I usually make it a point to just do most of my shopping here. It's a good way to kill a couple of hours.

They have the usual brands, including my faves Gap, Banana Republic and J.Crew. They also have a couple of Starbucks stalls and a food court.

The place is huge though...pick up a map at guest services and plot your course carefully....or just pull up the map on your cell phone like I do.

I typically end up buying way more than I anticipated and Priority Mailing it all home - which sometimes is cheaper than checking a bag.

I love this outlet out of all the outlets I've been too. Well,  mainly because the Kate Spade store here is quite big.   I like the fact they also have LeSportSac here as well.  It's hard to find their outlet store in the US.  I know there's another one in Seattle.  The parking lot here is pretty cool.  It will tell you how many spaces are open and will light up to tell you there's a space, just like the mall in Santa Monica.  And parking is free!   The mall is clean overall, and they have plenty of seats in the food court.   I will make sure to make this a tradition to come here every time i come to Vegas. I see a lot of Chinese tourist here with their empty suitcases to collect all their goodies.  Pretty cute to see this.

Having shopped here multiple times a year, spending plenty of $$ each time we come to Las Vegas, I was shocked to see this place has gone the same route as the corporate whore casinos on the strip - they now charge $5.00 to park in their already completed parking structure. Last visit ever.

I am a much bigger fan of the North outlets rather than South.  They just have more stores that I shop at. 

I like to check the website for sales (ie. 40% off clearance) as that usually determines when I will make the trip out here. 

Banana and Gap will offer sometimes offer a 15% discount on a future purchase if you complete a survey after your transaction. 

Now let's discuss PARKING. I don't know what was going on, but last Saturday parking was ABSOLUTELY insane.  Worst time I've had parking there.  I went around 2pm and the outside lot was full, the parking lot on Alta was full so I ended up trailing these cars into the other parking lot which took FOREVER.  We were just crawling up each floor of the parking lot looking for spaces and even the people leaving the parking lot were jammed up as well.  Looked like it would have taken like 30 mins to get out of the lot!  Luckily I found a space, after contemplating turning around.  My advice is to go EARLY if you're going on a weekend or later on in the afternoon. The traffic totally cleared up when I left around 5pm.

I love this place. I spent more money than I wanted to, but when it's 110 degrees outside and you have a choice of going inside a nice air conditioned store or melting outside, shopping too much is inevitable.

This outlet mall is pretty cool. I love that they have both Michael Kors and Coach, and other favorites such as Guess and Juicy.

It's pretty big so it's hard to get through all of it unless you know what you're looking for. 

My bf and I found some pretty good deals last weekend but unfortunately the heat was too much to bear. Most stores have air conditioning though which helps.

Overall, I recommend!

As I write this tears are streaming down my internal fashionista's face. FCUK! The French Connection outlet store is no more. It has been replaced with a sad Rue 21. I am this close to downgrading to three stars, but the outdoor exercise element and my latest sweet finds at the Diesel and Vans stores is saving this Premium place for the time being. And, J. Crew did a nice job for me too. On a somewhat related note: The Polo store makes me a little crazy.

I went here on a Saturday around 1:00 after some brunch at Baby Cakes Cafe :)

Parking is normally an issue, but I lucked out and found a spot quickly. From what I saw, the recommended technique to finding a spot is to drop off the kids and wife and then drive through the parking garage. 

Outlet malls may have good stores, but they usually stock old items. I didn't find that to be the case here. These outlets were quality stores with quality merchandise and low prices. 

Now that I am familiar with the layout, I'll come again.

If you catch it on a gnarly holiday they hav a lot of sale here. My personal fave here? Tumi! Yes I am so down with a lot of stores here. Who cares if it's an outlet. Reaaallly good stuff tho'. So if you are needing for a new gear and kicks. ( clothes and shoes) this is your go place. Unless, you have a lot of dough to spend then this is not for you . ( go Caesars forum ) . Hey just a reminder its not all that cheap here, it's far fetch from your regular Marshall's and TJ Maxx or Ross. A wallet maybe 150 depending on where you go. Purse 250 or 300 up to 2000 ( cant afford the 20000 ) :) depends. But no super low ballers :) ... happy shopping... :)

HUGE HUGE HUGE. this place has almost everything!!!  Even great places to way in the food court. Misters going in the summer so that makes the outside shopping more bearable. I sober too much money but can't wait to go back !!

I have always found this to by my favorite shopping for someone who hates shopping. They have a lot of very high end clothing stores for half the price. And my favorite shop DIESEL which I can't get enough of. You can look forward to spending at least 2 hours here walking around. And add an hour if you go with someone who loves to shop. : /

I always find something good here.  I can't stand the Premium Outlets near Palm Springs or the Camarillo spot.  Way overcrowded and stupid lines everywhere.  I'll save my shopping trips for this outlet.

Other than walking the strip, hiking Red Rock, or just gambling....this is our preferred 'walk-off-buffet' spot after lunch.  Nothing strenuous, just using foot and eye coordination.  Walking from one outlet store to another, we try to gain some appetite for dinner or late night treat.  

They have a nice assortment of outlet stores, from Adidas to Banana Republic to Timberland.  Surroundings are clean and well kept, and parking is plentiful.  If there's one thing to complain about, it would be the food court.  For the size of this outdoor mall, I expected to see a much larger food court and more snack options for people on the go.

Nonetheless, I usually feel like a winner here more than any casino I've been to.  

Outlet prices + Clearance items = Jackpot

The last Vegas North Premium Outlets have most of the brands I like. Coming here during a non-peak season is easy. There is ample space to park. It is also I good outdoor outlet. Stores are organized and not all over the place. If you want to get some cardio into your day and do some shopping? Come to this place. During peak-season such as Thanksgiving day and Black Friday, be prepared to test your patience and endurance. This place gets packed like a sardine and customers starts to get agitated due to the long wait for parking, traffic, waiting to get inside the stores, or just plainly impatient and rude. Aside from that, this is a good place for shopping whenever you are in Las Vegas, either off-season or peak season.

If you're going outlet shopping while in Vegas this is the one to go to. Skip the one in the South.  Its not as nice and dint have as many nice brands you're looking for.

Yes, its pretty hot here as its an outdoor mall but they have all the misters and fans going which make it a little more bare able.  Parking can be a bit challenging on a busy day but we came on a Thursday and it wasn't too bad.  There's also plenty of your typical mall food stops here for a snack or beverage.

Great stores, great selection! Problem is... parking is a little bit of a pain and it seems no matter where you park you're doomed to reach the outlet center already hot and sweaty... 

Although this place has all the great name brands, it's hard to give a place 5 stars that involves walking around in 110 degree Vegas heat for a long time.. you'll definitely leave thirsty and tired during the summer!

In hopes of finishing up my XMAS shopping... friend and I went here on a weekend (suicidal, yes... desperate... another yes.)

I failed miserably on finishing my XMAS list... I ended up buying ALL of my XMAS gifts to myself! 

- Benetton rocked... got a $125 suit (jacket and pants) - nice!

- Columbia (I'm in love with them!) killed me! I got another soft shell jacket as well as a track jacket ... (I'm a jacket whore!) ... I literally had to pull myself out of there before I do any more damage to my wallet!

- Adidas - got the clima-something pants for when I need to work out during the winter season plus a beanie... 

Oh I did get a couple of shirts for the nephew at Gymboree... so I at least got something... besides myself =P

Anyway... friendly folks in all the stores... well at least to the stores that I went too...

Happy shopping!

Always the outlet to go to when in Vegas. Don't waste your time at the South, just come straight North.

Got great deals on Puma (40-70% off), Michael Kors, Marciano, and the list goes on! Spent a solid $600 here. lol
This place is great. It's indoors, your shopping comfortably in AC and the variety of stores is big. The discounts are great. They have 2 food courts and great places to eat outside the mall.
Quite frankly, between Boss, Etro, Ted Baker, and Burberry I'd be flat broke if I lived anywhere near here.  The ability to get there on comfortable and clean busses....enough said.

This is probably my favorite outlet center in the country.  They have a good variety of high and lower end stores to suit anyone's preference.  And no matter what you're looking for, they will most likely have it. From clothing to shoes to bags, you really can't go wrong here.  I come here on every Vegas trip.  It's a little pricy getting there from the strip if you cab it.  There are free shuttles from the Grand Chateau for hotel guests that run every hour.  Other hotels may have similar services so it's something to look into if you're visiting and don't have a car.

This is a nice place to visit if you want to get off the strip.  They have plenty of parking in the garage so your car won't roast in the sun all day. The stores are all outside and the layout is a bit confusing. You really need to follow the maps. And being outside, it can get toasty. So plan accordingly. Decent deals, but nothing earth shattering.  Overall, a good place to check out.

Der Outlet ist sehr sauber und Ordentlich!
Man bekommt von echt jeder marken etwas.
Wenn man in Ruhe durchgeht findet man auch sehr gute Schnäppchen!

Winners win big and shop at the Las Vegas Premium Outlet to get what they deserve. But losers, well, all they can do is window-shop. 

"I'm neither; so don't ask too much from me."

This is a very lively and well-architect outlet, especially in the dark evening. There are many stores that fit my rugged and suave lifestyle. Some of the discounted stores I've visited are Nike Factory Outlet (of course), Adidas, Puma, Timberland, Ecco, Mark Ecko, Gap/Banana Republic, Bose, Tag heuer, Ferragamo and L'Occitane. 

The food court is small with a Subway, China Pantry The Great Steak and Potato Co, Dairy Queen, Italia Express and of course a Starbucks all located inside a separate dome with a club-like atmosphere with current dance hits. 

In a separate location, there is also a Makino Seafood and Sushi Buffet restaurant.

In case many of you are concerned about my endurance and fatigueness, I was able to walk the entire bright-light outlet mall.

All my favorite stores in an outlet!

There's a Kate Spade outlet store? Why yes. What about a Tory Burch? Oh, hell yes! So, I had a great time and probably spent too much, but hey we're in Vegas!

The bathrooms were clean and it was easy to get a taxi back to our hotel. The only bummer was that there were no great sales for President's Day weekend. The weather was also wonderful so it was nice to be shopping outdoors!

Also, the outlet was only a few miles away from the strip so very easily accessible!

Better than the Premium Outlets South by far!
They have some great high end stores as well as your average outlet stores.
The set up is nice, its not too big.
Free parking garage which was full as hell (we're talking an hour to park!) on a saturday afternoon.
Sunday  morning was perfect though, empty and painless.
Its very clean and well kept with something for everyone.
Its a must stop for anyone wanting to do some shopping in Vegas without breaking the bank.

A little confusing  to get to from the I-15. You're better off driving north on Las Vegas Blvd and following the street signs. Parking is pretty ample and The outlet has a variety of shops that caters to the high-end shopper & pinching your pennies shopper. A definite shopping center to visit while visiting Las Vegas

This is one of the best outlets I have ever been to.  They have all nice brands and it it not too far from the strip.  You should sign up for a free VIP membership to get extra online coupons and a coupon books from the information booth.  I prefer this one to the one in the South.  I will go back next time I am in town.

Paraíso das compras, sensacional, amplo, confortável e completo. Reserva pelo menos dois dias para percorrer tudo. Não deixe de se inscrever no site https://www.premiumoutlets.com/vip para pegar o voucher que dá direito aos cupons de desconto grátis - imprima o voucher e troque pelos cupons na administração do outlet. E cuide do cartão de crédito, é um perdição! Uma dica: reserve um dia para ver tudo e anotar os preços e o dia seguinte para comprar.

The outlets in the Bay Area are nowhere as nice as the ones in Las Vegas. That being said, a trip to Vegas calls for a trip (or two) to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets and I was so glad I went on a weekday! Some of my favorite stores are Nike, Tory Burch, Kate Spade, Cosmetics Company Outlet etc. If you like Coach, Burberry, Michael Kors, Polo Ralph Lauren then you will definitely be impressed with the selection of stores. Everyone warned us that the North outlets was in a shady side of town, but it wasn't that bad during the day!

We love coming here when we're in Vegas.   The 150 stores are amazing.  We got some great deals at Spyder, Adidas, Ecco, Burberry, etc.  Okay, almost at every store.  You can save lots of money from the malls and stores on the Vegas strip.  It's worth the trip out here.  

You can take a taxi for about $20.00.  I usually rent a car during our visit so I can come back a few times during my stay.

These outlets are awesome. I'm not into shopping: I like going into a store having an idea of what I want and buying something if it meets that idea. These stores let me do that. There is always at least one thing I want to buy every time I go to the outlets. Last year's Labor Day was crazy; I found great deals on Calvin Klein casual button ups and Rusty and Quicksilver shorts.

The selection of stores is great, from Oliver Peoples to Nike, Polo, Kenneth Cole, Zumiez, Adidas, American Apparel, Quicksilver, Volcom, etc.

Most of the time I find parking in the outside lot; only once did I have to rely on the structure, and did not have trouble finding a spot.

I like this outlet, but was disappointed to see that they are now charging $5 for parking. Just another way to rip off the tourist especially knowing there is no other parking options in the area. I maybe rethinking if I wanna shop here in the future.

Ok, so I'm a guy, and I admit, I kinda like to shop around! I think the Outlet Malls in Vegas give you another option to gambling, remember what I said in an earlier review... This Outlet, near downtown is easily accessible by bus, car or cab. Lot's of parking and stores to see. Actually got a good deal on some walking shorts here as well as some stuff for the niece and nephew! Good food court and there's lot's of places to sit and rest. But I think if you go early in the day or late in the afternoon it may be better since it can get pretty hot!
Always great deals. Sizes run pretty small in general. I I my like to buy on clearance and there are always great finds

If I had to choose between the Las Vegas north outlet versus the south outlet, I would choose the north hands down. However a big difference is the north is outdoor while the south is mainly indoor so in the summer time i would recommend the south one.

The north has more variety of stores and more higher class store names compared to the south. Also they have covered parking garage and I believe the north is bigger. I'm not 100% sure but from my experience with both I just felt like I walked more on the north side.

It's also right by the highway but there is construction so it is pretty hectic right now but if you are a tourist then I would just uber or lyft your way from the strip. It's like 5$ and it's worth the lack of stress in my opinion.

I really like these outlets!  They have a lot of high end stores that I've never seen in other outlet malls, but they also have some of the typical outlet players.  It's pretty easy to navigate - there are a ton of maps with the stores listed in alphabetical order.  In the summer there are misters that make it more bearable to walk around outdoors.  

I take off a star because I think the parking garage is one of the more frustrating to park in.  In my experience there's always a long line of cars waiting to park and it takes forever.  Other than that, a great place to shop with good variety.

Its alright. I prefer the Premium Outlets South because its enclosed. The Food court is better and the stores are geared more for locals and not tourists. Plus I stopped in at Auntie Anne's pretzels with my little one, and the employees were rude. Like they didnt want to deal with the line and the tourists. HELLO You work at the PREMIUM OUTLETS. Tourist Central. QUIT YOUR JOB IF YOU DONT LIKE IT. Yes i was rude to her right back.

I love this place hey have Kate spade and all the other stores I like.  I come here when we don't stop at primm, because it is the only other Kate spade.

The parking when it is busy is Better to park across the street instead of trying to go in the structure. 

The place is hot during the hot summer months and very unbearable.

The Good:
decent shops for guys - burberry, boss, quicksilver, AX. a lot of outlets only have the one or two stores you'd go in so its really not worth the trip out.

opens later...shops close i think either 8 or 9 pm so normal mall hours.

decent selection..so its not all the junk u dont want to buy from a normal store.


The Bad:
prices are much higher nowadays...its not that much of a difference to go into the regular stores...well, still much cheaper than the Caesar Forum Shops but!!! 

far away from the strip, so if u didnt drive to vegas, its not worth cabbing it there...but the good thing is that there are a lot of cabs waiting outside of the outlets if a ride is needed back to the hotel..

Great Premium outlet. Always good deals in a lot of shops. Usually always enough parking spots available, though on weekends or days when there are special events or expos in Vegas it can get a bit tricky to find a spot.

This place has become part of a Tuesday ritual with my friend. Nothing is better than getting dim sum and walking around the outlets to burn off all the delicious Chinese goodness you consumed. Although I have been unfaithful and visited many other shopping malls on my weekly excursions, this will always hold a special place in my heart. I know it is redundant to repeat how much of a deals hound I am, but who does not love a good sale?

Banana Republic always has some great sales going. In February, they had a suit sale. What normally would have been $350, sold for $135. I bought two fitted suits for almost the same price as one. 

When I need workout close, Adidas is the place to go. Watch out for red ticket items. Every now and then they do specials where they take an extra 50% off of drastically reduced inventory. 

There are so many stores, that targets a vast range of consumers, you are bound to come out with some amazing finds. Even if you don't, it is good exercise. Just avoid during the summer, the crowds are massive, the heat is killer, and the shear amount of people only makes the Las Vegas sun more unbearable.

Every time I go here, I ask myself why!?
The Columbia outlet store is the only reason I head here, there isn't another in town. I like the Columbia outlet store but I seriously hate these outlets as a whole. Getting in and out is never easy. Even when it's not a holiday or weekend, parking is a nightmare. Always crowded, full of rude people. There's no airflow if you go on warmer days, it gets stuffy in those walkways. They're currently doing some sort of construction outside of the parking garage making things an even bigger cluster f***. I'll read this review every time I think I want to go to this outlet.

This mall was appropriately sized, but for me, stores in it were not as interesting as some premium malls have in LA. You can get there by taking public transit or Uber, but I suggest use personal vehicle since the mall has ample space for parking.
Overall, nothing was super interesting, but also nothing to complain too much about. Maybe I was expecting too much.
Easy 3.5 to 4 stars tho.
I am in it for all of this! Beautiful day calls for some nice outdoor shopping! Loving it!

ALWAYS find something good here. Even when I pep talk myself in the car before I walk in that I don't need anything and I can't be spending my whole paycheck like last time. Yet as always, I come out of there a few bags heavier and a whole wallet lighter. 

My favorite spots are Levi's, Pacsun, Nike, and I've heard great things about Kate Spare, Nine West, Adidas, and Lululemons, but ya know my wallet can only take me so far.

First time going to any of the outlets in vegas and WOW, pretty impressive.  idk if it's just me but they have MUCH better stuff here than the outlets in CA.  Wish we could have stayed longer, but next time I think I'll have to squeeze this into our schedule.  Parking wasn't bad either.

Weather is nice for outdoor shopping, a nice leisurely stroll after some sushi, stores like Coach, Burberry, LaSporte, Levi, etc...not really crowded tonight. Most offering some deals. 

I am not a shopper, but I like seeing what's out there, and who's offering what, I guess you can call me a window shopper for sure, however, I do love a good shoe, and well, I find it hard to find one that fits well, keeps my feet comfy during work, and well that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. So when I am at the outlet mall, (usually when relatives are in town), I like to check the shoes. 

But, soon, the weather is gonna get colder, the Holidays are coming up fast and black Friday will soon be here. If you can stand the crowds, there is guarantee some great bargains so get out to the outlet mall to take advantage of them.

DO NOT LEAVE BAGS IN CAR. Shopping center owners have no regard for customers safety.

My brother--in-law went to our van to drop off bags. When we all went to the van someone had broken in and taken everything. We went to tell security. Apparently it happens ALL THE TIME. There is absolutely NO CAMERAS. NO SECURITY that goes around parking lot. There were other people whose cars had been broken into. 

At my local mall stores always ask me if i want the receipt or put in in the bag. Here at this mall EVERY store we went to automatically put it in the bag. We left all our bags in the car with their original receipt in them. We were later told by a local that on the street they cant get much for whatever they take but since the bags have the receipt in them they just go and get the cash back from the store. 

I know parking lots cannot be responsible for lost or stolen items. BUT to have no cameras and no security is an open invitation to crooks. People come here from all over the world and spend thousands of dollars and they can't add more security to a problem that apparently everyone around the area knows about.

Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2015 #13 - #365

OUTLET SHOPPING in Vegas!

You can't go wrong with shopping after Christmas with loads of clearance items on sale and many other deals to be had! My Mom's friend suggested to shop at the North Premium Outlets because they believed they had great deals. 

High end designers all around like Michael Kors, Godiva, Burburry, La Coste, Hugo Boss, Polo Ralph Lauren, True Religion and countless others that are located around the outlet. Parking in the garage wasn't a problem even though it was so packed with a long line of cars ready to park. Some stores like Tory Burch and Coach had long lines out he doors with waits as long as up to 2 hours. Shopping after Christmas has been a family tradition with excellent deals that you couldn't resist.

Make sure you come here in the morning and try to get most of your shopping done before noon because it gets HOT outside!! Then have a nice lunch at Cheesecake Factory and leave before you melt! Avoid the indoor food court - it's overpriced, crowded and the food is not that good. You're better off getting a lunch special at Cheesecake Factory and relax for an hour at a nice table. 

There's a Lululemon outlet here and you can find great deals on yoga clothes! This is the main reason I come to the Outlets.

Love this outlet!! My favorite shopping destination in Vegas!! Just try to stop by Tory burch first bc there's always a line in that freakin awesome store. Then u can make your ways to the other stores through this nice outlet mall. Food here sucks but who eats when you can shop. Just give me a bottle water & a Twix bar & I am good for 4 hrs of shopping galore. If u run out of water... Tory burch always provides great customer service & provide you with a can of soda or bottle water.

Seems like everything in Vegas is crazy with a capital Z.  The traffic was crazy, the parking was crazy, the crowds were crazy.

Unfortunately we had to shop. No, really, it was an emergency.  Brother's wedding reception that night. 

And that morning we discover in a moment of heart-stopping horror that we left my boyfriend's suit and all his fancy clothes in a garment bag. Hanging in a closet in a motel at the opposite end of Nevada. 

So. We hit the outlets hard and walked away with a passable sport coat, shirt, etc. 

Here's some tricks we used to survive:

- Follow the taxis. The street lay-out is a maze, the signage non-existent, you'll get lost on your own. Follow the guys who know where they're going.

- Skip the parking lot. Use the valet service.

- Time to leave? Give the valet dude a big-ass tip, and he'll get your car fast. Time = money.  You either pay with money or you pay with time. Your choice.

- Bring your own water bottle. The fountains don't work and the prices are crazy.

Crazy!

Holy crap... stop the presses... 

I just found out the Disney Store Outlet here gets Disneyland park merchandise and sells it at a fraction of the cost.  I picked up an entire bag of $32 shirts marked down to $4.99 each.  What a find!  Why did I waste my time all of these years going to the AMS-run Disney Outlet in front of the (South) Las Vegas Premium Outlets at the other end of Las Vegas Blvd?

Oh, and I love the prices at the Coach store too.  Found a small wallet/ID holder for a gift for only $20. And last time I was here I got a cute LeSportsac bag (before i knew about the Disney Store).

It used to be for me that there was an excitement in going to the LV Outlet...now somehow the excitement has faded and instead replaced with a sense of dread and frustration.  It's great seeing all the high end stores, but the quality of their outlet products are just not up to par.  Somehow I was under the impression, at least in the past, that the outlet products are the items that did not sell at the retail store...but now I am sensing that the companies specifically produce lower quality goods for their outlet stores and sell them at a "discount" price.  So during this last trip, we went to all the stores we wanted to go, looking for some great after Xmas buys only to be disappointed by the prices and quality.  In fact, we checked online for many of the products and found cheaper prices at the company's retail online store.  So why deal with the crowds, the pushing, waiting in line to get in stores, and the rude new wave of clientele when you can click some buttons and have it shipped to your house?

Great place for people from Hawaii :) cheap prices everywhere and all of vegas's summer clothes is on clearance and super cheap!! :D

We can summer clothes everyday through out the year :)

I wish I prepared my Christmas/Birthday list beforehand. I was really happy with the deals at baby/toddler clothing stores like Gymboree, Carters, and The Children's Place while Coach offered a 50% off coupon at the door which made deals better on handbags, wallets, wristlets, totes, etc. than any I could find online including ebay. 

There's pretty ample parking and during the hot summer months, refreshing water sprays along the walkways. For dining, there's a dependable California Pizza Kitchen which serves alcohol and other choices.
Had so much fun here with my family. Spent way too much money, and the place was really clean. Great deals, clean, and pretty good food court.

Great selection, superior service. We were able to get last year's Alexis Bittar's rings my friend was looking for a long time. Their selection of Lululemon was outstanding. And we left with our bags full of new running stuff. They also have many more premium brands to choose from than any Simon malls that are in North California
Beware of the kiosk clerks. They can probably convince you to buy $10000000 face cream. Doctorates of sales these people are

My favorite outlet in Las Vegas! There are so many stores here, and many of them are high brand (such as Burberry, Vince Camuto, Tumi, Dolce&Gabbana, etc.). You can be sure to go here and leave the outlet with both hands full of heavy shopping bags.

They also have stores such as Charlotte Russe and PacSun, for those of you who are not interested in high brand items, but are looking for good clothes at a discount! 

The most popular stores here would probably be Michael Kors, Kate Spade, and Polo Ralph Lauren. I'm probably missing a lot, but I always see shoppers carrying bags from those stores wherever I go.

They also have a cafeteria and many small shops to eat, in case you ever get hungry. I noticed that this outlet recently opened a Chipotle store as well!

The holiday and post-Christmas season seem to have the biggest sales, with a lot of stores boasting a clearance of at least 50-70% off. If you visit Las Vegas, you need to shop here to make your vacation complete!

Go early in the morning! You'll beat the heat and the parking scarcity! I bought Tory burch sandals and flats for the price of 1! Francesca's is also buy one get one 50%!!! My grand total was as much as one thing would have been!

I have a love-hate relationship with this outlet. I love that it has most the stores I need when shopping for the brood. However, I stay away and dont ever think to come to this outlet during any holiday. ANY.HOLIDAY. While I'm happy with its latest additions of stores and restaurants and parking. Parking still sucks and i don't have the patience for it. But we're smart about it now...if we must come...we go a bit later in the evening rather than hours where tourists have awoken, had their breakfast/lunch, and are ready to donate to.our economy. I like to go when everyone iz thinking it's getting dark, dinner is approaching, feet tired, etc...lol. That'd be the best bet you won't be sitting in traffic...in a parking garage.  Other than that...it's a vibrant place to roam around and get some shopping done. Well, except for when it's summer. Eek.

Definitely kid and stroller friendly. 

Enjoy!

I love these outlets. This is a must place to stop when in Vegas. It has the best stores, and great service inside all the stores. The only one downside is that it is outdoors and when it is hot it sucks because shopping in the heat is no fun- but all the stores have AC blasting so that's a major plus. 
These outlets have all the best stores and always have great sales- so it really deserves 5 stars!
like all outlet. its pack. their tory burch outlet isnt really an outlet. other then tory burch i dont know if ill come again.
Lots of walking.  4 stars because the bathroom was super gross.  But everything else was great.  Shopping from bargains to luxury.

We spent an afternoon here. I love all the high end stores that they had to offer. The place is pretty big so a lot of walking. It's outdoor setting so you will get a lots of sun tan. Very clean environment.

This is one of two outlet centers I like to shop when visiting LV to catch some great deals. There are 2 parking structures, and the first couple of parking floors are packed. Some advice - park at the top! No one parks up there!!! Yes, it may take a while to get up there due to the slow traffic, but it's well worth the wait.

Food court could be better, but I don't generally stay here long enough to eat a meal. 

I typically shop at:
-Burberry
-J. Crew
-Ken Cole
-FCUK
-BR
-CK
-Lancome store

Pro's -  Best outlet shopping I've ever experienced.  Got both a Coach and Dooney Bag for under 100.00 each.  Tank tops at Banana Republic for 4 bucks.  Got my son some shirts for 5 bucks each and some dress clothes from Gap for under a 100 bucks for two shirts and two pants.  Husband got two Quicksilver shorts for 50 bucks.  We could have done a lot more damage but our time was limited.

Con's -  It was hot!  But then it was our choice to travel to Vegas in the middle of July.  There were busloads of foreign tourist who push and shove their way around the place, especially in the Coach and Dooney store.  At the Dooney store this lady was giving the salesgirl a hard time because she couldn't use this coupon she had for an additional 10% off on a particular item.

This place gets packed early like around 11am.  It's an outdoor setup.  Food court isn't very big and I don't think there are any restaurants.  Items aren't that cheap here and yet people had bags and bags of stuff.  There are a lot of tourists that come here.

Oh and the customers are very rude and obnoxious.  People walk like they own the entire walk area.  Oddly enough sales staff are very friendly and helpful.  I've never seen so many smokers in a shopping area before but then again this is Las Vegas. 

Parking sucks. Maybe because it's still under construction.  They have some high end shops.

I wandered through a couple of the stores and can't say that I was all that impressed with their offerings. Some of the major stores like Guess and Diesel offer better deals in their regular stores when they have sales and you don't have to deal with the madness and chaos that the Outlets can be on a busy day. I'm told that season transition time is not the best time for bargains, so i'll go back in the summer and see what they have.

 Today a man head butted me while he tried to jump for a shirt. It was an accident (carelessness on my part, I'm sure, for standing still in plain sight) and no fault of the store that I was in, but I probably won't go back again unless it's the middle of the day on a weekday when tourist season is low.
 
 Being outside on a mild day is the best part of the experience. The shopping; well, I left empty handed.

I know these stores as the Charleston outlets as it's right off the 15 freeway and Charleston exit. It's all about the Nike Factory store for me here but I have scored some nice work clothes at Gap & Banana Republic. So many stores... It's an outdoor outlet mall so prepare yourself when it's hot out. It can be draining walking around... They've organized the parking so you can see by color green or red whether the parking space is open or not from afar. Bring your patience as this place gets packed every day of the week and especially on weekends.
It's an outdoor outlet in the desert! Lots of my favorite stores to shop at! When we came here, it was super crowded and parking was such a pain. However, there's great deals for shopping.

These outlets have become a required detour on every trip to Vegas. I particularly like the Tumi and Kenneth Cole outlets here. A Tumi Outlet is a rare thing. It's worth going to Vegas just for this Outlet store.
This place is good if the weather permits. If it is super hot or super cold dont go. Its all out doors. I like the south one more because it is indoors.

There are a multitude of shops, including Guess, VanHeusen, and Kay. Obviously, the prices are expensive. Lots of people are here everyday. Not many parking spaces are available during the signature rush hour.

Odd layout for people who've never been there before.  I'm actually pretty good with directions and when I thought we'd gone the entire loop, I was all turned around.

Otherwise, it's a pretty cool outlet mall with a decent selection of stores.  Vending machines and snack vendors everywhere in case you need a break from shopping.

Plenty of parking with reliable indicators if a parking spot is free (no more false starts only to find out a small car or motorcycle is parked in a stall).  

Bring your credit cards! (But spend responsibly.)

I wanted to do some shopping on Black Friday here - apparently everyone else in town wanted to do the same! It took at least 30 minutes just to try to get into the parking structure. It was mayhem. 
 
This outlet has some great stores - a little something for everyone. I think this place caters to a lot of international tourists. There were definitely long lines for the designer stores. I avoided any store with long lines outside of the stores. I found a lot of shoe stores to carry small sizes so if you're a size 5-6, then you're in luck!

The layout of this place is chaotic - it's kinda laid out like a spider web. Plus, there's so many shoppers during the holiday. Half the battle was trying to get through the crowd. There were definitely some good deals, but I don't know if I would bear the crowd again during a major holiday.

It was overcrowded and it was hard to find the parking garage. I wasn't that impressed with the sales. We went to Sketchers shoes outlet and it was overcrowded and small. People were throwing boxes everywhere and it was felt like I was in a can of tuna, just awful. The employees were rude and had no clue how to assist customers.
Wow, women everywhere, eye candy everywhere. My favorite spot for free eye candy while I do a little shopping. A must visit every time i'm in lv.

Las Vegas Premium Outlet is just alright. I wish it had MORE stores, but I work with what they have. I don't often shop here anymore because parking is horrible and I can't stand shopping when it's hot or too frickin' cold. So this place is definitely the LAST place that I go to for my shopping therapy. The food court is alright... Not too many selections. They have a Dairy Queen, two Chinese food places, Subway, a pizza place, and an up-and-coming Philly Cheesesteak place. They used to have a Makino's here, but that place closed. 

Would I shop here in the future? Eh, yes but rarely. I only come here for their super discounted prices on high-end brand names. Other than that, I like to feel comfortable when I shop around.. Not sweating my bawls off and feeling gross.

Overall, I have to say that I was very impressed with these outlets. They have a lot of shops even though it's outdoors. I'd recommend going in the early morning so it's not too hot out (they also have the spritzer machines to keep you cool). Although there's only a handful of shops that I was interested in going to, they all had good (and current) selections at deeply discounted prices (compared to the regular stores). I imagine that this place gets pretty busy during the weekend so go early and go during the weekdays possible.

Premium outlets!! Hurray! This place is one of the better ones I've been to. 

This outlet has a great selection of stores, such as Nike factory, Express, Bose, Coach, Coach MEN, Michael Kors, Kate Spade, Adidas, Gap, Banana Republic, Mark Ecko, Dolce & Gabbana, Nautica, Tommy Hilfiger, Ralph Lauren, Ann Taylor, and much more. 

Parking sucks, so I would suggest going with a cab or UBER (now that they are LEGAL). My cousins drove us there and left us, so we decided to use uber ($13-18 ride). According to my friend Janice C., the cab ride from Mandalay Bay hotel is $20.

Small food court with selections such as Subway, Great Steak, Italia Express, etc. 

The outlets architect looks awesome, but while walking inside, I'm not a big fan, especially on cold days.. From what I looked, it was basically 2 U's - to get from one U to the second, you'd have to step outside Dx

As for crowds, they are pretty crowded during the winter time..... Holiday shopping and post-Christmas sales lol. For Michael Kors, there was a line, so if you're there during winter time, bring a jacket, gloves, and a scarf!!

Normally, I love the Premium Outlets as they are scattered all over the U.S. But I guess it depends on the season you're going so sales and product offerings can vary depending on your timing. When I was there in early March, I have to say I was super disappointed. Not a lot of sales and not a lot of good selection.

I think  Woodbury Common Outlet in New York and Seattle Premium Outlets are my favourite in terms of sales and selection. I mean they all have similar stores but I didn't find much at the Vegas North Outlet. Some of the stores I did like were: White House Black Market (small store though), Banana Republic, Gap, Nike (no real sales, felt like a regular store), Carters, Coach etc.

Cabbing it here from the Palazzo hotel was $16 each way. You can also take the bus but make sure you take the Express and not the Deuce, as the latter one will take much longer since it stops way  more often. 

There are two Premium Outlets, the other one is in the south near the Airport. The south outlet is indoor but it's not as nice as this one in the north. The mall seemed clean and didn't seem to be super busy on a Tuesday afternoon so that was nice.

This is probably one of the best outlets I've ever gone to. The Vegas outlets have a HUGE selection. Not just of stores, but of things at the stores. And it's only a 5-10 minute cab ride away from the strip (about $15 each way). 

You'll find pretty much all the high end designers here, as well as mid-range places too. All of the stores have great selection and carry a variety of sizes (not just XL and XXL!). Some noteworthy things I got was a BCBG dress (originally $280) for $40. And my boyfriend got Ferragamo sunglasses for $99 (usually $300+)! 

The only slight downsides are that it's outdoors and you have to put up with the Vegas sun and heat. The food court and bathrooms also aren't all that clean. But who cares when you find a great deal!!!
i came here three times on a six day trip to vegas, nuff said.

This is a must-stop every time I go to Vegas. It's designer discount heaven. But even outside of that (because a purse discounted to $300 from $900 is still $300), they have normal store outlets that can score you some killer deals. I walk away with at least two bags at every visit. 

Hit up: J Crew, Banana Republic, Gap, Coach, Kate Spade, Juicy, Levis & Perry Ellis.

Pass on: Burberry. While I can appreciate a good deal, you just won't find it there. At least, I haven't!

One of my favorite outlet malls!  I always try to stop here when I'm in town.  There are a lot of great brands that you don't find everywhere -Kate Spade, Stuart Weitzman, Joe's Jeans - as well as the favorites - BCBG, J.Crew, etc.

Too bad it's outdoor, but most outlet malls are.  If you're staying on the Strip, cab fare is less than $20, so it may not be worth taking the shuttle if you're going in a group anyway.

After shopping, the Makino seafood buffet isn't bad, especially if you're looking to save a few bucks after your shopping spree.  Certainly cheaper than a buffet on the Strip.

I personally did not care for this outlet. I was sadly surprised that the Michael Kors store was extremely big, but they didn't sell clothing! My husband loves going to outlets in whatever state we are in smh. Anyways, I found more things for myself at the shops on the strip, such as Fashion Show.

THE best outlet mall in vegas, or maybe even in america?  teehee.  on a regular old day, it's great.  their variety of stores are excellent and there's so many, it takes the whole day to go through ALL of them.  burberry, le sportsac, coach, juicy couture, bebe, french connection, pacsun, ecko, zoo york, quiksilver, bcbg, stuart weitzman, the list goes on and on.  however, if you come here on black friday, prepare yourself for no parking whatsoever and people trampling on you at 4 in the morning.

They started to charge  $5 for parking.  Ridiculous to pay for parking at an outlet mall.  Even the casinos give you 1 hour free.  The stores are just ok and prices not great so not worth paying the parking charge.  I won't return.
Best thing about this outlet mall - the Steve Madden store. Got amazing deals on super cute shoes!!

This mall has my favorite stores (Adidas, Oakley & Timberland) along with some of my "Tier 2" favorites - Puma, Quiksilver & Nike.

It gets really busy and so I would recommend getting here when it opens.  There is a multi-story parking structure attached to the mall.

This owner of this mall (Simon Malls I think) has a VIP shopper club you can sign up for online and then get a coupon to pick up a coupon book at the mall information office which has even more discounts on a lot of the stores (never Oakley though which is frustrating).

It is a couple of different buses to get here from the Strip - or about a $30 cab ride and so if you compare that to the cost of a rental car you can probably save money by getting a rental car for your trip to Vegas).

The food court here is pretty terrible and so I would either eat before, or stay hungry and eat somewhere else.

Shops open at 10 am but if you get there a little early they have a Starbucks to kick back at.  Parking can be a pain, so if you're a serious shopper, get there about 9:45 and you'll be fine... except during the holidays like Christmas, where's nothing can help you.

This place is nothing more than a shopping trap for those looking for good outlet deals. It seems like it is made primarily for tourists coming in on busses. Waves of people walk around and crowd up stores, bathrooms, and the small amount of eateries here. A lot of them buy big rolling luggages and lug them around the outlet. 

Anyways, let me start from the beginning,

Parking - We almost didn't even come here after driving around for 30 minutes looking for parking and finding nothing. The parking garage is horrible despite telling you how many spots are available. We came at the wrong time (130pm on a Saturday) and there were "0" spots available on all floors except the roof where the electric sign read "300+" spots free. Awesome, except when we got to the roof, there were no spots there either. Absolute useless sign. In fact some cars even parked where you're not supposed to park. Cars were circling everywhere and these people can't drive. You end up giving each floor a second chance and finding no difference. One person even reserved a parking spot by standing in the spot where a car is supposed to be. I guess their car was like 6 cars behind a trail of angry drivers passing up an otherwise available spot. We gave up and were already driving out when unfortunately we found someone was leaving so we pulled right in. Taking the bridge across to the outlet was non eventful. 

Outlet - you will want to take a quick glance over the directory. Not for the stores (let's face it, you're gonna walk all the way around anyways and hit em  all up) but for the food court and bathrooms. If you walk around in the middle of the day, there is no shade. Small shade sails might block 1% of the sun. Be prepared to bake from store to store. There are air mister fans than attempt to blow cool mist onto you as you pass beneath, but it's so damn hot it evaporates before it reaches you. 

Stores - you will soon find out that:

1) most of the stores are regular stores. Maybe 1 out of 20 stores are actually considered outlet stores. Basically they're just fillers to accept your money or the money of tourists willing to waste their money on regular items. 

2) no deals here unless you buy more than you want. Almost every store will say "buy one, get another for xx% off". you want a deal on crocs? Expect to buy three pairs just for the discount. Or get a discount on oakleys if you first pay full price for the first pair. There are far better discounts online on their company sites and you don't need to buy more than you need. 

3) there's not too many food stores. It's very weak compared to their sister outlet "las Vegas south premium outlets" which I recommend over this place. They are indoors, have two food courts, and less touristy. 

I think I could go on and on with this ridiculous place, but I'll stop here. I don't know why people would even like this place enough to recommend it. They obviously have never been to a real outlet. Definitely skip this place at all cost.
We like to go to the outlets. This is one of the better ones.  Of course not in the summer. Nice and cool in November.
I liked it....pretty much the same as the other ones you see. The staff were super helpful. There were deals if you looked a bit....even with the CDN/US exchange. Take an Uber or Lyft!

We finished 90% of our shopping before even checking into the hotel later in the day.  Glad we went early because the crowds and lines stat to dominate this place later in the afternoon.

Be prepared with a map because it is a bit maze like and easy to become disoriented if it is your first visit.  The store indexes do not have a "You are Here" star on them.  So you may likely find yourself along with a group of others trying to figure out your location.

The best time to go there is during the week, on a sunny day, bc parking and cold weather can be difficult in this outdoor mall.  However, they usually have incredible deals on brands and I never left there without a great bargain.

I'm the dude who usually hates shopping.

I'm the dude who holds all the shopping bags for his wife. I'm the dude who sits on those little girly chairs or sofas next to the fitting room waiting for his wife to try on clothes.

I'm the dude who ONLY likes going to this outlet in Vegas and spent a whopping 3 hours shopping here last weekend... and had a good time doing it.

A morning visit at 10:30.AM to the North Premium Outlet Mall was surprisingly hassle free. 

We easily parked in the north tower. The green light/red light system made the process of locating a place to park easy to spot. 

The corridors amongst the store venues were open and unpopulated. I smiled as I did not see crowds of huddled shoppers. 

After a purchase from the Quicksilver store, the clerk kindly offered me a map  to help me navigate towards O'Neill, Hurley, and Volcom. Also, there are customer service agents and kiosks who helped direct us to our destinations.

Back-to-School sales have begun.  The Gap, Le Sports Sac, Gymboree, A Children's Place, Nautica Kids are just a handful of stores ready for kids and their school year. Puma and Disney Store both have promotions this month, so check the website before you venture off into the maze of stores to help with strategic shopping.

Our morning jaunt ended with lunch at the Cheesecake Factory. The service was immediate and hospitable. James, our server, provided A+ service and attention.  The Chopped Salad was fresh. Also the crispy and supple kids' menu chicken tenders and perfectly grilled kids' menu salmon were well prepared. We sipped on three types of lemonade: raspberry, cucumber, and original. The beverage refills were free. Kids' drinks were included with their menu option.

if you want to buy better stuff go to Fashion Show Mall , wait for a holliday or sales ... better quality better stuff better everything
this outlet is more like a trap , it only makes you think you get a bargain but in reality you only get out of fashion left overs :)
Peace and love !
