Hot as hell during the summer.  Who thought of having an outdoor mall by Vegas?  lol.  Oh well, at least there are these water spritzer machines.  Doesnt' really help.  I guess the outdoorness makes people stay inside the shops more.

Nothing really special about this outlet tbh.

Parking suckssssssssssss!

I am basing this review mostly on the trip I took there about 2 weeks ago. I originally gave 5 stars to this outlet because it has three of my favorite stores.1. Tory Burch 2. Michael Kors 3. Kate Spade, but I took one star off because according to my bf's sister the parking is horrendous when it is busy and compared to Hawaii, people in the mainland are even crazier when it comes to limited parking. Also I have been to this outlet during the summer and they have those "mist" machines to help cool you down. Sadly I'm a short girl so in those times of dry LV heat, the mist evaporates before it reaches me. 

There were lines for Tory Burch and Michael Kors, but we only waited about 7-10 minutes. I found really good deals and used the "I'm on vacation" logic and bought what I pleased hahaha! Well, until we got to Kate Spade and I was reminded that we needed to bring all this back home..

They have alot of other stores like Guess, Marciano by Guess, Aldo, Sketchers, Coach, and so much more. They also have a food court and Starbucks. 

I would recommend this outlet over the one in the South any day! Can't wait to go back !
Brands are expanding, each time we come, always see new brands in. Product styles are very updated. Many products are selling here which we cannot find in LA's outlets. Awesome!
What can u say that hasn't already been said? This place is awesome for those who don't live  in metropolitan areas. It offers all the major brand names at outlet prices. Being ur comfy shoes!!!

So i got dragged here by women... but I have to say that not only was it interesting to look at all these premium stores (places I would normally not ever go to) but also to see some of the deals.  Defiantly a place to get some good clothing cheep!  Even the Disney store had some nice deals on stuffed animals.  The outdoor part was nice, despite it being a little cold. Parking is abundant in the garage and its free.  If you have some free time when in Vegas, its worth spending an hour or two bargain hunting.

By far the best service I have received in...Forever!! I was in search of a LeSportSac backpack (Polynesian Paradise pattern) and it was SOLD OUT on-line, so I contacted the LV outlet store and spoke w/ Alyssa. She knew exactly what item I wanted and said it was in stock and 40% off what I would have paid elsewhere. Glorious!!! She shipped my item that day and I received it the following day! Wow, that was fast!!!! She even included a nice, hand-written "Thank You" note! I'm impressed!!!  All stores & customer service personnel, "TAKE NOTE!" This is how a GREAT store is run & done! Thanks Alyssa & LeSportSac! You guys are awesome!!! If I had a megaphone, I would announce it to the world...good thing there's YELP! LOL! ;)
The fact that there is a Tory Burch outlet there is all I needed to know.  There are some really great stores.  Like most outlets - you really have to make sure you're getting a good deal.

i used to live in vegas and i would frequent these outlets. its ALOT better than the outlets on the south side of vegas (on las vegas blvd... before the strip). they have everything you could want... the only reasons why i gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was cuz its outdoor (its gets hot as a mofo in vegas come summertime) and its down the 15 freeway a little bit (like 10 mins or so). but other than that its a cool spot so check check check it out

In Las Vegas kann man zwischen zwei verschiedenen Outlets, den Las Vegas Premium Outlets - North und South auswählen. Von der Auswahl und Anzahl der Läden hörte sich das Outlet in der Downtown von Las Vegas interessanter an. Es war auch nur knapp 3 Kilometer von unserem Hotel entfernt.

Wer es einrichten kann, sollte hier früh morgens zum Shoppen gehen, dann findet man bequem einen Parkplatz im Parkhaus und ist nicht der sengenden Hitze ausgesetzt. Darüber hinaus hat man fast leere und aufgeräumte Läden ohne nervende Drängelei.

In den ca. 150 Stores findet man unter anderem Adidas, Benetton, Calvin Klein, Dolce & Gabbana, Levi's/Dockers Outlet, Nautica, Nike Factory Store, Polo Ralph Lauren Factory Store, Puma, Reebok, Timberland, Tommy Hilfiger und viele weitere.

Für das leibliche Wohl ist dort auch gesorgt. Man findet hier beispielsweise Amorino Gelato, Auntie Anne's Soft Pretzels, The Cheesecake Factory, Dairy Queen, Kung Pao Wok, South Philly Cheesesteaks & Fries, Starbucks Coffee und Subway.

Unser zweiter Besuch am Nachmittag war allerdings nicht so angenehm. Die Parkplatzsuche war im Parkhaus doch sehr mühevoll und die Läden waren sehr voll. Sehr unangenehm empfand ich die unerträgliche Hitze und der ständige Wechsel in die klimatisierten Stores. 

Die Premium Outlets North sind täglich geöffnet. Die Öffnungszeiten sind von Montag bis Samstag von 9.00 Uhr bis 21.00 Uhr und am Sonntag von 9.00 Uhr bis 20.00 Uhr. Insgesamt fand ich die Angebote und Reduzierungen nicht so reizvoll, kann aber auch daran liegen, dass der letzte USA-Urlaub noch nicht so lange her ist. Wer noch weiterfährt, kann in anderen Outlets sicherlich bessere Schnäppchen machen.

The stores in the outlet is amazing. Kate spade and Neman Marcus had the best offers.
It s pretty close to the best rated restaurants and the food court was also pretty good with DQ. Had coconut and strawberry smoothie at DQ and loved it. 
Don't forget to check out BeBe and BCBG for great offers. I'd love to see forever 21 and other stores in the outlet. 
Overall had a great time shopping !

Probably one of the best, if not the best outlet malls i have seen in the US.  They literally have everything here!

Nice outdoor environment.  The place is clean and orderly.  

Stocked up on some amazing deals here.

There's free parking and a lot of stores to choose from! I'm lucky to have a good self control or else I would go broke!

Only bad thing is the weather!!! Vegas! Why you got to be so hot?!

:D

This place is really not that far from the Vegas strip, yet offers slew of high-end outlet stores (Burberry, Tory Burch, Kate Spade, etc) along with more contemporary and "everyday" selections. Tip: Traffic can get pretty bad around popular dates/times (I was there during the Thanksgiving weekend) and the Uber will only drop you off/pick up at certain areas - this is strictly reinforced!

I didn't find the prices to match that of other outlets by the same company. Premium Outlets in Gulfport, Ms were much cheaper, these seemed more like retail prices. But it's Vegas so you expect to fork out the extra cash for everything I suppose. 
The parking made me want to jump off the top of the garage. I highly suggest installing speed bumps in there, people were driving all sorts of crazy and PASSING other vehicles at high speeds in the garage as the security guards on their segways directed traffic for no reason on the bottom floor.
The mall just imposes $5 parking fee for out residents cars. If you are not happy with this unusual charge, avoid this mall.

Not the best Premium Outlet I've been to, but it did have most of the things we were looking for. Levi's Kids is located in the branch in the south, we were told. 
The shops are located outside, which is nice when you are trying to avoid death by air-conditioning.
Sign up ahead of time for their VIP program (on their website) to get a free coupon book for extra savings. Otherwise, you can buy the book for a few dollars. It really is worth it, though. 
Small food court, but who's there to eat? Unless it's at The Cheesecake Factory

As far as outlet malls go, this is by far the best one within 100 miles! Before they opened up LV Premium Outlets in Downtown, I used to travel all the way to Primm for any outlet shopping. Now, I just have to hop on the I-15 going the other direction and boom! I am there!

Another great things about LVPO is their variety of high end stores. Personally this means more to the girlfriend then it does to me. However, a happy girlfriend = happy me.
This place is called a outlet but junk . Prices are the same as shopping at the regular stores . Nothing to be found here .

I've worked a stone's throw from this mega mall for 10 years but never go. Well, I used to go until the crowds got to be too much. 
I was enticed to return by VEGAS mag for a sneak preview of the brand new Neiman Marcus Last Call store, which is within the mall's latest expansion. There have been major renovations to the mall since my last visit years ago. The addition of Cheesecake Factory will certainly increase my number of visits!
Nice selection of stores, but I don't find the prices to be true "outlet" pricing or much of a bargain. I'm used to the true Outlet Malls of the past where bargains were aplenty. Of course some stores do have good deals and isn't half the fun in the hunt?

It was a lovely day of shopping at the las vegas outlet mall. by the time me and my friend were finished shopping we visited the bathrooms next to the info center, they were awfully hot with AC at all and therefore where also smelling very badly. I strongly suggest for people to wait to go to the bathroom until they get to a different location. Hopefully whoever is responsible will fix that because it absolutely ruins a nice day of shopping!

Las Vegas North Premium Outlets is an outdoor outlet mall located just a few minutes away from Downtown Las Vegas and The Strip.  Why do they have outdoor malls in the desert?  Well, it beats me because I couldn't bear the heat when I to these outlets in August so my shopping trip here was very short lived.  I imagine they would make more money in the cooler, winter months because when I went there once in November, I spent almost the entire day there.  The nice thing though, about these outlets, is that there are these water misting sprays scattered around the mall to cool you down from the heat.  The water spray is light and doesn't help a whole lot but it's better than nothing.  The last time I went, there was also a shave ice/snow cone truck called "Kona Ice" to help cool you down.     
      
Despite this mall being outdoors, I normally enjoy shopping here.  There are a lot of good stores here including Tory Burch (sometimes the store gets really packed so they make people form a line outside to wait), Rue21, Zumies, Michael Kors, Guess Factory Store, Bebe, and they even have an outlet store that sells show tickets.  There's a food court and a few snack kiosks as well.  
  
Overall, timing is everything at these outlets.  If you go during the summer, you will have to find a way to tolerate the heat.  There are multiple parking lots and structures but sometimes the outlets get so busy that you may have a hard time finding a stall.  The first time I shopped here, I had no trouble finding parking.  The second time I shopped here, I had to circle the lot a few times to find an open stall.  Their operating hours are pretty good as they usually close at 9 pm and are open on major holidays like Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's Day (shorter hours).

This is one the top outlets I've been to in the USA! I come here every time I am in Vegas and always find some great deals. There is a big selection of stores for men, most notably Diesel, Calvin Klein, Kenneth Cole, Energie, and all the fitness brands like Nike, Puma, Adidas, and DC Shoes. There is a lack of food options, but I don't come here to eat. I come here to buy clothes! A bonus is the new ACE Gold Line comes here from The Strip!

I've been to both Premium Outlets North and South this trip and found the North to be wayyy better. I will not go back to the South. The North Outlets are newer, have better stores and alot of visitors shop there. The sales people are also nicer. North outlets are outdoors (open mall) sucks when its really cold or hot, and can be difficult to follow the map and find stores sometimes. It can be alil confusing navigating around.  (but its worth it) The South is enclosed but just sucks all the way around. It's older and mostly locals shop there, it's alil more urban if you know what I mean. Also, both outlets carry different merchandise and when I went to the same stores at both, I found nicer things at the North Outlet.

Deals in every store around every turn never gets old. Lots of variety with the shops with a good mix of luxury brands and popular labels. Super easy to get to from the stripe with tons of taxi available.  Impressed with the restaurants that have opened - nothing wrong with a food fair  but nice to have the extra variety.
Great place to get the quality stylish goods at a discount from the designer prices!

Great deals here! If you have AAA membership, you can go to the information booth to get a coupon book for free! Otherwise, if you want one you need to pay $10 for one. Bought a whole bunch of items from belts, shirts, polos to purses and wallets. Great deals and sales! That's what an outlet is meant for!

A large, outdoor outlet mall with some of the best deals I've ever come across! They've got a lot of the good brands!!! Just to name some places I've shopped at: 

Armani Exchange, Armani
Bose, Fossil
Nike, Adidas, The North Face, Puma
Alex and Ani, Pandora
Disney Store, Kate Spade
Tory Burch, Michael Kors, Aldo
Asics, Journeys, Lululemon

They have a Starbucks, an Auntie Anne's, and a Cheesecake Factory. A food course. They just recently opened a Shake Shack.

Many foreigners shop here and I don't blame them. Don't be surprised when it's busy and hard to find parking. A lot of places have 50-70% off! You can find great deals here and there's lots of coupons flying around! Definitely a place I love to splurge at.

Whenever my husband and I make a trip out to Vegas, this is one place we always stop at. This is one of the nicest outlet malls that I've ever been to. They have a lot of high-end stores here, and also some that aren't. Among the stores that we love: Oakley, Michael Kors, Coach, Nike, Wilson's Leather, Ralph Lauren, and Skechers. There are definitely deals to be had. On our most recent trip, I scored a purse at Coach for $79! And my husband got a pair of custom made Oakley sunglasses for under $200. 

Keep in mind, this is a strictly outdoor mall, so it definitely feels like a desert atmosphere in the summer months. But they do have water misting fans scattered throughout that you can walk under. And the stores do a great job of staying air conditioned.

There is a huge parking structure, so there is ample parking. And they have one is one thing that should be a standard feature in all structures. Above each parking space, there is a light that indicates whether the spot is open or taken (red for taken, green for open). Why has this not become a common feature?! 

Another thing that I like about this mall is that fact that it's not overrun with kiosks like the South outlet mall is. I am not a fan of mall kiosks to begin with. Not all kiosk employees are like this, but a decent number of them jump out and yell at you like carnival barkers. "Try this new hand scrub!" "Let me clean your jewelry with this awesome cleaner made from the tears of royalty!" So, thank you for not having too many kiosks. 

I am looking forward to the next trip to Vegas (even though it hasn't been planned yet. It's not a matter of if, but when), and the next trip to this mall.

land of XL's and bad shoes. This place isn't bad, but it has too many "shoe pavilion" type stores and old man type stores like Izod or Geoffrey Beene for me. AX, D&G, FCUK, Guess, Calvin Klein, and Kenneth Cole are some of the better stores, but you still need some luck to find something thats a good deal AND your size. Found a Small AX jacket for $30 among the piles of XL's, so i'm happy.

And like someone said, it is HOT outside! i found myself hopping into one bad store after the next  just to avoid the sun - wouldnt be so bad if they were better stores. This place needs a Queer Eye makeover.

very good outlet. they had THEORY (which was disappointing!) and Tory Burch (but still kinda pricey for me)
However, I did get some stuff from BR and Kate Spade so I was happy. 
Food court needs an upgrade though, yikes!

Small location with few shops. There are pretty good deals here though. Nice quiet place to be when you want to be away from the crowd in Vegas. I really loved the employees at Coach in particular; everyone was extremely friendly and personable.

This was a great excursion from the madness of the Strip. Take the fast, clean, cheap gold-line buses from the Strip to get there. Get some sightseeing from the expansive bus windows done on the way killing two birds with one stone! 

I managed to find several great steals here and I found the prices comparable to our premium outlets back home so yayy for no Vegas premiums. They have many of the outlet mall staples including Coach, Kenneth Cole, Diesel, Burberry, Dooney & Burke, Guess, etc. Pretty extensive food court and the mall is setup out-side with plenty of little rest areas throughout. 

The only caveat is that there was few stores here that we didn't have at our Premium Outlets at home in DC so if you have one near you or you're time pressed you can skip it!

This place is HUGE! Apparently, it's one of the largest outdoor mall in the U.S. 

I've been coming here for many years and everytime I stop in I MUST check out FCUK, but it's closed down! =( So sad. I did go to the FCUK in the Fashion Show Mall, but it's just not the same.  Many top ends store here and a awesome Hookah kiosk which almost suckered me into buying a Hookah.

This rating is not based on the stores but based on the parking... Unless you're a Nevada resident you have to pay for parking. It may be only five bucks but why the fee??? Go to the other mall Primm, they have the same great stores and you don't have to pay to park.. also its indoors, you can keep cool while shopping
Outdoor outlets and it is no fun in the summer heat.  Great store selections.  Lots of good restaurants in the mall, so you don't have to drive somewhere else to eat.

I'm not a big fan of outlet malls, but I do enjoy this location from time to time. I like that outdoor aspect of this location. The worst part about this mall is the parking. I never seem to be able to find anything close and the parking structures are always a nightmare. I try to park in the uncovered parking at any cost. 

There are a few stores that I enjoy, especially the Coach, Kate Spade, Fossil and Gap outlets. I don't come here often, usually when I have friends visiting from out of town or when I'm doing some last minute holiday shopping. 

All in all, it's a pretty enjoyable shopping experience here especially during weekdays when it's less busy.

We come here almost every time, if we are staying in Vegas a few nights.  My wife can find nice gifts at bargain prices.  We hardly ever leave empty handed.  They have plenty of stores and parking.

The best time to come here is during the middle of the week when school is still in session.  There are less crowds and better deals to be found.

I would give them 5 stars, but because the outlet is outdoors I have to subtract a star.  The summers can be unbearable here.

Wow this is THE outlet mall to go to!  Everything you need they probably have.  Some of the stores had no deals so don't think you HAVE to purchase something just because it's at an outlet mall, and know you may be able to get a better deal at a regular department store or online.  That being said, I was able to find some great deals here.  This wouldn't have normally been a 5 star rating, but every employee I ran into, whether it be at a store or outside was very helpful and pleasantly courteous.  Very impressed.

Like all premium outlets, you'll need a whole day for shopping.  The plus is that the stores are located in buildings which are close to each other as opposed to being separated by roads ALA Gilroy Premium Outlets.  However, there are no Mickey Ds or Sbarros to get your burger/fry or pizza/spaghetti fix going!
